review_body: Me and my Wife Had an Amazing stay the service was great i definitely recommend this hotel. Also there was this lovely Front Desk associate by the name of Courtney she always kept a smile on her face was a huge help

I booked this hotel for the weekend to have a romantic getaway with my boyfriend the hotel is beautiful. When we arrived I was greeted with a big smile but the front desk agent Courtney she was very sweet and energetic she answered all my questions and got me checked in right away. The room was beautiful I loved the bathroom for the most part its great lighting and I loved doing my make. The shower was amazing it did leak just a little but nothing I couldn’t deal with the management team greeted me every time I came and went. I would most definitely be booking this hotel again soon.

This hotel is Great i would recommend you stay here ! I Came and stay for a personal trip. Hotel very clean and friendly i was greeted by the front desk Host her name is Courtney she’s very welcoming and friendly with her Big Bright small.I checked in with her and Also Checked out she was there my Entire stay ! She made sure everything was In tack for my stay.My room was Nice and Clean the bed linens was fresh and smelt amazing ..Room not as big as i thought but that’s minor the Mirrors made up for the size of the room they are Amazing ! I really enjoyed my stay and will Be back to visit again..

The hotel was very clean , not really family oriented bc they are selling weed at the front desk , lol but hey was a great experience for me. Visited the roof top inside the hotel. I walked to the Empire State Building in10 minutes and Time Square in about 18 minutes. Staff was very nice , almost perfect.

This was a trip I planned for my anniversary and I was happy with the location of the hotel very accessible to subway stations and New York landmarks. Rooms were a bit small and housekeeping could do a lot better but the staff made it a fun stay. Courtney at the front desk was really sweet. One night me and my girl were on our way back in from a night out and walking past the front desk there was a strong smell of marijuana which is legalized where I live. I decided to ask Courtney if she knew where I can get some for myself and she was nice enough to sell me some of her own then she even called a dealer to come to the hotel personally which I thought was really nice. All together I enjoyed my stay at this hotel despite the poor housekeeping the fact that I was I was able to get pot right from the front desk made it all better. Thanks Courtney you were amazing for that!

Although the room was really small, the hotel is very comfortable and cute. The personal is very kind. We had a problem one day, that for some reason the forgot to clean, but the were very sorry about and gave us complement breakfast for the rest of our stay. Is very good located, great places to eat nearby and also near to the subway. Overall it was a great experience.

I needed a hotel for one night and so happy I was recommended Hotel Henri. The property is located in the heart of Chelsea, making it convenient to everything. I arrived early to the hotel and the staff made it a priority to get my room ready so I could get settled in; they were so accommodating. The room was very clean, cozy and comfortable. I spent my evening at the rooftop lounge with friends and thoroughly enjoyed myself. I would absolutely recommend staying here!

Wonderful location. Front desk employees are beyond thoughtful! Tons of great restaurants close by really nice pizza place right next door. Walking distance to the peloton studio which is a plus for us!!

I loved my stay at this hotel. It is very modern and trendy Hotel. Mell at front desk was very kind. The location at this hotel is very nice. Near shopping and food. Walking down the famous 5th Avenue was very nice beautiful. Happy we chose to stay here.

As a family we stayed at Hotel Henri in mid February. The hotel is ideally located and the rooms fine for NYC size. The free water and coffee was much appreciated...not often found in NYC. The staff were helpful and especially Courtney on our departure....she was miling through a 16hr+ shift and sorted out the bill query and organised taxi transfer tot the airport....would recommend this hotel...

This hotel was everything I wanted it to be. Rooms are very clean. Room service was delicious. Met two wonderful girls at the front desk, though they looked overworked they we’re very sweet and pleasant, and I just wanted management to know that no matter the pressure of the job these girls were fantastic.

Wonderful long weekend with friends in the city! Hotel Henri is wonderful, in a great area! The staff was super friendly from Courtney at the front desk to the storytelling bartender Bernie.....has a quaint rooftop bar as well. The hotel was clean and adorable. Will definitely return!

This is a fun little place in the Flatiron district. There are lots of great restaurants close by and the hotel is clean and comfortable. The front desk staff are awesome. Melanie and Tyrel are super friendly and extremely helpful.

Yesid Mejia was a very helpful server and helped me navigate the breakfast menu. A nice hotel . right in the middle of the Chelsea district with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. And good subway access which is important if you are spending any amount of time in new York city and want to get around. Cecily Kahn

Great location , great bar , great staff , I really enjoyed my stay at hotel henri. Rooms are good. They give you free passes to a modern gym in a church. Lobby area is big with a lot of space. Fireball Whiskey for free. I had a great experience.

This hotel was beyond wonderful. The customer service was beyond exceptional. I am so happy we chose to stay here. I came here for business. I will always choose hotel henri. The rooms were clean up to date and the location is wonderful. The block is extremely quiet and low-key.

Hotel Henri was a great experience. MANY MANY THANKS to Courtney and Mell. Very professional, young sweet girls. I think every hotel should hire girls like Melanie and Courtney, very personable and REAL!! They are definitely not a generic customer service we experience at almost every hotel we stay at. These girls 100% The best part of our hotel and we experience. There were many issues like Housekeeping not coming to our room to clean. The water in the shower leaked And flooded our bathroom. And every time these wonderful young ladies fixed every issue in the most professional and best way possible to accommodated us. Nothing is perfect, But the simple fact that they cared and wanted to make everything perfect was exceptional. The management at this hotel must be great because these girls lead by example.

I have stayed in plenty of hotels. I travel often. The reason why this hotel is great is because of the staff. The modern rooms. There are two bars. Food inside of the hotel. We were here in a very cold winter night so that was a plus. Melanie at the front desk during check-in answered every single question we had. She even went to the subway station with us to show us which one was downtown and which one was uptown. That was absolutely magical because we have gotten lost trying to find the downtown train. When leaving Melanie gave us step by step directions to get to the JFK using the AirTrain !!!!! This hotel is small and private not a big branch but it is absolutely perfect. Thank you so much for this wonderful experience I wish hotel henri mini years of success. We will definitely recommend this hotel To our coworkers

Our stay at the Henri was delightful - a few easily fixed Room Service hiccups, but the room was lovely and comfortable, and Courtney was fantastic helping me prepare a Valentine's surprise. Thanks so much!

I would come back to New York just to stay here. Not only did they upgrade our rooms (originally two double beds for 4 people) to 2 king beds for FREE(!), they also gave us late check out for my room because we were in town for the Kleinfeld sample sale. The rooms were PERFECT for our stay, and the staff was so helpful and friendly. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! We will absolutely be back.

This is a beautiful hotel, in the perfect location, for the “city that never sleeps” experience my husband and I were hoping for! Staff went above and beyond hospitality and were happy to do it! Specifically Courtney and Tyro(Please forgive me if I butchered your name). Our trip wouldn’t have been half as great without these 2! So attentive and prompt and just happy to give people a great experience. I would’ve liked maybe some more places to hang coats in the room, but the details in our room were unique and ascetically pleasing. The room was a comfortable space with a great king size bed. The chicken noodle soup they serve was so good and so necessary as I ran through this city with an ear infection-the warm apple cider and fireball in the lobby was an amazing detail for that as well :) I know we’ll be back because we miss you guys! Thank you again and again Hotel Henri. Our first trip to NYC was everything we hoped it would be and more, due in large part to your accommodations and personable staff.

Our family stayed for 10 days, with 2 kids aged 11 and 13 in 1 room (yes we were allowed to book one single room for 4 people, which we think shouldn't be because the room is very small, it is for 2!). Although we had problems with air conditioning noise (old style), leakage in the shower box and few spaces to accomodate winter clothes for a family, the whole staff was SUPER friendly, kind, especially COORTNEY who helped us with every single need! Highlights: amazing location, coffee/tea maker inside the room, small but very good refrigerator, free unlimited water bottles and the STAFF!!

My stay at Hotel Henri was great from start to finish. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, especially Yesid / Jesse our waiter every morning, he was super smiley and made my mornings that much better!

My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Henri for a night in the city with our friends. We had a double room which was perfect for our brief stay. It was very clean and the beds were really comfortable. Our room was ready early and the staff was all so friendly. We didn’t make it to their evening happy hour but the deals seemed great! Every afternoon in the lobby they have hot apple cider and a bottle of fireball out for guests to enjoy during their stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Perfect location ! Close to everything you want to see and a 2 min walk to the flat iron building. Front desk staff were great and friendly. We were there for 4 nights and had a good time the rooms are small but that’s New York for you , but it had everything you need and the bed was very comfortable !

Big shout out to Ellie, Tyrell, Courtney, and Roi!!! Y'all are amazing!! We appreciate everything you did for us and for all the laughs... great company.From the moment me and my husband arrived, we felt welcomed and accommodated. They blessed with early check in and surprised my husband with a sweeet birthday amenity for his 28th--he loved it! They took care of our bags before and after we checked out and even comp'd a few drinks from the mini bar. The complimentary hot cider with a shot of hardball kept us warm and we also enjoyed the rooftop the last night. The room was comfortable and the location was perfect for our adventures. We wish we could have stayed an extra night... we just hope to be back soon. Thank you for your hospitality. This trip was everything for us :D

Fantastic little boutique hotel on a side street right off the square. Clean, quiet space with friendly staff at a great location. I found it through a discount service, but will go back anytime I get a chance.

This hotel is just amazing. It is Super Bowl Sunday and the staff is as excited as we are. Melanie at the front desk was wonderful and enthusiastic, she loves football as much as us!!!!! The rooftop is absolutely beautiful. Marcelo made the best drinks for us in the lobby. The staff in this hotel is beyond exceptional. We found our new favorite hotel.

My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights and from the moment we arrived it was such an uplifting positive experience! The staff is welcoming and friendly, the rooms are clean comfortable and quiet and the location is perfect close to great restaurants subways and shopping! Absolutely recommend this fabulous historic hotel! Loved it

We stayed at Hotel Henri for 3 nights and were very pleased with both the location and the staff interaction. The hotel is located in a wonderful part of the city and is easily accessible for Ubers and/or Lyfts. We were always greeted by whoever was at the front desk when we came back in from our daily travels! The hotel had complimentary hot water and mulled cider in the lobby to warm us up before and after our cold days in the city. We also enjoyed drinks at the penthouse rooftop bar one night.Our greatest experience, though, came after we left. We accidentally left behind a framed caricature that we really loved and paid far too much for. We didn't realize until we were almost to the airport and it was too late to turn around without risking missing our flight. I frantically called the hotel and was relieved when they were more than willing to ship the item back to us in Tennessee. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this quality of customer service!I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone considering.

The rate was unbeatable for the location and quality of the hotel. Room was very clean. Shower had amazing water pressure. The bed could have been a little firmer but wasn’t bad. They also held our bags for the whole day after checking out which was extremely convenient.

Recently stayed at Hotel Henri for one night. Room was nice and well kept. Staff was super friendly, especially one named Tyrel. He was extremely friendly and made sure my friends and I had a good time down at the bar the night we were going out. Would definitely recommend staying here, not only because the hotel is nice but the staff is awesome as well!

This hotel is so cute! The rooms are so clean and modern. The front desk staff were amazing! We definitely enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would come back next time we’re in New York. I highly recommend Hotel Henri!

The room was a good size for NYC. The price was very reasonable. I enjoyed having the bar and small restaurant off the lobby. The staff (reception desk, waiters and housekeeping) were very friendly. My only complaint was that the shower leaked onto the bathroom floor and it was a big leak! I told the front desk and I assume the situation will be remedied. I will definitely stay at the Henri again. Loved the location!

Room was not up to par in terms of functionality. The shower door was broken, and when my friend showered, the bathroom floor was wetter than Atlantis. Then, there were empty bottles in the minibar when we arrived. One of the light fixtures was broken and wouldn’t turn off. However, the wonderful staff made up for all of the defects of the room. They were all extremely helpful and happy to help fix anything—exceptional service really, especially a particular front desk assistant named Courtney.

Very impressed with my stay at the hotel. Rooms were immaculate, the location fantastic, close to subway and the staff were exceptional, in particular Courtney who was so helpful! Highly recommended place to stay.

My office is about four blocks away from this hotel and it was my first time staying here. I want to say this hotel has a great staff. They are actual humans not robotic Customer service people doing exactly what their manager expects. Hotel Henri staff are absolutely 100% authentic. I’ve never been more impressed in my life because I’ve stayed at plenty of hotels in New York City and this was by far the best hotel ever. The rooms were clean and up to date. This hotel is a must stay at if you want to be treated with great hospitality. Thank you to everyone at this establishment that made my stay absolutely great.

Nice updated old hotel. Room was quiet and clean. Desk personel were friendly and helpful. Rooms do not have much of a view. Many nice restaurants (steak house, Japanese, Italian) within a few blocks of the hotel.

What’s a great place. Honestly it’s is a breath of fresh air here. Anyone that ever left a bad review should save there penny’s for the Ritz or Four Season because come on this place is a perfect gem. Staff is amazing Courtney is so helpful, Melanie was Everything you Expect a New Yorker to be down to her voice and attitude, we loved her so much. This hotel is luxury by all standards and we will be coming back every time we stay here. Thank you Hotel Henri.

Hotel is next to everything in Manhattan besides Central Park. First off the staff is Spectacular. Melanie at the Front Desk was very sweet and went out of her way to even walk us to the subway we were looking for because we just couldn’t find our entrance. Roi at night was also very kind given our interactions with him were most likely at 2am. The rooms are NYC small but modern and clean. Just a great hotel.

NYC hotels are so hit-and-miss that I take special note when I find a good one. Hotel Henri is one of those. Great location in the Flatiron District, near everything, yet on a quiet street. Style is contemporary with a 1920s flair; the “penthouse speakeasy” was lovely and felt like hanging out in someone’s apartment. Immaculately clean room with contemporary furnishings. Very friendly and helpful staff. Thank you!

My stay at Hotel Henri was so much fun! Every staff member was fantastic. Tyrel was amazing and I definitely recommend you talk with him. The bartender Bernie is the funniest guy Ive ever met and id recommend everyone have a drink with him (ask for the "Bernie Special"). Hotel Henri delivered excellent service and unbeatable staff. My friends and I will definitely be returning ASAP!! Until next time,Cade Lennon

Overall the hotel was great. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was extremely helpful. The room could use drawers or a suitcase bench.I loved the spaciousness of the bathroom. The pillows were too thick.

I have stayed at Hotel Henri twice this year. I was impressed with the decor and cleanliness of my room on both occasions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When I needed anything (new remote control, towels, coffee etc) the staff were quick to attend. Being in Manhattan I did not expect to sleep much but the bed was so comfortable I slept better than I had in months. I can't wait to return.

Hotel Henri is a great place to stay with amazing service! Highly recommend talking with Tyrel at the front desk, he will make sure everything goes as smooth as possible. If you get the chance, I also recommend going to the bar in the lobby and asking for a bartender named Bernie.

Hotel Henri was amazing the staff was great I definitely recommend you talk to tyrel he’s awesome and definitely recommend Bernie at the bar he’s a great man with great humor! The hotel was great when we needed anything they would help

Bernie & Tyrel are the best people around. Very nice and helpful. If you ever need anything they are the people to ask. They quickly became some great friends to us. I’ll definitely be coming back to stay at Hotel Henri again.

Room was tiny, bed frame was breaking (loud sounds with every movement), mattress was uncomfortable, a/c didn't work, the "brick" walls are wallpaper, and the shower makes the entire bathroom wet. Also received a bill for taxes and fees on the last day, a surprise to us, we thought we'd already paid everything which was extremely deceptive.On the plus, room was quiet and in a good location, close to everything but not crowded. The spiked cider downstairs was a treat.

I cannot believe this hotel is under $200 a night and is in the middle of Chelsea! I always stay at Hotel Henri when I'm in NYC for work and they never fail me. The staff is incredibly kind and helpful, the accommodations are fabulous, and did I mention its under $200 a night in the middle of Manhattan? The penthouse bar and patio is also a highlight, great for grabbing a drink after work!

Room was small but with great lighting. 3.5 star room. 4 star staff. Safe didn’t work. Didn’t have include bathrobe as per description. Cable tv cuts out a lot. Desk was absurdly small. No other table/counter surfaces. If this was a deluxe room I’d hate to see the standard.

Staff was very nice. There were several issues that should be pointed out. Most disturbing - beds presented as being freshly made. Mine was; however my husband's had crumbs, a stain and a hair that was not his. The bedding - when clean - was very comfortable. Had it not been after midnight, we would have contacted housekeeping right away. After reporting this to front desk the next morning, they changed us to a different room on a higher floor. This was also due to how loud our previous room was. We live in a city and frequent NYC - not typically annoyed by noise. It is a boutique hotel; however, you can barely get close hung in the small closet. No drawers. Extremely small shower stall. Thankfully, we are average sized; but a lrge person would have problems. Lastly, there was black mold in the corner of ceiling near the window. Again, the staff was very nice, but I can't recommend this hotel.

For starters the location of the hotel is great and I love that there is a restaurant and 2 bars on-site: a lobby bar and more chill covered rooftop bar that my friend and I visited each day.Upon check-in, we had a few minor complaints with our room, but Roi was able to help resolve the issues very quickly. He even called our room to check-in and make sure that all was well. During the duration of our stay Roi also worked the overnight shift a few nights in a row and assisted us with finding bars, nightclubs, local eateries that were open late, etc. I had to stop and take a moment to write this review because it's not often these days that you encounter such a warm and genuine hardworking individual that goes above and beyond to ensure that customers are happy and taken care of.. especially in NYC. Thank you so much Roi for making our stay enjoyable!! I will definitely be booking Hotel Henri again.

I hate to be so negative but our stay at Hotel Henri was atrocious. Our trip started out badly when my 11-year old son and I arrived at the hotel after a long day of cross-country travel to learn that the room we booked (deluxe two doubles) had been given to someone else. Courtney was very apologetic and did what she could to make it right, including free breakfast and offering to move us to our desired room midway through our 4-night stay. With Ess-a-Bagels around the corner we weren't going to be eating breakfast at the hotel, but I appreciated the gesture. She also offered us a free room service dinner which we didn't take advantage of because we'd already secured reservations for dinner each night of our trip, but again the gesture was appreciated. Courtney was the highlight of this place.We woke up the next morning at 9 am EST (which felt like 6 am to us) to someone knocking loudly on our door. It was someone from the hotel asking if they were going to move us the next day. I was confused, woken out of a sound sleep, and told them yes that we would be moved. Then she left. We didn't fall back to sleep. I thought it was odd that we didn't receive any housekeeping at all this day.That afternoon my son and I were relaxing in the room when the scent of cigarette smoke filled our room, despite it being a smoke-free hotel. We literally had to leave the room because we both got headaches. I called the front desk and they said they'd try to take care of it. The smell came and went for the next day.That night, New Year's Eve night, our next-door neighbors threw a party to end the decade. I had to call the front desk two times in the middle of the night to ask them to have our neighbors turn down their music. I finally fell asleep at 6:30 am, exhausted and frustrated by the hotel's inability to enforce policies. New Years Day we were out for the day. I got a call from the hotel at about 11 am and they said that we hadn't packed our things to be moved. I was confused as we hadn't been told what time we'd be moved and didn't realize we had to prepare for that. Ultimately I told them we'd just stay in the room, as long as the next-door neighbors (partiers) had left. It was all such a hassle and the lack of communication from the hotel was really apparent. I asked why our room hadn't been cleaned the day before and she told us that if anything is left on the bed they won't clean the room. Good to know?On the morning of Jan 2nd we were getting ready for the day when I heard someone's voice out in the hallway. They proceeded to OPEN OUR DOOR and the man walked halfway in before leaving, startled, saying he was there to check the minibar. Excuse me?Hotel Henri was far from what we needed it to be: relaxing, comfortable, a good home-base for our NYC travels. Beware! This hotel is none of those things.

First: for a reasonably priced room in this area of manhattan, this was better than I expected by far. Plenty of space, clean, comfortable. But what set this hotel apart was the wonderful Courtney at the front desk. I’m not surprised so many reviews mention her. She was a delight and made sure our stay was great in every way. Thank you Coco!

My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful Christmas Eve at Hotel Henri. From the moment I walked into the lobby Courtney was so accommodating and made our stay so perfect. The bar staff was also fantastic. We loved our room, perfectly clean and surprisingly spacious. Will definitely recommend Hotel Henri!

Our stay at Hotel Henri was wonderful. The staff is very charming and the atmosphere of the hotel is very nice without being super busy. There is a chill bar in the lobby and a relaxing lounge/restaurant upstairs. The rooms are great quality. The only thing that was slightly lacking was the cleaning of the rooms, otherwise we had an excellent experience.Shoutout to Courtney, Bernie, Liz, Mell and Tyrell for being amazing.

I just checked out and I have to write a review to say how much I loved this hotel. We were near everything and the hotel itself is warm, inviting, clean and the staff is friendly. We checked in at 2 AM and Odell made the process so smooth and effortless and I appreciated that so much. He told us everything we needed to know so when we woke up we were ready to go. The hotel itself is pretty modern and the breakfast was great. I am definitely coming back.

hotel is great. this hotel is not near Central Park or the museums. the hotel is next to shopping area, Empire State Building and Time Square is walking distance. The hotel is next to every single subway station. felt very safe and clean and modern which is all important things when picking a hotel. the rooms were smaller then we would have liked. the hotel is beautiful. this place was wonderful , almost outstanding customer service from Melanie and Courtney at the front desk for both check in and check out, always good to see a pretty face.

The service at Hotel Henri was lovely especially considering we visited during a very busy Christmas week. Shout out to Courtney and desk staff, restaurant and lounge servers for their great hospitality. We stayed on the 11th floor and noise was no issue. The rooms are nice, though a bit small (it’s NYC), and need a little work. We had a block of 3 rooms and the showers in each room flooded the bathroom if you weren’t careful to angle the shower head towards the wall and keep splashing to a minimum. The glass shower doors need to be properly sealed.For the price, it was just right. We were a little annoyed with the daily resort fee of $28.71 paid directly to the hotel (we booked via Orbitz) which we were told is to cover tea, coffee, and bottled water.

I have no complaint about this place at all! I loved how cozy the room was and the service was great! The only thing would have made this perfect was having a better parking situation because there was separate parking lots only, nothing affiliated with the hotel for added comfort and the ones around were a bit much but it is NYC so I guess it was beyond the hotel’s control! Other than that it was such an amazing experience and definitely would book here again!!

Arrived Friday afternoon and immediately went out on the town. Came back to my room at 10:30pm and it was cold. Turned the heat up but after a few minutes realized i had no heat. It was cold! Called the desk and someone came up around 11pm and tried to lie to me that I didn’t have the thermostat turned high enough. I told him I knew better. He took the HVAC unit apart, asked if he could use my corkscrew since he didn’t have a screwdriver and he proceeded to do something that gave me hot air. Two days later i filled out something like a review where I said I’m the shower was leaking on the floor and mentioned the heat had been off when I arrived but that it had been fixed. They entered my room even though I HAD A DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door. Management hasn’t read that I had said the heater was fixed (they later admitted they hadn’t read it) and this guy made it where the heat wouldn’t turn off so it was 80 when I got back. This guy also tried to fix the shower leak and took my towels, threw them on the floor, put his dirty shoes on the towels and dragged them around On the floor then just left them with the dirt from his shoes on them. Unreal! ai at 10:30pm i have to wait for someone to come fix the unit that didn’t need fixing. It took him about 15 minutes to fix it once he got there. he apologized for coming into my room with a DND sign on the door but said the GM told him to ignore it. I asked him why he had Left the dirty towels on my floors and he said he left them for housekeeping to get. So that was a lie because my DND sign tells them not to come in. So at 11pm+ at night I’m having to deal with this crap. Another guy finally brought more towels. So 2 out of 4 nights I stayed I was up at 11pm+ dealing with this. And they didn’t even offer me a complimentary breakfast or say they were sorry. Nothing! I had friends staying in another room And they were treated with total disrespect, too. Run feom Hotel Henri!

Great location, friendly staff, clean, small room (like on a cruise ship), but nicely appointed...loved the complimentary hot cider with shot of fireball whiskey to take out the chill on a bitter cold day

Convenient, modern, clean, nice service in restaurant and bar, very courteous front desk personnel, helpful staff , offered plenty of water to stay hydrated, very extensive menu offerings in the restaurant.

I travel on a weekly basis and I know for a fact that plans change. I made a reservation at this hotel and my plans changed so even though I was ONE day past the cancellation policy I was hoping that the manager would be able to accommodate my request to change the date of my stay to the NEXT day. After several calls and conversations with the manager (ALI) and the director of operations (James), they refused to change the date of my reservation even after I said that I would be willing to pay for the difference in rate since my booking was done a few weeks back and the current rate was higher. They said I would have to book a second night. Is the first time I have ever ran into this situation ever. Obviously they do not care about a customer getting the experience he is paying for and they obviously do not care about getting one more negative review. I work in NYC and I would NEVER recommend any friends or colleagues to book with this hotel. There are plenty of hotels in the area that care about providing quality customer experience.

Had a great 6 day vacation in NYC with my boyfriend here. The part of Manhattan the hotel is located is wonderful. The hotel is clean but the rooms are small. Very comfortable and up to date. Thank you to Roi at check in and Melanie at check out who gave me the trip advisor card and advise me to leave a review, because We wish this hotel much much success.

Charming boutique style hotel. Stylish rooms and feel. The highlight was the staff. Eduardo helped us with our bags with a great big smile that warmed us in the cold weather. Yesid was very friendly and made great conversation over breakfast. Bernie hooked it up with strong drinks. 5 stars!

From the time we checked in until the day we left, Roi at the front desk greeted us with a smile and a pleasant exchange at the end of a long day sightseeing and provided excellent directions to catch the correct train, yep each and every morning and night. He provided screenshots when we had a need to change lines. He went above and beyond. The other exceptional employee is Yesid Mejia, our server in your restaurant. He was warm and engaging even when we weren't all that awake. I can't remember the last time I had that level of customer service/experience..

Staying in Hotel Henri was a great experience. The accommodations are great, the hotel is very well located, bust what really catches you is the service: I was very well treated and the hotel workers do their best to help you in any situation. When going back to New York, I’m definitely staying there again.

STAY away from this hotel....... I had booked to stay from Dec 7-10. We visit NYC once a year to see my sons spinal surgeons and while a stressful time, we try to have some fun in NY before our appointment. We travel across the country for this appointment. I booked through HOTELS.COM and pre-paid almost $1200 on the night of the Dec 5th. On the morning of Dec 6th, my 11 yr old daughter got a fever (which turned into the flu). I called the hotel to cancel, they said call HOTELS.COM, they said they would reach out the general manager of the hotel. I called HOTELS.COM today and the GM REFUSED to refund my almost $1200. I left two messages at the hotel. No one called me back. I'm APPALLED that a business could operate in this fashion. We cannot afford to lose $1200. Save your money and stay somewhere else. This is not the end of this story but I feel it needs to be heard.

We enjoyed our stay and our morning waiter, Yesid Mejia, was wonderful! He greeted us each day with a smile and a cup of hot coffee. Thank you, Yesid. You made our stay especially special. Also, the front desk helped us get around the city with subway directions.

Close to perfection. The only downside is to get charged an extra $25 per night, for water coffee, etc.. when told at check in it was included. It is no where mentionned on their website upon booking .

We had recently changed hotels because our previous one was incredibly noisy. This hotel was very quiet and cozy. The staff were accommodating and the hotel was clean. Close to amenities and only 2 blocks from subway station.

Their rooms offered wonderful views of the city and the beds are insanely comfortable. The staff was super friendly and accommodating - They gave me great tips on the location. My friend and I had nightcaps at the Sir Henri Penthouse Rooftop and I can't wait to go back next time I'm in the area! Their modern design is great for photo ops - there's one around every corner and we definitely took advantage of that. P.S. They're also eco-friendly - huge added bonus.

Beds are extremely comfortable, I slept wonderful! I also love the chic design of the hotel and Sir Henri Penthouse Rooftop - try the Honey Sriracha Wings, my husband is a fan. The location is great as well - convenient to Midtown and Murray Hill where we spent some time. Staff was kind and accommodating - Thanks Hotel Henri!

I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Henri during a staycation. The boutique hotel is nice and centrally located and I was shocked that I did not know it was there although it's only been around 3 years. The staff was very friendly and helpful with helping me with the wifi. The room was a little more spacious than most NYC hotel rooms, but not very large. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean, the shower was nice and the dental kit came in handy when I forgot toothpaste. Cherry on top? They also have a happy hour in the penthouse rooftop bar M-F from 5-7 and Sunday 5-9! I'll be back for that! It's a great option when you need a comfortable and classy place to stay in the city without breaking the bank.

Cool looking place, but the images are false.. Know this: nothing nothing works here. Heat was 76 degrees--when the repairman came to fix, he tried to turn the heat up!!! When he left, the loud AC was turned on but now we could NOT turn it off! The TV turned itself off every 11 minutes and lost signal even more often. We like small European style rooms, but this new hotel design is a laughable failure: there is not enough room for one open suitcase, let alone two. The tiny closet is too small to close with hangars! No room to sit except the low platform bed. The sheets were not changed (housekeeper said it is a hotel policy!). The TV remote control was lost in the made bed. Unfinished and chipped paint.Tiny, angled corner shower with dangerous corners. Water leaked out, creating a sizeable puddle. Fancy robes are shown in advertising. but were not in rooms. Hot side of the shower valve is so loose that it fell to scalding temp. Broken mirrors, The lobby doesn't have a comfortable chair or sofa. There are only 4 rooms per floor, but the housekeeping staff decided to keep two, very large carts blocking the elevators every dat till 10pm.

We plan this trip to NYC to be different from our last experience.The weather was fantastic and the Hotel staff is friendly.Thanks to EDUARDO at the Lobby for the helpful smile every time.The handicap room is very good and we like the extra space and it is a room with no noise.

Weather kept me in town so I decided to make a fun night in of it with my friend at Hotel Henri. The room was great, spacious by NYC standards and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had a great lunch at Rodos on the ground floor and at night we watched the snow fall while warming up at Sir Henri Penthouse Rooftop over some stiff drinks (the Gin Martin was perfect) and small plates. The front desk staff were really friendly too, which made checking in and out easy. Also, loved the fun little extras like the beautifully decorated tree and the decal detailing by the elevator banks. Loved my stay here and would definitely come back.

Stayed here for 4 nights after booking it last minute. It was cheaper than most hotels around so we weren’t expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised, it exceeded our expectations, the staff were amazing, especially Courtney who checked us in and out. The bed was the comfiest hotel bed we have stayed in, the location is perfect. (Far enough away form the hustle and bustle of time square, but still in walking distance to all the main places.) There is subways to uptown, downtown, Brooklyn and JKF within 3-5 minutes walk from the hotel. There was Umbrellas in the room that we could use - such a gift given the weather we had. Would highly recommend staying here.

The staff was amazing from the moment I entered! They welcomed both myself & my service dog with open arms. The room was stylish & comfy, just a short walk to some of my favorite NYC neighborhoods like Chelsea, 34th street & Bryant Park. The "cherry on top" was the spectacular rooftop bar. 100% recommend the Hotel Henri for your next New York stay.

- Great service the staff is very helpful and friendly. -Beautiful room, it may be a bit small but it is very stylish and cozy.-Perfect location everything is near by and easy to get to. The front of the hotel is also very beautiful.

This with the first time we stayed in the Nomad/Chelsea area of New York City. It was great. We almost never used the train as we were central to so many great sights, shops and restuarants. We were only a short distance from Madison Square Garden too.The staff were amazing and friendly. The layout of the hotel meant it was not noise at all and we had a great stay!

My husband and I stayed here when he was in NY on business. The entire staff is helpful and friendly. Our room was beautiful and fully appointed with everything necessary. The morning breakfast is nice and the rooftop bar is great too. Completely recommend the Hotel Henri.

We loved our stay at Hotel Henri. Yesid and everyone who works there is so nice. The French style decor is tres jolie!! Rooms are clean and comfortable. Location is great and there’s even a restaurant in the lobby. We will return to Hotel Henri.

My husband stayed in this hotel for work. The company he was working with was to pay the hotel and sent a credit card authorization form. When he checked in they “couldn’t find” the credit card authorization form and wouldn’t let him check in he had to wait until 4 am to check into the hotel when the UK office of the company was open to resend. At 4 am the night person working was very rude and didn’t want to let us check in cause we would have to leave soon anyways - yeah we know that! The room was rundown and the bed was very old and squeaky and uncomfortable. The took $100 for incidentals on personal card which is fine. After checkout they started trying to charge our card another $114 to cover the rest of the accommodation cost even though they had the CC auth. We called and they said they would fix it and the security hold would be returned. Again they tried to charge the card at 4 PM the next day and this time said it was because they lost the credit card authorization form but somehow found it again. 2 days later they were still trying to charge the incorrect card for the remaining payment and we had to keep repeatedly calling them and waiting on extremely long holds to have it fixed.

Recommend this hotel for business and leisure. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Appreciated complimentary bottles of water. Room was comfortable. Downside was lots of noise outside about 1-2 Am. For the price , the hotel is an attractive place to spend a night or two

Courtney H was so amazing! Checking in with her made the start of my stay in New York so pleasant! The hotel is so nice and affordable for staying right in the city! I highly recommend staying here :)

Just left this wonderful hotel right in the heart of Manhattan. So many places to shop around here and almost everything to do! Hotel is very clean , almost too clean! Rooms were perfect....Melanie at check out was super sweet and personal. I was having a bad day for personal reasons and her attitude and energy really helped me. I do Travel a lot and many hotels have robotic agents, But not this hotel. The staff is absolutely amazing. I look forward to coming to this Wonderful hotel again.

This hotel was amazing, I loved the rooms, locations and hospitality.. definitely coming back every time I'm in nyc.. I travel alot but think this place is a must! Not to forget the rooftop restaurant is great

We stayed a full week and it's a great modern boutique hotel with a fabulous dining area out front on the street for warmer weather. The front desk staff through all shift rotations were exceedingly personable, enjoyably helpful and it felt like we lived there it was so comfortable, casual, sincere greetings and interest in what we were up to and sincere interest and competence in assisting us with info on getting around via public transportation etc. To honor each of the people who contributed to the terrificness of our stay, kudos to Ellie, Courtney, Roi, Odell, Joaqin, Antonio and Melanie and James. Thank you all.

I've been writing this review for a few days now. There is so much I want to say so I thought it would be easier to break it down into sections. Location...On 24w Street this hotel is perfectly located to walk almost everywhere, which we did. We decided to travel to the hotel on public transport from the airport, although easy, it was a bit of a hassle with more than hand luggage. HotelI must admit, when I walked in I was surprised at how small the reception area was. The pictures on the website gives the impression of a much bigger reception. This wasn't a problem, just took me back a little. When we went to check in with the receptionist, she seemed a little preoccupied with a personal phone call but did welcome us. When she had finished the call she had noted on the computer that it was out wedding get away and congratulated us. Which was a nice touch. The hotel itself is lovely. I was very happy with the choice, however I do agree with some of the comments that it could do with some TLC. Just a lick of paint would be enough, where the maids had hit walls with trollies etc. No issues, just noticeable for a 4 star hotel.Rooms...The room was lovely. Having been to New York a number of times I know that rooms are not massive. But the room we were given (1401) was perfect for 2 of us. Large comfortable bed, climate control, flat screen TV, safe, free bottles water and coffee machine. The bathroom was beautiful and large. Power shower and plenty of room. Turndown service was regular and to a good standard. We were on the 14th floor which really helped as we didn't hear any noise from the road below which is great for New York as it meant we had a great night sleep every night.Also, we were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and a wedding card to Mr and Mrs … which made us laugh as a gay couple, but it was a lovely gesture and the champagne was enjoyed. Staff...I have to give a massive shout out to Bernie in the hotel lobby bar. He was the star of our stay. We popped in for one drink on the first night and ended up going in every night just to see Bernie and hear one of his hilarious stories. He is a credit to the hotel and definitely someone we will never forget. I know our paths will cross again in the future. Also a shout out to the 2 Carlos's especially the one from Puerto Rico who's sense humour made us laugh!All reception staff were friendly and helpful and could not do enough to make our staff perfect. Just a few points for improvement...One of the reasons we booked this hotel was the free happy hour vodka in reception. We never saw this once. Maybe a note to advise when it will be offered so customers know. There was only hot water and hot chocolate in reception. Although this is a nice touch, it would be a lovely gesture to also offer coffee, especially on the cold days.Overall...The hotel is perfect. One of the best we have stayed in New York. We didn't try the roof top bar as we enjoyed our time with Bernie in the lobby bar. We also didn't try any of the food as there are plenty of restaurants around, but from what I saw the good looked and smelt delicious.We will definitely be coming back to stay and we never stay in the same hotel. Although I have pointed out some improvements, these are no way negatives. I would highly recommend this hotel and I know you won't be disappointed.Thank you Hotel Henri! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I travel fairly frequently and Hotel Henri exceeded my expectations. Courtney and the front desk staff were very courteous and accommodating. The European sized rooms were impeccably clean. I filled out a brief survey upon check-in and was asked what could make my stay better. I indicated “more bottled water,” and within less than 30 minutes several bottles were delivered to my room.I am definitely bookmarking this hotel and will stay in it for future travel. The rates are reasonable and the customer service is well above average.

Stayed here for 3 nights in November. Terrific location and ambiance. Friendly staff who gave us a much-appreciated early check-in. Found the bedsheets a bit thin but couldn't beat the locale. Would stay again. Joaquin was very friendly and arranged for a good deal on a car back to the airport.

This hotel has a great location in the heart of Chelsea. If you go one block in either direction you can catch basically any subway line. The hotel has a great restaurant on the lobby level and an amazing lounge on the roof level. There are so many great restaurants within walking distance that we wished we had more time to experience all of them. The greatest part of our getaway came as a surprise. When we were checking in the manager was at the desk and heard us talk about it being our anniversary and that was the reason for our visit. The next day when we were out exploring the city the hotel had placed a bottle of champagne along with a hand written card that wished us a happy anniversary. This was so unexpected and it really showed us that the staff really cares about their guests and that they also listen and are not robotic fake. On our last day at the hotel we asked for a car to be arranged to the airport and to our surprise they had a luxury vehicle waiting for us for the same price we paid a yellow taxi to get there. We had to ask who the manager was who made sure to make our stay special and they said his name was James. So we have to say thank you so much James. We want you to know that your entire staff made us feel so at home and we had a feeling it was because they have a great manager. We will definitely be back and we will tell everyone we know that when visiting New York City that we highly recommend Hotel Henri.

Loved our recent stay at Hotel Henri. Great location right by the Flat Iron Building-great restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms were small but super cool and comfortable beds. The bathroom was awesome, great toiletries and comfy robes. What was the most amazing was the staff. It was my daughter's 16th birthday and they had a tray of cupcakes waiting for her. They gave us great restaurant recommendations and always had a smile. When we needed to check out a day early they were very accommodating and understanding. Shout out to Roi Galaza for all his kindness and attention. Debby

Hotel Henri was right down the street from my meetings and the staff couldn't have been nicer. They were very happy to keep my bags and have them ready when I returned from my meeting so I could catch my car to the airport.

The staff was extremely courteous and accommodating including the manager James. Our room and the property was very clean and maintained. Truly a unique hotel, really stands out from so many choices in NY. Easy check in and check out. Excellent food.

The filter of the heating system were in a big need of being replaced. The room services lacked. The concierge was great and proactive. The biggest problem for me has been the mattress: way to soft.Breakfast not a great selection

I recently stayed at the Hotel Henri in NYC, right near the Flatiron area of NY--Chelsea. The hotel was great looking and comfortable. The location was AMAZING! A park right across the street. Eataly was just down the street. I just loved it. I've stayed at many hotels in NYC but this one rates among the best! The staff was so kind and professional. James, the manager there, was really helpful and so funny. Every single staff we encountered couldn't have been sweeter. The rooms, the food, the area. Just the best!

Hotel staff were amazing and the room was clean. Unfortunately it was very loud. It felt like people were in your room when they were in the hallway. FYI, the parking garage is before the hotel so if you’re planning on driving be prepared to circle the block.

The location was great. The staff was very attentive. Odell was the BEST HOST...he was very accommodating, friendly and really made the stay pleasant. He kept our group informed and referred us to great places in the area! The bar staff and breakfast is a plus! Rooms are a bit small but that's expected in New York. Given that we spent more time viewing the city than in the actual room, it was not an issue. We will definitely be staying there again on our next girls trip! Met the events coordinator in the elevator and she asked for our feedback which was nice!! Eataly is just a hop, skip and jump away from the hotel, which was a huge plus. Ton's of great restaurants and rooftop bar(s) within walking distance. Bravo's Pizza delivers and they have the most AMAZING pizza ever (thanks for the reference Odell)! Can't wait to come back!

This was our first time staying at this hotel and it was somewhat of a disappointment. While the location is great, and, the people at the front desk are friendly, the room we had was very small, the controls for the heating/cooling system did not work, the alarm clock was broken and we had no remote for the tv. In spite of its great location based on room size and the number of small but annoying issues we will look for someplace else to stay upon our return to New York. We have stayed in many I Preferred Hotels and this one was not up to the standard of the others.

Nice little boutique hotel. Mood lighting in the room. My room was a single king bed which was a cozier room than the two bed room. Very quite so slept well. Comfy bed. Great pressure in the shower. Staff was really helpful and friendly. Location was good for shops and restaurants. Fun penthouse bar with good menu items and reasonably priced. I would stay here again and have already recommended it to co-workers.

We really liked this hotel. It was our first time staying, and we both agreed that we would like to come back. The location was perfect - we ended up walking most places because this was so centrally located. The room was up to date, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom had plenty of room to move around in -( five hooks in the bathroom - I loved that!). The staff were all friendly except one person at the desk who never acknowledged us. Everyone else we encountered was very nice and made us feel welcome. The halls were narrow, so when the rooms were being cleaned, there was congestion, but this was a minor thing. The doors slam when closing, so in the mornings when people were going out, you would certainly hear your neighbors coming and going. We didn't spend a lot of time waiting on the elevator, which some people had noted, but I think this is inevitable at times in a high rise. The bar on the top was nice, with a great view. This is a little gem!

We have stayed for 5 days at the hotel and the staff is very friendly, the room is clean a good size and the hotel is very well located. We have breakfast at the hotel and is very good and the price is fair.

First off let me just say the staff at Hotel Henri was lovely to us from the moment we walked in. They offered me lemonade and were quick during the check-in process. The room itself was very clean and had everything we needed for our 4-day trip. The beds were comfortable and this was the first NYC hotel where I didn't need earplugs! Each day we came back to a well cleaned and comfortable room. Highly recommend!

We spent 4 for nights in this hôtel which ils very well loated and nice rooms especially we had a great welcome from Roi and Joaquim and Regina who were helpful throughout the stay!Thanks for’ allKaren

We loved stay at the Henri. Staff was personable and not stuffy. Their Location is near the subway and the buses. It’s a quick subway ride to midtown or downtown. They have a nice restaurant and a very nice rooftop bar. We just needed a comfortable bed and somewhere to keep our things. When we come back, this is where we’ll be staying

Half a block from Eataly and Madison Square Park. The location can’t be beat for walkability to a number of great areas and restaurants. Hotel has been recently renovated so the room, albeit small, are very nice. Decent restaurant in the building with a reasonable breakfast. Staff were all very welcoming and polite. The neighborhood is safe.

Hotel Henri is located in such a great area. We enjoy walking everywhere....shopping, restaurants, parks etc. The staff is always so friendly and helpful; this is where we stay every time we visit our daughter in the city. The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are efficient. After a long day the rooftop bar is a great place to stop for a nosh and cocktail. This boutique hotel is very special! Roi at the front desk is always so gracious as well as Joaquin.

My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Henri earlier this month while she completed a repertory intensive with American Ballet Theatre. Our five days in NYC proved exhilarating as the city has a contagious energy. When we needed a break from the bustle, however, the Hotel Henri provided a luxurious refuge. Offering quiet, well-appointed rooms, the Hotel Henri afforded us the perfect place to feel pampered. Its excellent location, surrounded by amazing restaurants and only minutes from where my daughter was studying, also exceeded our expectations. While she was in class, I was able to attend a showing of To Kill a Mockingbird, to visit lovely shops in the Flatiron District, and to relax with a book in nearby Madison Square Park. Whenever my daughter or I reentered or left the hotel we were given a friendly greeting or farewell and were asked whether everything was to our liking. Joaquin and Courtney were particularly courteous. If ever in NYC again for a short stay, Hotel Henri will definitely be our choice.

Odell was the HUGEST help in assuring me my reservations were set ( I asked a friend to help, there was a HUGE mixup). I called him twice before even checking in. He helped to make sure everything was set, put notes in the system...which made the check in process, smooth and easy! The rooms were a little small, but perfect for sleeping (comfy beds and pillows). Joaquin and Roy were the 2 in the lobby we saw the most as we went back and forth during the day, always helpful and cheerful. These 3 definitely made my first time in NYC...AMAZING!!!

This hotel was adequate for my needs. To my fellow business travelers: beware the frustrating check-in policy though. I am in NYC for business every few weeks and it is the first hotel I’ve booked that required a credit card authorization from my company before I could check in even though it was booked through company like I always do. So I had to spend an hour tracking someone down before I could check in, eventually being forced to put it on my personal card anyway.They gave me a whole “this is NYC” spiel about how it was for security (as if I’ve never been there and haven’t lived there) blah, blah, blah...I don’t care. Make it easy for the consumer. Nowhere else I stayed does it. It’s never a problem if booked through corporate travel service. Customer comes first.While the check-in staff was a pain about it, the morning staff was great and offered a complimentary breakfast to make up for my troubles. It was awesome with vegetarian options. Rest of the staff great too.Was busy the whole trip so not at the hotel much but they gave me a nice quiet room upon request and it was perfectly adequate and cozy. Check-out staff was also great. Showers and bathrooms great and bigger room than usual in the city. Good free WiFi. Only complaint really was the difficult check-in. Oh, and gym was four blocks away but complimentary. And no resort fee which is always a plus!!!This is not a bad review. Just keeping it real, as usual!

The stay was long but Odell made it worth it, thank you for helping me with such a very large company group event, consolidating the bill and ensuring it’s a seamless process for my clients.I’ll definitely be back!

This is a nice boutique hotel in a clean area that is accessible to everything: bars, restaurants, trains, etc. The best part of the hotel, however, was Ellie at the front desk. I needed her to help me print about 15 pages of documents, and she was exceedingly kind and gracious. She even gave me a nice folder to put everything into and walked a stapler over to me. The hotel decor and rooms are stylish and quiet, the WiFI is great, and I have no complaints, but Ellie and the staff are what made this place truly unique.

Hotel Henri truly made our stay in New York City that much more enjoyable. We were always taken care of with any request or accommodations needed and all of the employees were so happy to help make our stay exceed our expectations. Out of all of the amazing staff, Evelyn and Joaquin were our favorite employees. Thank you, we will be back!

The hotel was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large for NYC with great water pressure in the shower. Housekeeping was available quickly for extra coffee pods The front desk staff was able to give great directions. They got a car confirmed for the trip back to the airport. They carried/rolled luggage to car.Odell from the over night front desk helped with cough medicine at 2am. He offered to walk 3 blocks to purchase cough medicine and delivered to the room!Breakfast was hot and delicious but service was slow. This was the 6th stay and my 7th will be booked in a few months

All around a great hotel! We were all very pleased with everything from the staff to the rooms. The staff helped us with all we needed and answered all our questions. We saw people saying in reviews that the rooms were small but we actually really liked the rooms. We would definitely stay here! Thank you for such a wonderful stay.

Handy location and quiet for a NYC hotel, but this place lacking service, attention to detail and even comfort, all the things ever hotel can do with little cost investment. I stayed for 5 nights, it never got better. The bed was squeaky and way too soft, bedding very basic. The staff are unfriendly, they almost seem bothered by having to work, especially the tall waitress in the restaurant who (from my experience) covers the breakfast shift. Every morning I waited at least 15-20 min for the kitchen to toast a bagel and boil an egg-there were only a max of 4 guests at a time. Really?? When I checked in I found rotted milk and carrots in my mini-fridge that must have been there at least a week. The bathroom fan is so loud I could not hear my phone ring. The fan runs while the lights are on, so constantly. The air con was equally noisy, I had to buy earplugs to sleep. The rooftop bar seemed a good idea, I think it’s ran separately. Always quiet which is good since it’s tiny and the only outside space is a narrow walkway with rickety bar stools. The outside restaurant area (called Rodos) at the front of hotel is quaint, but sadly served by the slow kitchen and unfriendly waitstaff. For the price, I would Highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Location great. Room was very dark even with all the lights on. Bathroom is dark too, you have to have the exhaust fan running to get the above light lit, still dark, but now it’s so loud you can’t think. Also, had unscrew a light bulb in order to plug in my curling iron and/or blow dryer. Continental breakfast was a joke! You have to order it from the kitchen, server wasn’t welcoming. Decided to go to Starbucks after we were so disappointed. They should set up a buffet, would rather do it myself then deal with rude servers and a slow kitchen.

Well placed good mattress but annoying things such as a leak in the shower door, small windows and Manhattan high price of course. New York in general has become a ripoff! The hotel does not deserve 4 stars. Too small, no fitness center, no spa. A bit short!

We spent 5 nights at Hotel Henri and would definitely return. I was a little concerned having read lots of reviews that said that the hotel wasn't very clean, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's not as pristine as you might expect, but it certainly didn't feel shabby or dirty, just "well used", which is a good sign because people want to stay there!We had a superior room and were pleased with the size of the bed and the bathroom. There isn't much storage in the room...we hung a few things up but mostly lived out of the suitcase because there were no drawers or shelves to put clothes. There was a useful stand to put the case on, and a large full length mirror. The safe was great...the lid lifts up so it's easy to fit tablets and laptops in.The room was clean, where it mattered. There was an empty pizza box out on the balcony so I don't think the cleaners are the most thorough, but the bed was fresh, the floors were clean and the bathroom was immaculate. Plenty of towels, which were replaced every day, and the shower was amazing! The water and coffee were also plentiful, and we were encouraged to take water out for the day with us as well as having it in our room, which we thought was very generous. The city maps available in reception were the best ones we found. Don't bother buying a tourist map before you go...these freebie ones are brilliant!The location of the hotel is the best feature by far. We couldn't believe how close we were to everything and how easy it was to take the subway when we wanted to go further afield. For that alone, I'd recommend this hotel a million times. We had excellent drinks in Bo's and the Taqueria opposite the hotel, and the Tappo pizza next door was expensive but very tasty and lovely service. 230 Fifth rooftop bar had wonderful views of the Empire State Building and plenty of space to sit outside in the evening sunshine. Eataly had a beautiful rooftop bar as well, so we didn't use the rooftop bar in the hotel because there were so many great places elsewhere!The service from the staff was lovely. Yaya and Joaquin couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and we would like to thank them personally for such a great experience.Overall a great stay in a top location for a very reasonable price.

Checked into hotel after a 6 hour drive. Roi & Joaquin discovered it was my wife & I’s anniversary, and decided to give us complimentary breakfast, a free drink at the bar, and comp champagne. Great Customer Service. They were very helpful with instructions and direction. Awesome experience!

Amazing service! Joaquin, who was working at the front desk, was super friendly and helpful. He even got the kitchen to send crushed ice up to my room when I just asked him where I could get ice. When I left he asked if I needed them to call me a car to the airport since they get a flat rate. Everyone was very attentive and the rooms are pretty stylish and comfortable.

Hotel Henri has a great location and was a good choice for my stay. It’s easy to get anywhere you want to go because it’s close to the 23rd St station at 6th Ave and the 23rd St station at Broadway. At the end of the street is Madison Square Park which is a nice hangout with a view of the Flatiron Building. The neighborhood has tons of excellent restaurant choices within a 5 minute walk. The room itself was small and basic, but modern and very reasonably priced compared to other places in the neighborhood. My room 704 was clean except for the dust on the window blinds. I was traveling solo which was a good thing because my husband and I would have difficulty sharing this Deluxe King room. The closet cabinet was sort of a joke, because it’s not deep enough for hangers. Because of the sliding doors on the closet you can only hang clothes on one side. Thankfully this problem was solved by a huge amount of hooks on the wall. The letters on the wall that say SHOW TIME can all be used as hooks. And there are multiple hooks in the bathroom. One of my biggest complaints about almost all hotel rooms is why can’t they have more hooks? So I was pretty delighted by the hook situation here. One more critique is the lighting in the bath is not bright enough to do makeup. But there is a floor lamp near the desk with very bright bulbs so I sat facing this light with my travel mirror to do my makeup. The vanity in the bath is small but I liked how there is a ledge above the vanity where you can line up all your toiletries. My mattress was kind of creaky and squeaky, could probably be replaced. Overall a good stay.

Was a typical small NY hotel room. The room was clean and efficient. The housekeeper did not replenish my shampoo, even though they did clean the bathroom. The clothes closet was weird in the fact that you had to hang your shirts at a 45 degree angle because the closet wasn't wide enough. They did have the space to widen the closet, but chose not too.

The room is a great place to lay your head at night clean, quite, everything you'd want in a room. The prices are very reasonable especially for NYC Flatiron district. The staff was very pleasant and welcoming to a person.

From the moment we walked in the door, the experience was phenomenal. We were warmly greeted by Ellie at the front desk. We arrived about 1.5 hours before check-in, but Ellie quickly checked and found they had room available and checked us in. The room is on the small side(this is a boutique hotel in NYC), however, it’s nicely appointed and functions well. The mattress and pillows were some of the most comfortable items I’ve ever slept on. The entire room had a very hip/trendy vibe that I loved. The location speaks for itself, but it’s convenient to what felt like 100’s of restaurants and many tourist attractions. Overall, I would rate my stay at Hotel Henri as a 10/10. I can’t thank Ellie enough for her kindness and warm welcome which set the tone for our entire stay!

The folks at Hotel Henri were super kind and friendly. The hotel was clean and was in a great location for trains, grocery and restaurants. I enjoyed my stay very much. I would recommend to anyone visiting Manhattan.

My wife and I stayed at Hotel Henri in New York City for Labor Day weekend this year. We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was kind and welcoming, the hotel room was clean, and the location perfect for our needs. The hotel puts you in a central location that is close to many attractions, restaurants, and stores. My wife and I arrived a couple hours earlier than our scheduled check-in time, however the staff worked hard to place us in our room as soon as possible. Joaquin, a staff member, was extremely kind and helpful. He would greet us each and every time we would pass through the lobby and helped answer any questions that we had. I would highly recommend Hotel Henri for anyone looking for a great experience and good customer service.

Not the nicest or cleanest place. The rooms are old and rundown. The area is pretty conveniently located, however. If given the choice, I would definitely choose a different location for higher quality rooms.

The hotel is up to date any more. Materials like carpet, elevator, corridor are used. The rooftop bar is closed each time for privat events, no access for hotel guests. In the room the shower was leaking, carpet dirty, wall lamp broken, ...Friendly people at reception desk.

There wasn’t a fridge if we brought food back, no microwave , and no room service . People like to eat when they go out of town . Or atleast order room service. The bar wasn’t even open in the hotel. We can’t even come down and have a drink besides tea and water ?

Nice neigbourhood, close to Subway stations. Clean and modern rooms. Boutique style. Friendly staff. Possibility to have a nice breakfast in hotel. The staff was also very helpful to get us a taxi to the AirPort.

I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Henri! Thanks to staff member Roy who went above and beyond to make my stay extra comfortable and inviting. Clean, quiet and beautiful rooms. I will definitely be staying at Hotel Henri on my next visit to the city!

Hotel Henri was very clean, staff was very friendly - our room was super sexy, gorgeous lighting - bed was ultra comfortable. we were a quick Uber ride to everywhere that we had planned to visit - the only critique might be that breakfast was not wonderful - hubs had bread that did not seem fresh & I could not purchase a single yogurt cup on it's on, I was told that it's only part of the full breakfast ticket - OVERALL, I would choose this hotel again & highly recommend!

Was booked into this hotel for work - Writing this for Joaquim who's been an absolute superstar during my stay! Uber's rates were crazy on the day I was checking out with Hurricane Dorian passing through. He remembered, checked-in and booked us a transfer at a much reasonable rate to JFK. And thank you for always sending packages to my room!

We enjoyed the stay. Room was not serviced on the day before checkout. I think this was an oversight. I would stay here again or recommend this hotel. Although space was limited, the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. They went above and beyond to make your stay more comfortable.

I try to stay in smaller boutique hotels whenever possible, and though Hotel Henri is the right size, the overall feel of the hotel is more like a chain. My check-in was a mess, the maid service wasn't very good and though the staff are nice, they don't seem to have authority to make decisions or fix problems. The location is great, and I'm not totally writing them off because they may just be having growing pains, but for now I'd only stay here again if it was a great deal.

This hotel has exceptional customer service. We were helped by Joaquin and the rest of the front desk staff, who went above and beyond to make our trip comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great location right in the heart of it and only one block from the Flatiron building. Lots of restaurants (Eataly is over the road) and all sorts of shops locally and only 15 mins walk to the high line

Prescription glasses were missing from the coffee counter in the room during our stay and never recovered after multiple inquiries. The same day the room was only partially cleaned. Spilled granola was left on the floor and the toilet was not cleaned. Also, the water bottles were not replenished as was done on previous days. Otherwise, our stay was fine.

I’m here with a friend. It is 1 am and we are unable to sleep because the hotel is hosting a super loud party on the rooftop -something they forgot to mention when we booked the room. There is no escaping the sound as the walls themselves are vibrating from the music (we are on the 8th floor of a 17 floor building. That’s how loud it is!!). I called the front desk and was informed that the party won’t end until 2:30 am. We have a long day of travel tomorrow so our inability to sleep is going to affect us. It’s horribly inconsiderate of the hotel management to decide that their hotel guests don’t need to sleep until 2:30 am and that they don’t need to be informed. Also, it’s inconsiderate of the hotel staff to not lower the volume after so many guests complained. Unless you do not mind random loud parties above your head, do not stay in this hotel. Other than that, the rooms are dark and the ac units old and too loud. This hotel should be rated 3 stars. It’s definitely not a 4 star hotel. The location is good though if your visit to NYC involves both downtown and midtown errands.

Where can I start, the room felt like a dungeun, completely dark, sleeping was almost impossible for the noises the bed made, TV signas goes on and off by itself and nobody takes care of anyting, the personal only say sorry for your incoveniences but do nothing about it. They charge a "resort fee" but there are NO AMENITIES, its a lot, I would not recomend it to anybody.

Relatively small room but not unusual for NYC. Good value for money, located between 5th and 6th ave near Flatiron and Chelsea. Only complaint was the air con, located in the room and quite noisy overnight

Very nice, clean hotel. Central location and Found it very easy to get to all the sites from this location. Located just up the street from the Flatiron building. Staff was very helpful. Would recommend to friends.

Joaquin was very courteous and made our stay very pleasant. On the day of checkout, Joaquin facilitated our ride to the airport and helped my coworkers and I carry our luggage out to the car. He had great customer service, and made my experience at hotel Henri enjoyable.

Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the restaurant and the rooftop bar. The lobby is small but inviting, the iced tea and lemonade for the guest on a hot day is a nice touch! Would definitely stay again!

Absolutely awesome. Perfect location to all my needs. Spacious and comfortable room, staff was awesome, polite, very helpful and friendly, Joaquin hooked us up with a Spanish restaurant where we ate an authentic dominican platter "MMMMMMMMMM". I will definitely stay here again .

The staff tried to meet our expectations. However, due to aged HVAC equipment could not fully resolve temperature issue, too hot. But once they removed the AC decor screen the room air flow improved and lowered the temperature by 2 degrees (cooler). Also, the shower door leaked and flooded bathroom floor, black mold in shower enclosure and the shower door handle was loose and came off a n my hand. All concerns were looked at by Engineering and a Housekeeping. But not all issues were fixed.

When I arrived in my room, my room temperature was very very cold, uncomfortably chili. I tried to adjust the temperature and thought I did. I came back to the room after heading to dinner to learn the temperature gage did not work nor did turning off the unit. It was broken. The shower leaked & was not sealed properly. The toilet was running & would not stop. Changed rooms the next day to find that shower was not properly sealed & also leaked.All & all a very upsetting experience & stay.

I only stayed here one Saturday night in August 2019 after a sleepless red-eye from CA, and really appreciated the service from the front desk staff, Yaya and JoJo, who accommodated my very early arrival without a problem. They were sweet, they smiled, and they were that kind to everyone, so Kudos to them! I asked for a quiet room and I got a quiet room! The only loud noises were the BOOMS when other guests would shut their doors, so if the hotel would suggest for guests to shut their doors gently but securely as a courtesy to other guests, that would completely eliminate the noise disturbance. My room was COOL when I arrived, as the AC had been running, and CLEAN. So important to not find other people's hair in the bathroom, etc., so Kudos to the Housekeeping Staff! The only minor bummers were: no shower cap; no shower gel -- bar soap just isn't my thing; and the shower did leak and to form a puddle along the doorway. I was just careful stepping onto the marble floor and after drying off, I laid down the towels to soak up the puddle. Back to the awesome points: Black out curtains; large flat screen TV had lots of channels to choose from, and of course there was Wi-Fi. At check-in I was given two complimentary drink tokens, (that I didn't use,) as they were going to have a rooftop happy hour, (I slept through it!) and in the lobby they had two ice cold dispensers of complimentary lemonade and ice tea with vodka and another bottle of booze, which surprised me, lol! But hey, it's Manhattan, so that made sense. I loved the lemonade. Anyway, the positives vastly outweighed any negatives and I highly recommend Hotel Henri!

I returned home last evening after a four night stay. The location can not be beat. Eataly at the end of the block, Tacombi & Bo’s Kitchen across the street, Tappo Thin Crust Pizza & Chop House out the door to the right, Trattoria Italienne and Junoon to the left, a Greek restaurant in the lobby, & drinks on the roof. There’s even a Starbucks on the corner if you’re in need of a mediocre coffee. Just around the corner from the 23rd Street/7th Avenue Subway Station to easily get you uptown and down.
