Boy, I was surprised as the balcony room was the biggest they had and on the top floor! I asked the front desk also if I could see the other rooms, they were smaller, so I was happy on my choice. The hotel give me free coffee maker inside the room and free bottled water. I was a very happy camper. The staff is very friend and some are very good looking. Overall I enjoyed my visit in NYC. Thank you Hotel Henri personnel!

I just had an amazing weekend in NYC at the Sir Henri. Ronni was my first contact upon trying to check in. I'd arrived early and wanted to drop my bag to begin the fun. Ronni was a wealth of information on nearby attractions and places to eat. Additionally, she coordinates tours if desired and is a valuable asset to the Sir Henri team. The room (12th floor) was quiet, nicely appointed and very comfortable. It also contained a safe, a few essential toiletries and umbrella if one needed them. My room would have been comfortable for two, but an older child would have begun to make it a bit crowded. I encountered other very friendly and helpful staff members during my stay. I found the continental breakfast offering rather substantial featuring various pastries, some fruit, juice, coffee and tea. Lena was here and was friendly and helpful. It is worth obtaining the breakfast coupon. I agree with other reviewers in that the location is great for walking and exploring or summoning a ride. I did not drive but did see a garage nearby.

Terrific location and relatively inexpensive Lee priced but my floor was loud with work being done on the building and the cleaning staff very early in the morning on the weekend. Their continental breakfast was beyond sub par. If the hotel was in a better repair then my rating would’ve been much higher

This property is centrally located. A short walk to Times Square and easy access to Subway. Clean, modern and friendly, helpful staff. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Onsite restaurant was great. Concierge was able to assist with all our requests. I would highly recommend this property.

By far the kindest, friendliest staff I’ve had the pleasure of coming in contact with on my travels. I had a terrible experience the day my flight landed, but the moment I arrived and checked into Hotel Henri it was like a breath of fresh air. They were amazing welcoming, offered me complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar and made sure my every need was catered to. They went out of their way to lift my spirits and I’ll always remember that!The room itself was superb... reminded me of Dash in Bali. All round excellent stay at hotel Henri! I’ll be sure to return

I had such a great stay at Hotel Henri. Right in the middle of everything and in walking distance of some great museums and restaurants. We had a wonderful time and the service was spectacular. I can't wait to go back and stay longer and spend sometime on the roof top bar.

It was clean and quaint. I did get to see Emril Lagasse in the lobby. I wished the room service stayed open later as I had just gotten into town and had to walk to find food open since the kitchen was closed. The heat was challenging in the room but the staff was friendly and the room was cute.

Very friendly staff and the place was nice. Great location for getting around and exploring. Nice rooftop bar and everything worked well inside. Very hot showers which was nice and we all enjoyed our experience

Biggest pro: location. Biggest cons: noise, customer service and cleanliness.Complaining to reception or maintenance did not achieve the result of getting a clean, functioning room. I'd hesitate to recommend this hotel.

One of those rooms that has lights and lamps everywhere, but you still don't have light where you need it. Only half the closet was usable because the hangers were too big, so you couldn't slide the closet doors.Couldn't turn off heat in the room the first night and had to unscrew light bulb since there was no way to turn off light over mini bar. Luckily these were both addressed the Next day, but frustrating when you get in late, want to iron some clothes and get some sleep. I could see coming back, but mainly because of the location in relation to the offices I visit in the area.

This hotel came highly recommended by a business colleague as it within walking distance of the office. Boy, was I disappointed. The location was great. The amenities were good. But that was about it.The window in the room would not close shut and it's so noisy and cold in Jan that it kept me up all night. They promised to fix it but did not repeatedly. The bathroom shower door would not close shut and it flooded the bathroom floor. The chair was ratty and had holes in it. All in all, extremely surprising that it was such a poor experience and that complaining to the Hotel did not actually get them to fix it. Extremely poor maintenance. I'd find it hard to recommend this hotel to anyone.

This spot has a narrow entranceway next to a restaurant whose signage kind of dominates. Inside is a small lobby with friendly staff. We stayed on the 11th floor...only 6 rooms per floor. Appreciated the red translucent shade that let in some light but gave privacy.

What a nice find. Great location in an area of the the city we typically don’t see. Took advantage of Eataly which was just a block away.Staff is very friendly and helpful. The Hot Cocoa station in the lobby was especially “sweet”. Rooms were very nice particularly the lighting and shower. And, finally, the pastries at breakfast were delicious.

I got a room below the rooftop bar and the noise was terrible till midnight. Front desk staff did nothing to help. Then a 6:00 AM the alarm clock of the room next door woke me up because the walls are paper thin. Very bad stay

If ever in Manhattan, the place to stay is Hotel Henri! The staff is professional but accommodating and the service is impeccable. They are friendly (which can be difficult to find in a large, busy city) and very helpful. Their rooms are modern and roomy for the area of Manhattan. You can't beat the location..walking distance to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, restaurants, shopping and many more attractions. A short ride will take you to Central Park, the Met and more places of interest. And the hotel is home to Rodo's, an Emeril Lagasse restaurant which you shouldn't miss. You may see he wandering around and speaking with customers. We did! He is so friendly and will gladly sign an autograph or take a picture with you. Besides, the food is outstanding. We will definitely come back here on our next visit to New York.

My sister and I stayed at the Henri during a short visit to NYC. The location is perfect for visiting the city. We walked to Times Square to see plays in the evening. During the day we walked from the hotel to the High Line and down to the 9/11 Museum. Greenwich Village and NYU are a short walk away as well. In addition to the location the room was very comfortable and the bed was great so we had two good night's sleep. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet. The offerings were mostly sugary sweets with no protein options, The second morning we went out for breakfast. Other than that we were very happy and appreciated the friendly and helpful staff.

Great value and good location. Close to subways and on same block as Eatily. Chef Emeril in the house at Mediterranean Rodos! Gym access off site. Comp continental breakfast weak, Starbucks close by. Front desk friendly and accommodating.

Very nice hotel in NYC. The staff was friendly and very attentive. The rooms are on the small side but I didnt go to NYC to stay in the room. Everything was very clean and exactly how it is in the pictures. The restaurant in this hotel is exceptional. The rooftop bar was nice and once again very friendly staff. I will definately keep this on my go to list for NYC!

Very nice hotel and in a great location within NYC. Staff was very helpful. The new restaurant was also very good. Wish they had a few more breakfast options. All in all, a great stay and would recommend it to business and holiday travelers.

check in was fast,Ronnie was great!! she was was knowledgeable and welcoming.room was a bit small but cozy, location was perfect.we did not get to visit the restaurant only because it closed by 10pm on Sunday however, we do look forward to visiting again real soon. our experience was great, and for the price we couldn't ask for more.

Overall my stay in hotel Henri was good, the only part is did not like was the fact that they did not have a microwave and fridge was not so cooling. So I could not preserve my food and this led to wastage for me.

I stayed here for my first time few days ago and i absolutely loved everything about it. I would stay here again and plan too. I love Wyndham but this one was one of the best. The room decor and style is so nyc, the bathrooms are nice and spacious, hot strong shower, cute bathroom dressing room style bulbs... rooftop bar and such nice accommodating staff. Recommended!

Great location for the price. Rooms were a little small but for a solo business traveler it does the job just fine. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and I loved the free hot cider and cocoa bar (with Fireball whiskey and rum as add-ons!) in the lobby to warm up from the winter cold. The hallways got a little noisy at night and it seemed as if folks were right outside the door if anyone talked out there but nothing crazy.My only big disappointment was my experience in the rooftop bar and lounge. The bartender was very cold and seemed annoyed to serve my friend and I. It was a quiet Tuesday night with only a few others at the bar and it took us probably 15 minutes from drink order to drink delivered. I'll also note their food room service is a bit odd in that it's through a restaurant rather then the hotel and it's not 24/7, I wish I had been told that upon check in but not a huge deal with all the food delivery apps out there.

Excellent! We loved the Henri Hotel. Food was delicious. Staff helpful and pleasant. As a Wyndham member, we were pleasantly surprised by receiving two complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar. What a treat!

We stayed overnight at Hotel Henri. Location is terrific if you are planning on being in Midtown or South. Staff is outstanding. Ronni at check in and Carlos, the bellman provided terrific customer service. This hotel offered a # of extras. Free bottled water, hot chocolate with marshmallows in lobby and wifi. Being a Wyndham member a continental breakfast was included for the three of us. It was my daughter and her friend's birthdays, Ronni gave us free drink vouchers at the rooftop bar. I wish the rooms were a bit larger, but that is usually an issue in NYC and the price was great! I would definitely stay again

Our stay was pretty good. We were staying in the city over the week and used our Wyndham points. Surprised location was Nice and convenient. Also, the Keurig was a big plus in my book. My husband and I totally adored this hotel. Thank you for the stay Henri Hotel Team!

It wasn't my first time in NYC, but to stay in such a great hotel – that's a first.Location? Amazing! Staff? Wonderful (special shout out to Melisa at reception who was just incredible)! Rooms? Large (compared to usual New York room sizes). Price? At first I thought it's a mistake. But be smart – book really really early. Honestly this is a first hotel in New York I would love to come back.

We travel a lot. We have earned max status with several chains to try them out. Wyndham usually results in disappointment, unfortunately. We have only truly enjoyed a handful of locations. The best ones being Hawaii, and now Hotel Henri.If it isn't poor staff and dingy looking places, it's not advertising the location properly (looking at you Ravel with your boom boom rooftop bass making it nigh impossible for a good nights sleep), to flies on the food, to no food at all, Wyndham has often been a big letdown.When I checked in I mentioned to the front desk we were on the 14 day challenge to match max status with Wyndham, we usually have had bad experiences and were really hoping things would not be that way here. He apologized for our poor prior experiences at other hotels but said he would do his best to make sure things were good here. He then spent a few minutes talking about the new restaurant and a michilin star restaurant nearby when I asked for food recommendations. I am happy to say that our experience at Hotel Henri was the compete opposite. When we got to the room we received a small upgrade due to being max status. In our room was a bottle of champagne. The room was clean and well maintained. It also had all the little extras you might need like tooth paste, a sewing kit, makeup removers etc. The only negative about the room was you could hear peoples doors and talking when they were in the hallway.In the evening they had fireball whiskey, rum, cider, and hot chocolate for guests for no additional cost. Seeing as how it was cold this was a really nice touch and something I saw several guests partaking in. The restaurant was a bit on the pricey side, even for new york, but it was all delicious and tasty. The service at the restaurant was fast and attentive. We did not have to ask for anything at any time. The bellpersons I would also like to throw a shoutout too as they brought in and out over 30 bags for us as we had done a lot of shopping. Pro tip: You can find free parking on the weekend by going where TWo Brothers Pizza is and parking on that area. Most of the parking restrictions are removed for Saturday and Sundays. Just read the signs carefully. We ended up saving about 50 bucks for parking this way. Otherwise use Spothero to save a bit of cash.

Hotel was new and chiq, with comfortable living space and a very nice urban twist on decor. Price was reasonable and it was situated in the heart of manhattan. I will definitely go again as I am always receiving deals via email.

This hotel is in a great location with lots of places within walking distance and you can catch the subway nearby. The area around the hotel is safe as well. Rooms are small but that is normal for Nee York. Staff was friendly and helpful when asking questions about getting around.

The reason we chose this hotel was the good price. Love the nice location and view. Good hotel facilities. The rest area is also nice people can take a rest and gather there. We would stay at this hotel again.

This boutique hotel is convenient to Penn Station,Chelsea and Greenwich Village, all within walking distance. Rooms are small but clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Do not accept a room on 17th floor unless you enjoy hearing thumping percussion until midnight. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

From the time that I walked into this boutique hidden gem, until I hailed my taxi to head back to Penn Station; I felt welcomed. The room, bar, and personal concierge were all great. This is not your grandmother’s extended stay. You feel the sense of practical elegance from the creative furnishings and attention to detail. All of the hosts were great every during each interaction with them. I definitely recommend the laidback hideaway rooftop bar.

I stayed here before and it seemed pretty good. This time there was a lot of miscommunication. I stayed after traveling for a funeral so my funds were tied up I was told there would not be an additional hold or security but due to the low balance cause of the unexpected expenses I ended up having to use another card so basically ended up paying for 2 rooms. The restaurant was closed, The manager offered to make up for the stay by notating my membership account and said they would follow up but she did not as of yet almost 2 weeks later.

I was disappointed with how small the room was and the rooftop lounge was not as great as advertised. The customer service was also not up to par. The room decor seemed cheap and was not worth the money.

Enjoyed our stay but wished the restaurant was open. The rooftop bar was nice for a break. The staff was very hospitable and welcoming. It was convenient for our sightseeing and transportation was nearby. Would stay there again.

With no parking, it’s costing us $75 /day for a pickup.The staff is nice and the drinks are good, but the facility was poor. Improper directions to rooms, sloppy painting, mold in shower grout, and smell of weed coming from the stairwell just to name a few issues. Emeril Lagasse was consulting at the newly opened restaurant - Rojas. I was a shocked when Emeril asked how we like the food then left. (We were the only patrons in the restaurant) My spouse ordered the whole artichoke which tasted like tuna fish. I ordered the Louisiana Crawfish pasta which tasted like old seafood. We wont be returning or do we recommend.We have stayed in numerous Wyndham establishments from timeshares to hotels and this was the worst. The staff was nice....

Stayed with family on a vacations for the holidays. Staff was excellent and couldn't be more helpful. Location was good, in the middle of Manhattan, easy access to ride sharing. No onsite hotel parking, but a parking garage was just 2 doors down.

All of the staff from the front desk to the housekeepers are extremely friendly and accommodating. The location is great lots of bars, clubs and restaurants near by. I am very satisfied with my stay and will be returning. This was a 10/10 for me.

My Wyndham stay at hotel Henry was great, the accommodation were perfect, the rooms were clean and comfortable the house was minimal and the staff was kind and friendly, it was close to many popular sites in NYC

Room was just what we needed. Clean, very comfortable bed and nice shower. The service staff couldn't have been nicer. A free cocktail at the rooftop bar upon arrival. Free breakfast each morning. Complimentary unlimited water bottle service the whole stay. The location was perfect in my opinion. Right next to Madison Square Park with great fast food and coffee spots like Eataly and Shake Shack. Close to Union Square and Grammercy Park. Quick trip to Upper West, and both sides of Downtown. I will only stay here in the future.

Great stay, rooms are small but the beds are huge and very comfortable. Would recommend & stay here again! We paid for a balcony room the only issue being it’s close to the rooftop bar which can be noisy... location great for Subway, bars, cafes & restaurants!

This hotel may only be for the 30 under crowd looking for a great location in flat iron part of NYC but for the price it is not a great deal. Rooms were small and uncomfortable (literally bed bowed in the middle, lights falling off walls, yellow dim light in bathroom). We were two floors below the rooftop bar and still could not sleep till after two (bar is best part if you want to party but I was there on work so terrible). Hot chocolate is about best part of it. Truly will not stay here again.

Stayed with a friend in a double room facing backwards. Which end up being good cause there was no noise at all. Another friends who got a front room, complaint a lot about the street noises.The room was small but clean. The bed really soft but I had no problems with it. The shower had a leak and the bathroom got SOAKED everytime one took a shower. Despite my complaints, nothing was dome about it.The real downfall of the hotel was the service. This hotel doesn’t have a formal front desk. There’s a tiny table with one or two people tops. And no one willing to help. Location was ok. Would not stay again.

I chose to celebrate my 51st birthday in NYC. I couldn't have selected a better hotel to stay. From check-in to check -out the staff was incredible. Diana and Carlos were so friendly when I check in. I was in and out sight seeing and Diana spoke to me every time. When I ask about a restaurant I wanted to go to the gentleman in the lobby escorted me to the location, which was nearby. The hotel was clean, well maintained, and nicely decorated. Overall my stay was great and it was the staff that won me over from the start.

We stayed for a week and got metro cards and could easily get anywhere on the subway. We visited Central Park, Harlem, soho China town and Little Italy. The restaurant was closed at the hotel for renovations but there was restaurants everywhere. Nice park in a short walking distance. I would definitely come back here.15 minutes to Central Park 8 minutes from soho or Times Square.

A last minute business trip before year end my partner arranged a reservation for me in Manhattan. Hotel Henri is a boutique hotel that's part of the Wyndham chain. The front end staff is amazing and helpful. Parking is pricey but not an issue with hotel but just NYC parking. Still, that too is worth every penny and secure. Back to hotel, their downstairs restaurant is being renovated but the rooftop restaurant is small but cozy and intimate. See my review of Sir Henri Rooftop.The lobby here is small compared to most hotels, with two elevators. There are 12 floors + rooftop restaurant.Rooms are more typical of European, small, yet contemporary style and appointment. The bathroom is roomy, great water pressure and well lit. We had a Deluxe King room, comes with safe, iron and board, free WiFi, desk and mini bar. Large screen TV, good selection of channels. And Clean !! Centrally located between Times Square and Wall Street, just off 6th Ave. Easy walking distance to the shopping, restaurants. Tucked away on West 24th Street. A great hotel to just escape. To the staff... well done.

Our stay was good. Room was clean, staff members were nice and helpful. This was our second stay and we will be back again. The only thing was that we had to wait to check in, but it’s understandable during the holidays.

I never have done a review in my life, but I would feel wrong about this situation if I didn't speak up. Upon check in we waited close to 10 minutes for a front desk staff member, the door man kept us company and was a great guy. The front desk lady finally came and was friendly enough and professional. She told us we could select pretty much any floor we wanted, however she did not bother to tell us that their would be a party until 3am on the Saturday night at the bar. Had she done so we obviously wouldn't of selected the 17th floor which is right below the bar. I have a recording of it on my phone and it legitimately sounds like we are playing music from a speaker in our room until 3am. The door man felt bad for us and said we should call and try to switch rooms, however the front desk informed us all rooms were occupied and that all they could do for us was bring ear plugs. The doorman said that someone should of told us about this at check in because they have known for atleast a week about the party. We also planned on using our 2 complimentary drink tickets on the Saturday night, however due to the private party in the bar we were not able to even use them on the Saturday night. Again something you think the staff would inform us about at check in. The kitchen is under renovation so you cannot get any food, which is something that wasn't told to us until we asked how late room service goes, once again something that should be told to you upfront. The elevator situation which already had some serious issues became even worse when 1 out of the 2 broke down completely on the Sunday. And lastly I dunno how you are promoting a continental breakfast package but in reality its just muffins and danishes, 0 warm food such as eggs, bacon etc and the coffee and hot water were both empty at 9am when I was there because the poor women running it has to go all the way to the main floor to refill everything (18 floors down). 1 positive is the the cleaning staff and door staff were amazing and the rooms are actually nice. I chose this hotel because I am in the military and we get a discount on Wyndham Hotels so I thought I would give it a shot, however next time I think I will choose to pay a little more money and get ALOT more value.

It was my wife and my first time in New York City and staying at the Hotel Henri delivered an amazing experience for us on multiple fronts. Dyhana was the first person we encountered and she couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming to us. After making an emergency landing in Newark, NJ flying in (thanks a lot Delta) and dealing with extremely rude Delta staff when trying to figure out a ride to our hotel, we were very pleased to find a friendly person like her at the front desk. Dyhana made us quickly forget about this disastrous experience and put us at ease from the moment we walked in. Delta could learn a thing or two from Hotel Henri. The hotel provided complimentary hot chocolate and apple cider in the lobby along with vodka and fireball to give it an extra New York kick. Our bellhop Danny was funny and very welcoming. We interacted with most of the staff during our week long stay and they all exhibited the same high level of professionalism. No matter what time of day, there was someone at the front desk greeting us and wishing us a nice day when we walked through the lobby.Our room had all the amenities we needed for the week given that we were out on the town most of the day. The only thing it lacked was a refrigerator for the food that we came home with. Water was provided to us on a daily basis and housekeeping staff was not hard to find at any hour of the day. Halfway through our trip, we requested to be moved to a balcony room and the hotel happily obliged. There were only two aspects of our stay which were not perfect. One of them being the thinness of the walls. We could hear doors slamming in the hallway (which was very tiny) as early as 6:30 in the morning. We were unable to sleep in any day due to this. We brought this to the attention of the staff and they told us they would be addressing this as they sought to continue to improve their guest experience. The hotel's lobby restaurant was also undergoing renovations and the daily morning "breakfast" was moved up to the rooftop bar. Our stay included breakfast each day but others were charged $10 per person for coffee, juice, donuts, pastries, frosted flakes, and bananas. Perhaps things are different in New York but I would not have paid $10 for this breakfast spread and we witnessed many patrons who were disappointed at the options once they arrived at the rooftop. Clearer communication regarding what to expect with breakfast would have gone a long way.

The hotel was nice, clean and pretty convenient. The walls are a bit thin so if you are a light sleeper, bring whatever sleep aid works for you. We weren't expecting a continental breakfast, but it was provided. My only suggestion is for the front desk staff to have more knowledge of the area, thank goodness for google maps.

Amazing atmosphere. Had hot chocolate/apple cider available for spiking for free. Only complaint is that the overall cost when you initially purchase the rooms do not show the “facility fees” which end up being around an extra $30/day

Work booked me this hotel a few years back and here I am again! I was pleasantly surprised that they renovated the hotel and is now this jazzy boutique Hotel. Pleasant and heapful staff, The kicker was the free hot chocolate and cider in the lobby. What a bonus when it is so cold outside!

Thumbs up all around the staff was great and informative about places in the area .I grew up in Ny but have lived in Florida since 2009 so a lot has changed .the bar upstairs was nice and fun to have drinks at .all in all i think it’s the best place in the area to stay at for the money.Please excuse my typos sent from my iPhone

Enjoyed the hotel. Great ambiance. Hotel was close to our evening out to the nearby comedy club. Parking for our vehicle was within steps of the hotel. Enjoyed the quietness of the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Perfect location in Chelsea, especially during holidays when midtown is crazy crowded! Easy walk to SoHo and Midtown. Staff was very friendly. Upper floor room was a bit loud, could here music and dancing from bar at 1am on Saturday night.

Staff are very accommodating and were able to help us get an early check in. The luggage guy Rooms are stylish and sleek. I particularly liked that the floors were wooden. Breakfast was served with a view in their rooftop bar. I can recommend it for anybody

The hotel is located on a calm street near 5th Avenue in NYC, close to subways and within walking distance of major NY sights. The room itself is rather small but ok for a couple of nights stay. Breakfast is continental with rather limited choice. What I really didn't like is the charge for mini-bar that appeared a couple of days later on my card account while I didn't touch any item there. I had to call the customer service a number of times to resolve the issue. Customer management of the hotel finally notified me that they exceptionally made a courtesy for me cancelling the charge, which sounded like "Yes you consumed sth but we'll cancel your bill". I found this offensive and distrustful, especially given that I am a platinum member of this chain and staying in Wyndham chain in many countries.

The room was great, small, but that’s the City. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Staff were extremely helpful. The front desk recommended a great local bar and we had a great time! It was an enjoyable experience.

The Htl is very well located specially in winter times. Few steps from 23th St subway station. The room is comfortable with good linens bed and towels. We spend about 9 nights and everything we request or complain are solved in time and with care for the reception desk staff! Very good cost x benefits.

Checked in for 2 nights and had to ask for free breakfast vouchers as they forgot. When I asked about free drink vouchers I was told they were out but they'd get them to us that day. Never got them. Our room had only one toothbrush, so we asked for another. Never got it. Went to free breakfast and it was a joke to us and the other guests. No eggs, meats, pancakes, yogurt, waffles. Just pastries & breads from who knows when, Cherrios, coffee, apples, bananas. Plus the garbage can was overflowing and it wasn't from that day. The room was small but nice enough, but the free wifi rarely worked on phone or laptop. Staff was friendly. For over $400 a night, I think I can do better.

We found the stay at Hotel Henri to be great. Rooms were well kept and were reflective of advertisement. Beds were comfortable. Everything worked well and enjoyed the morning breakfast. Although it was cold outside, the room was very comfortable and staff made the stay even better. Good location.....center of New York "things to do." We walked everywhere and easy subway access.

Room was clean which was a positive. Restaurant was closed due to renovation and website didn't imply that information. One bed in the first room was broke down and squeaked every time you moved. Staff did move us the next night. Cleaning staff turned our air conditioner on and down to 63 degrees (in December) and opened our window and left it open. Small things that I did notify the front desk staff of upon check out.

Check-in time is 3pm, but didn't get the room unit almost 5pm. First, rooms were not ready, then when we finally got room key it was room with two full beds not one king. Had to wait more for the right room type. Location is great! Near everything, lots of food options, walking distance to many landmarks.Room can be cleaner and definitely can use newer set of sheets, our has holes.Bathroom is spacious for this hotel.

Second time visiting NYC and decided to say at Hotel Henri. The location is excellent with easy access to public transport and a quick walk to Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center. Staff went out of their way to be helpful, especially the manager on duty who helped us out with a booking mishap.

We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was small but clean and nicely furnished. The front desk staff were friendly and very accommodating. My only wishes were that there was more variety at breakfast—less sugar, and a vending machine with soft drinks.

Great location, The room was small but typical for NYC, We loved the rooftop bar, great drinks, hospitality and wonderful view. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired. But the staff was friendly and very approachable.

The hotel was in a great location to food, bars and subway stops. Room was nice and bed was super comfortable. Rooftop bar was a disappointment. Service to the room was hit or miss during our 4 night stay. The hotel tacks on $25 a day for coffee, water and workout facility. Had to constantly ask for water to be brought up because they would not restock when servicing the room.

Booked a deluxe room weeks in advance with a King size bed. Arrive after long day of travel ahead of an early meeting to a room with two tiny beds that might remind you of your childhood bedroom. Refused to move me a room with a King bed, as had been reserved weeks in advance. Refused any sort of compensation for the inconvenience. Their excuse? You book through a third party site, so your preference isn't guaranteed.Basically: we'll take your reservation, but we won't honor the room we advertise. If you don't like it, kick dirt. Sure we gave your room to someone else, but no, we didn't bother to give you a heads up or chance to change hotels. Some version of hospitality, folks.

this is my favorite hotel when visiting NYC, its right on the 6th and 23rd , central location, good size rooms with a nice modern look.staff is always polite and welcoming , its a great place to stay if you are traveling for business.only con is that the rooms are a bit dark, not enough natural light and there is no central lighting

I spent 10 days at Hotel Henri and it felt like home. The lady at the front desk did her best to check me in earlier (i arrived early in the morning) and in less than 2 hours my room was ready!The guys at front desk were very friendly, made sure I had everything I wanted - special shout out to Carlos and Jamos who were extremely helpful, always smiling.There's a ton of great restaurants and cafes close to the hotel, my favorite Latin Beet next door. The rooms and bathrooms were cleaned every day, they were spacious, good lighting, and provided water and coffee capsules for free. The pillows were super comfy and there were reading lights on the bed.I can't stress enough how the staff ensured I had a good stay and were responsive to all my requests. They provided us with free passes to the Equinox, one of the most popular gyms in NY, 7 minutes walk away. It's also close to fitness studios - Y7 yoga and MileHighRunning.The hotel is super hip and centrally located. I'll definitely stay here the next time I visit.

The service was outstanding, and this made all the difference. Because we were arriving into town at 12pm with bags, we had hoped to snag a room a little earlier than the regular check in time. We called twice prior to arriving to arrange this. We spoke to Nathalee who was courteous, professional, and expertly made us feel like we were her only customer. Our first call with Nathalee was to confirm whether there would be a room available to check into early. She said that the hotel was sold out the previous night but she would keep an eye on things, and we should call back when we arrived into town. We called upon arrival and Nathalee said that we should some to the hotel as soon as possible because there was only one room, and she would hold it for us.With respect to the overall experience, the hotel is clean and has a modern feel. The rooms were spacious, which was a pleasant surprise given that this is a small hotel with seventeen floors and only eight rooms to a floor. The location is central and near the 23rd and Broadway subway station which makes getting around town quite easy. There were a number of amenities that add a fun touch. Among them, the cider and hot chocolate were our favorites. Overall, I feel we received excellent value for money. In closing, our experience, especially with Nathalee's assistance at check-in, left us feeling special, and set us off on a good beat for what became a memorable weekend in NYC. Thank you!

Traveled with colleagues to visit client in NYC. The location was perfect for us both for our trip and for accessiblity to restaurants, subway, and sights. Hotel was cute and clean. Elevators were sufficient (I have learned that is issue in NYC hotels.) Staff in upstairs bar were great. Perfect for after work drinks.

I had the worst travel experience in my life staying at Henri Hotel NYC, not only because I had money and stuff stolen from a purse of mine, but mainly given to the way the hotel managed the case.The missing items incident occurred on the second day of my trip, and if you consider that on the first day the cleaning team forgot to clean my room, it happened on the first opportunity someone from the hotel entered to clean my room. Moreover, even after I have requested to not have anybody entering the room, later the same cleaner knocked at my door announcing the room service. Luckily I was in the room and I could decline the service.Because of the incident, I had to visit twice the police station during my vacation and until now I haven't received any contact from the insurance company of the hotel. Another unpleasant situation occurred with the room service: one morning the cleaner entered the room at 7 am to do the cleaning because she received the information that the room was empty. My boyfriend and I were awfully frightened by the loud noise of having someone entering the room in a way we couldn't sleep anymore on a day that both of us had a wedding ceremony that would occupy all the day of ours. I'm sure Wyndham knows the user experience is the key to success of any business and I can guarantee you that mine and my boyfriends' were terrible. I have imagined that Wyndham would grant us any offer to mitigate all the incidents that occurred and had been reported during the stay, but on the contrary, by the time of our check-out, I have realized that final prices were incorrectly and a little higher surcharge, if compared to the price that I previously booked (last unpleasant surprise after 9 days of stay).

I have been staying at the Henri Hotel multiple times during the last year, and I cannot recommend it more! The rooms are comfy, clean and the amenities are super nice. What really distinguishes the hotel, though, is the level of service: the staff is always kind and gentle, ready to assist and make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible. You are always welcomed by a smile and a prompt response to your requests. Nathalee, Carlos and, Dayhana were extremely nice and helpful, and Sanday has been incredibly forthcoming and helpful in resolving issues that arose because of bureaucratic obstacles.Once again, if you are looking for a nice, boutique hotel in the center of NYC you HAVE to try the Henri. Enjoy your stay!

Rooms are compact but very clean great location. Renovation nicely done, staff was friendly. We were only there for a night to get caught up on jet lag on our way home to NM from Spain. It was perfect for our needs. Had to leave at 5 a.m. so didn't take advantage of complimentary breakfast and we don't drink so didn't use 2 free drink tickets but it is a nice extra.

I had a wonderful stay and will gladly go again the staff where very helpful and knowledgeable and all questions asked the room was excellent and always clean and the roof top bar was great to visit for a nightcap

Booked with my Wyndham points and was very pleased with staff, and hotel. They gave us a back room on the 12th floor so pretty quite for New York City!! Also thought the location was nice. Complementary drinks of hot coco or Cider, with Run or Fireball to add some kick in the lobby, and a complimentary drink at the roof top bar, which is a must do. View is lovely.

The room was small, fairly clean (paint peeling in the bathroom), and the beds were comfortable, but the noise coming from the street and the air rushing through the window made for two rough nights. The front desk was helpful. They ran down the street and hailed a cab for us. Umbrellas were supplied to us on the rainy day. There was also a computer in the lobby, so we were able to check in for our flight home. Upon arrival, we were told that there was a $25.00 "Resort Fee." This was to include water bottles in the hotel room, a free drink per guest in the lounge, and access to a health spa down the street. This came as a complete surprise as we had already paid for our room via Wyndham Rewards.The food in the Greek restaurant on site was very good. We enjoyed the chicken and greek potatoes. The meatballs were small and just okay. The provided continental breakfast was nice, but we opted to purchase omelets in the restaurant, which were very good. Overall, I would have given this hotel more stars, but I just can't find the strength because of how the window allowed in the cold and noise.

nice hotel. nice breakfast. 2 free drinks upon arrival. staff well trained. hot chocolate with some fireball waiting for you in the lobby.would stay again. nice location with an excellent Mexican restaurant across the street.

Our stay at the Henri was lovely. The staff were lovely and didnt hesitate to do anything for us. The bed was so so comfy! We stayed on the 16 floor.. it was so quiet, we didnt hear the roof top bar or the streets. It is very central to the city to and plenty of places around the hotel to get a quick breakfast. The room was very clean and warm to. Would definitely stay there again!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this property. Accommodating, friendly staff, comfy beds and the hot cocoa and cider station in the lobby is a nice added touch. We certainly would stay at this location again.

A perfect hotel for a weekend getaway. Friendly, accommodating staff, comfy beds & nice little touches like the make your own spiked hot cider or hot cocoa station offered in the lobby. Quiet and clean. Would totally stay here again.

Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hot cider and hot cocoa on the way out the door was a nice touch. The breakfast could stand to start a little earlier. Love the location kind of central to everything

Average Hotel. Excellent location. But nice as not too large. Very basic bar on ground level. Not comftable or at all inviting. But the Penthouse bar is a must. Great atmosphere and music. Excellent food.Our room was clean, average size Small window with no view to talk of. Amazing super comfy queen size bed. Nice bathroom walk in shower.

The location is a great midtown south location in a quiet area. The room is small, even for NYC. The staff was great, very nice and accommodating. The free hot chocolate and apple cider were delicious and a nice surprise at check-in. The hotel and room were very clean with nice decor, my only complaint is there was no drawers or suitable place to put my clothes, except the shirts that hang. If you're looking for a view, this isn't the hotel to stay in.

The staff where very friendly and the location excellent! It was quite newly renovated. So it could have been very good and I think they really tried but didnt quite succeed.The worst thing for me was that the rooms where not clean. It was dusty, dirty etc and the stains remained all four nights. The glasses where never washed and had big finger prints from previous guests. We even found a pair of socks in one of the beds.We tried a few drinks at the bar and they where not blended then, prefabricaded and the mojito was not drinkable. They added a weird service fee of 27 usd per night. We didnt get a do not disturb-sign for the door, had to ask for it three times and where questioned when we finally got it.I wouldnt go back or recommend this hotel.

NYC's long been one of my favorite cities ever since I visited 20 years ago. Iconic sights like yellow cabs, steam from the ground, towering skyscrapers, and the Times Square neon lights felt like I was on a film set! I decided to stay in a centeral neighborhood which happened to be the Flat Iron District. This is a great jump off point to get anywhere in the city, and you have beautiful sights just in the area such as Madison Square Park, the Met Life Tower, Flat Iron Building, and the Empire State Building. If you plan your trip to most tourist attractions I suggest investing in the city pass. Many museums here are on donation basis, so made sure to read the signs before you spend big bucks. The concierge staff at the hotel was very kind and helpful, and make sure I was going in the right direction. Thank you for a wonderful stay and I will be back again soon. Love from Germany!

The Henri is a smaller Boutique hotel, but afterall this is new york .The guys at the door and the staff at the reception area did a good job at making me feel welcome. Room was comfortable and clean, I particularly liked the smell of the provided soap. I was happy that they gave me extra pillows, I normally sleep with 4 but housekeeping was able to provide me 6 :)

Friendly and helpful staff and a clean room. Location is great for getting anywhere in Manhattan....many subway lines within short walks. Bonus...Eataly is half a block away. It was fairly quiet for a New York Friday and Saturday night. Temperature controls worked fine. We will stay there again.

Unfortunately left an important article in my room. The hotel staff went to extraordinary lengths to get it sent to me. I cannot thank them enough for all of their above and beyond effort. I will always stay at their hotel in the future for my trips to NYC. Thank you staff at Henri! You really, really provided service I have never seen before.

Very convenient. The subway and bodegs are just nearby. Pen Station is a short walking distance if you are coming from the train, you are also in the middle of 2 subway lines. I loved walking to Madison Mark everyday and looking at the lovely flat ironing building at the end of the street! Also was nice that they provided a Keurig machine for free.

I love staying at the Hotel Henri because it's in the center of where I spend my time in NYC. Close to the subway lines, Madison Square Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and midtown. The staff is friendly and helpful.

I was placed in a room on the 17th floor for my stay. On a Monday night, the bar one floor above had the base so loud it was impossible to sleep. I called to have my room moved and was told that the hotel was expecting to be full and because I was in the room and touched a bottle of water I could not be moved to a new room. I was told that the bar would close at 11 and the noise should stop shortly after this. I had to wait an hour and a half to sleep. Here on business with an early morning and 19 weeks pregnant, this was not acceptable or an answer to the problem the hotel had created. Terrible service and a very unhappy customer. I do NOT recommend this hotel.

bloody great location mates if you want to be in lower manhattan, their rooms were cozy and so clean and stylish. Free wifi blokes! artsy, nearby everything and excellent facilities on site and bloody friendly staff! Grab brekky along the avenue at Toby's. Fantastic Mates!

Location, Friendly Staff, Quiet, Cozy, nice amenities, Overall Nice place to stay. What this Hotel should do: Add several USB charging ports in rooms, Replace TV with Thin Smart TV's. Remove Mini bar food and beverage, leave empty refrigerator and add a Microwave oven.

Loved the Chelsea location! The room was small yet VERY modern. The light fixtures were marvelous! The shower and hardware was Divine. The designer of this hotel pulled together all fixtures relating to NYC theater. Very thoughtfully done. I was there for 5 days and will absolutely return. The front desk women were very helpful and went out of there way to assist me. I broke my glasses and one woman was trying to glue them back together for me. above and beyond. My only slight disappointment is the windows are very small in the rooms so that NY view wasn't much. But then I spent most of my time out on the streets with view galore. Check out EATALY resto which is across the street. TO DIE FOR good food. That's my review.

Trip to the big apple to celebrate with special friends, wonderful staff made our stay very special, location wonderful, so central, very quiet for much needed sleep following our daily shopping excursions, boutique hotel, although rooftop bar didn’t fulfill our expectations, fabulous food nearby do not leave without checking out Eately nearby

The staff at Hotel Henri were excellent - very helpful, friendly and attentive. The rooms are small but very well appointed. The location could not be better. It was easy to catch a cab and go anywhere. It is also is an easy walk to many attractions - Chelsea Market, High Line, SpyScape. The room price was nearly $500/night. It seemed high but the hotel is well located, modern, clean , up-to-date with well trained staff.

:) I spent 3 nights at the Henri as I wanted to earn my Wyndham points and had a very great stay! The staff (Concierge Team) was excellent to say the least. The customer service is one of the best I experienced by far, very warm and personable! It is a cozy hotel with great bar and great location. You are in the center of the action. I would highly recommend to stay at the Henri if you visit New York :) Make sure to Try the tacos across the street!

Stayed in a corner room with a gorgeous view. Great time at the bar, great service, great food and drink. Great room great everything. Weather was even warm and sunny better than expected. I only wish the leaves in the park with Brown. Had my amazon packages delivered no problem.

Everything was excellent but two things. The entrance doors of the rooms - they do not fit and close well, so they are shaking if anyone in the next room opens it. And the shower - the door doesn't fit as well so the water is everywhere on the floor.

Great experience at a great location. Concierge and front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. I will be backagain with my family. I hope it doesn't rain when I return with them. Balcony does have a great view of the clock tower that is like back to the future.

I am a fan of boutique hotels. I was in transit in 3 different countries and needed a good nights rest and this bed was very comfortable. Staff was very helpful and friendly, Do check out the Michelin star indian restaurant next door. Superb!

I showed up 3 hours before check-in and soaking wet since I didn’t have an umbrella, hoping I could leave my luggage til we could check-in. Michael rushed off to get us towels so we could dry off. Sanday looked for an available room and got us into the room early and made sure we had enough umbrellas. Every time I walked by the front desk, Sanday greeted me personally by name. Gracious, personable, professional, friendly and respectful. Two free cocktails in the evening, a free continental breakfast, free Wi-Fi and a free late check out to accommodate our afternoon flight. Great location. I’d stay again in a heartbeat. Thank you so much, Sanday and Michael.

We stayed here for a weekend. Unfortunately the weather was not pleasant so we spent more time in the room then we normally would have. The room was super tiny for 3 people. Area was nice & parking was close by. Rooms/furniture was new but dusty.

Sanday and Daniel were amazing! Very friendly and very perfessional. They made sure to resolve any issues that occurred right away and that we were taken care of. My partner and I checked out with a great experience!

My experience with this hotel was amazing. Sanday and Daniel were super helpful and professional. There were some underlying issues with booking due to Wyndham Rewards not showing my bookings in their system but they resolved it fast. The rooms are super nice and upscale.

Let's face it, NYC is expensive. But when you pay for a 4-star hotel, even if in a lower range of them, you expect something much better than what Hotel Henri offers. The location is definitely great, but that's about it about this property. The breakfast is just a joke. Cleaning service must hace skip our room for a couple of days (no vacuum cleaning at all during 4 days, and shower mat and a towel were removed from our room one day before departure). The ventilation in the bath room makes you feel you're still in the plane that brought you to NYC, and the one next to your room door, in the hallway, is at least as noisy (and this one never stops... 24h a day!). Don't choose a room to high up in the building because you'll be using the stairways a lot (the lifts are so slow that they could as well be manually operated). The staff at reception is extremely nice, though. And that was really appreciated. If you're just looking for a place to sleep (which is what this hotel mostly offer), you can definitely find better and cheaper!

Hotel was newly renovated. Struggled with getting the hot water to work in the shower. Staff was helpful and professional. Check in and out was simple.When I checked my credit card a few days later, I saw an additional charge. When I called they stated it was because I used items from the mini bar. When I said I would like to challenge it as I did not take anything from the hotel room, they said they could not do anything about it unless I had proof. Although they were nice about the situation, I will NOT be staying at this hotel again as you are guilty until proven innocent.

It was a vacation trip. We loved the location. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I loved the free coffee in the morn and the free wall street journal. The room was pleasant and well appointed.I can list a couple of improvements....even though the room is a nice size, there is no room to put things up. One bag holder is in the room and everything needs to be put on the floor. Bags do not fit well under the bed. The closet has hangers but the door can't be closed because the hangers are too long....lame! Get rid of the closet and just hae a hanger bar. The hot water out of the faucet barely flowed (Rm 707). Loved all the hooks in the bathroom. Outlets were plentiful.

This was my first time in New York and spent quite a bit of time figuring out where to stay. I decided that the Flat Iron was a good place to be and accessible to everything. The staff at the front desk were very helpful in recommending places to go and visit. Public transportation was very accessible being able to walk to most subway lines! I'll definitely be back. Rooms were smaller than I was used to however being New York, I understand that unless you are spending over $600 you are probably not getting a large room. The view from the balcony was great!

I'm in NYC a few times a year for business and have walked by this hotel a few times and had drinks at their rooftop bar. I finally decided to try it due to the great location in the Flatiron area and close proximity to my tech clients. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful during my stay. Room was great for the price considering other hotels I've stayed in. The hotel gives passes for to a luxury gym which was a big bonus for me! I'll be back again in a few months time.

Receptionist and staff were amazingly helpful. Grabbed us a cab so quickly every morning! Bar staff were lovely and the room was so so cozy! It was my colleague’s second visit and now I know why, I will definitely be back!!

Great location,easy access to shopping bars and restaurants.Rooms are small and compact but spotlessly clean and the beds are comfy.The staff on reception made us feel very welcome and Michael on concierge was extremely helpful,thankyou,

Arrived Sat. for a Sun. conference and stayed overnight. Remarkably well-designed room with upper-end fixtures and amazingly well-designed lighting. Comfortable bed and relatively quiet, for NYC. Well-stocked mini-bar and snacks for those who are interested. Friendly, helpful staff.

Mattress was soft. Private party on the rooftop bar didn't help the 16th floor occupants with an early morning flight. The thumping loud music till 1 am was not that good. The breakfast bar, which came with the room, may be the worst ever. Location was good. Staff was friendly and helpful.

I have stayed here twice. BOTH times have been great. The rooms at a little small but hey it is nyc! There are lots of smart little lights and fun touches. I travel a lot and like this place because it does not feel like a normal hotel. I like their bag check and staff. My only complaint is it is like 100 degrees in the lobby during the winter. Also the mini bar and um adult options made for a good story.

Beware, hotel will cancel on you right when you arrive saying they are overbooked.I arrived at night and the front desk said they were overbooked. They offered to put me in a 2 star hotel for a night and then said I had to check back in the next day. Wouldn't even offer to put me up in a comparable hotel.Completely unhelpfull staff and irresponsible management.For your own peace of mind book somewhere else...literally anywhere else.Last thing you want or need on your vacation or business trip is what happened to me.

Staff was friendly, the location was perfect and the room was very clean. I travel for work often so i appreciate a comfortable stay. Will absolutely stay here again! The only downside was the view from my window was horrendous as it looked into the building next door that was being renovated. Other than that it was great.

The hotel is quite good, with the room spacious and having an excellent bed, and just generally good all around. However, they hit you with a hidden $30 fee and it seems rather sneaky that this isn’t just part of the room price. Be warned!

Easy access off 6th Ave on W 24th this hotel is close to a lot of areas but still provides a quieter street environment away from the crazy hustle and bustle. We came by train - 10 minute walk from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Walk a bit farther to Times Square. 15 minutes to Chelsea Market area and the Highline. There's a great pizza spot beside the hotel. The rooms are small which is common in NYC, as is the lobby. There's a coffee bar and a nice outdoor patio restaurant in front and an indoor rooftop bar. Staff were terrific, helpful and friendly.

Hotel Henri is absolutly great, perfect location, clean, room was quite big, big bathroom, nice breakfast, bar upstairs and especially big thank you for super friendly staff, Michael and his colleagues. Unforgettable! Highly recommended!

The bed is extremely uncomfortable!!! They charged up for a early check out smh. The staff was not compromising and not helpful. You were able to hear your neighbors. No privacy. Definitely will not stay here again.

Looks to be recently remodeled - very well. Room bigger (for New York) than I thought based on online pictures. Very nice bar upstairs in the Penthouse. Friendly, engaging staff. Would love to stay again.

Couldn't be more impressed with the hotel and its design. Very top notch customer service. Good location too which was nice and close to restaurants and a variety of food which is unique for NY hotels.

Great location in the Flatiron district where you find Madison Square Park, Eataly etc. The hotel is also walking distance away from Chelsea, Union Square and Lower East Side with great shopping and a plethora of restaurants. We walked to the Highline in the morning and enjoyed the most interesting park in NYC.

Great hotel to stay with family, business, couples, solo or with friends. Has a good localization, service, rooms, value and cleanliness. I recommend to stay some days and discover New York city and your magic.

My girlfriend and I stayed here over the weekend, easy to find hotel, we chose this hotel because it was away from Times Square and not so far from the meatpacking district. I was greeted by the associate at the front desk who was really welcoming, but the room was not ready even though I called to request a room early. The decor for the hotel seemed dingy and dark I guess ok for those who like that, many cigarette butts outside near the restaurant. As I waited for my room I realized 2 other hotel guest check in, did the hotel staff forget about my room? I asked again, and “Oh” yea the room was ready. After checking in I was handed keys to my room, as I waited for the elevator I overheard the front desk associate get reprimanded by management?? I think something like that should be done behind closed doors. My room was perfect, tiny but perfect, we faced another building in the back so we had no view, but who wants to stay in their room in NYC. Fast forward to our check out Saturday morning, my girlfriend and I party hard the previous night and just wanted to have breakfast and go home and maybe an aspirin. The front desk manager Sandy, insisted that we post a review about our stay even offered drink vouchers for their bar. As if that is what we wanted to hear after a long night out. Maybe offering Comp breakfast would of been a better gesture! Good location, management can definitely use help.

Thank you to Sanday & Melissa for the warm welcome! They were so friendly and made sure we had everything we needed at check-in. When we saw them the next day they said good morning to use and made sure we were having a pleasant stay. KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB!!

I arrived here after a long flight and commute. Was created by Natalie with a huge smile. Carlos was by her side and was quick to lend a hand. I probably called 3-4 times with questions and they were always warm, friendly and super helpful. Hotels are, like all companies, built by great people. Carlos and Natalie are winners. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends. Will be back soon,

This is my second stay here. The staff is always friendly and courteous. The rooms are immaculate and modern. The rooftop bartenders are awesome and are great mixologists. They create whatever you may want.

My wife and I found this hotel on the Wyndham website. Stephanie at the front desk was terrific. The room was smallish, but it had everything we needed and expected. The location was great. Bottled water was provided in the room and breakfast was delicious. We will definitely return to Hotel Henri

The hotel looks trendy and the location is great. The service and cleanliness is very average. Stayed at 2 other hotels of similar price range in the last 2 months they were both much better in terms of cleanliness and bed comfort, the bed creaks every time you move.

Front desk staff were helpful and kind. Close to everything. Not my taste in terms of decor but that's subjective. Good food at rooftop bar, and great waitstaff too. I would definitely recommend for business travelers

The hotel itself was fine. Nice room, cool little upstairs bar, tiny in all, but not bad. This review is for the staff. Carlos Moreta and Denny were the night shift that I talked with the most. They were friendly, helpful and just all around pleasant to talk to. Carlos was funny and really helpful in understanding New York. It’s because of you guys I will be back to the Henri. Thanks

Wonderful boutique-like hotel in NYC - reminded us of Europe. Rooms are small with different décor, but we loved them. Small is what is to be expected for NYC. The bathroom was updated and quite nice and very clean - even got a robe! Wish we had more time there but will be back,

Love the design. Evokes being behind the stage in a theatre. Minimalist but sleek rooms, comfortable beds. Morning time having the coffee on the outside patio. Evenings enjoying the lively rooftop bar. The location is perfect

Room was average size for NYC but modern and updated (Deluxe King with balcony - thanks Jose). It was nice to have the balcony and outdoor space with the room. The street notice was eliminated on the high floors.Staff was excellent and accommodating.Will return.

We happened to stay at Hotel Henri on points BUT would defiantly return and gladly pay for it, check-in was flawless, front desk staff a strong 10 ... shout-out to Natalie for recommending quiet & cozy room 801 ... Location is ideal, 1/2 a block to Eataly for coffee/ food & rooftop ... Madison Square Park & NYC train stop ... MSG was walking distance along with many other NYC attractions ... a great spot for work / fun / family

As a first timer to NYC, the Hotel Henri was a great first experience. Checkin/out: Fast, efficient and friendly. Can’t fault in any way. Now onto the fees. The Henri charges a facility fee on top of the nightly rate and this is one of the reasons for the 4-star. I honestly can’t remember if this was shown at the time of booking, but either way, it’s a deceptive fee used by hotels to be able to lower the headline nightly rate. This old school practice is slowly disappearing but just make sure you factor this in as it’s still charged by the Henri.Room: Spacious in NYC standards (or so I’m told). Modern and well equipped. The shower leaked badly, soaking the floor. Lots of mould in the shower as well. This seems to be in multiple other reviews, so hopefully management take note, as it slightly lets down an otherwise perfect room.Noise: Seems to be mentioned in multiple other reviews. You will hear horns, sirens, trucks etc. But it’s downtown NYC, so it’s to be expected and the street the Henri is on is a less busy at night than the surrounds. We didn’t find it bothered us at all.Location: Perfect location. Close to so many of the sights and close to the subway to take you to those further away.

Had a wonderful stay at the Henri. The rooms are comfortable, the staff was extremely helpful, and the roof top bar was fantastic. If you are in this part of manhattan I very much recommend. I plan to be back in December!!

Beautiful hotel, great room and a great value. Since I was traveling on business the only downside for me was the work area wasn't large enough for both the room phone and my laptop at the same time, otherwise a great place to stay. Will likely be my goto choice in the future when traveling to the area.

I spent here 5 nights on a business trip. Warm reception and fast check in process. Ok size room, same as bathroom, both nicely decorated. No view (see pic) but this might be an advantage in NY, extremely quiet at night. Comfy bed, I couldn’t say the same for the pillows, too hard and high for my taste, rather uncomfortable. Overall a good option (a bit pricey though, but this is NY after all) with a superb location, 2 mins walking from Flatiron building, shops, restaurants, subway station etc.

Had a last minute business trip and was lucky enough to stay at the hotel Henri. The check in with Natalie was smooth, simple, and early followed by a pleasant experience with Carlos the bellman who was very helpful in recommending places to eat, he even offered sites to see. Room was comfortable and cozy and the Continental breakfast was a life saver as I ran to my first meeting. Great accommodations and a great staff. Will be back on my next visit.

We just had a wonderful 5 night stay at Hotel Henri. Huge thanks to Melissa for accommodating our early check in, very much appreciated. A great location on W 24th St, right down the street from popular Eataly. Staff were always friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.

Forgetful staff, service was terrible. Breakfast continental was beyond disappointing.Rooms are also very small, and be prepared to wait 5 minutes or more sometimes to use the lifts. Overall a terrible experience.

We enjoyed our stay especially because we needed to work one day from NYC and they have a section on the 1st floor where you can sit and work. The location was very convenient too. I would definitely go back!

My husband and I stayed one night at this hotel last weekend. While it is a small boutique hotel, the staff went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. Melissa, at the front desk gave us recommendations for lunch and coupons for complimentary drinks at their rooftop bar. She was enthusiastic and helpful. The room itself was clean with a comfortable king bed and an updated bathroom. The Keurig coffeemaker was a nice touch. Complimentary continental breakfast was also a pleasant surprise.

The hotel is comfortable and clean with decent mattresses, sheets, and towels. There is complementary wi-fi. The complementary breakfast is minimal, but the two free drinks at the rooftop bar were very nice. It can be a little noisy at night, but that is to be expected in NY.

Our trip is off to a great start. Melissa at the front desk is an absolute sweetheart. My boyfriend needed to put a medical product in the fridge before check in time and she took care of us right away and was very professional. I was also impressed that she took the time to connect with us and make us feel special on the first day of our trip. Thank you so much for your help, Melissa! You have a great employee Hotel Henri. (Also the room is beautiful and very clean.)

We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Henri. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooftop lounge was cute and the bar staff were great. The lounge food came from the Greek restaurant on the lower level and was very tasty. Our room was modern, clean and well appointed. Location was great as well - short walk to great food and Madison Square Garden.

It's a jijji boutique feel hotel. Totally made good by its excellent friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Close to the heart of the city, it was perfect for our three day family stay. Time square easily walk-able as was so much of the great Manhattan attractions.

A great botique hotel in the flat iron district. Anything you need is within walking distance. The staff are very attentive. They have umbrellas available to use and free exercise pass access to a 5 star gym facility.

Great 3 nite stay. Property modernized and well kept. Staff very helpful and friendly. Wonderful location. Reasonably priced for NYC. Walking distance to lots of attractions, parks, public transportation, i.e., subway and buses.

I travel to NYC frequently for business and whenever possible, I stay at the Hotel Henri. The location is perfect for me...Flatiron district, just far enough away from the madding tourist crowds and very well situated for mass transit use. Staff is always very friendly and welcoming. Rooms are clean, quiet, and the air conditioning works all year round! (a must-have for me). Like most NYC hotels, the rooms are on the small side, but are quite well appointed. My only specific wish is that they had full-size ironing boards available for use. I am there on business and need to be wrinkle-free...which can be extremely difficult to achieve on the little tiny boards provided. Overall...the Hotel Henri is my favorite place to stay for my frequent NYC trips.

I stayed at the Hotel Henri overnight on September 21 while visiting my daughter in NYC. I have stayed at several places, but this hotel has been the best by far. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. On check in, I met Melissa and she was very welcoming and was able to have me in my room very quickly, as I had arrived earlier than the 3:00 PM check in. Your first impression of a place is the first person you meet, well Melissa was the best! I will definitley be staying at the Hotel Henri again. Oh, and i forgot to mention, the area of the hotel, the Flat Iron district is great.

Located in the flatiron district this hotel is an easy walk to almost everything in the city. The rooms are small but clean and uncluttered -- but most importantly they are really quiet, which is hard to find in the city! The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. I have stayed here several times in the past and will continue to stay when I travel to the city for both fun and work!

Jose at the front desk was very accommodating when I arrived 9 hours before check in by moving quickly to secure me a room and making sure i was taken care of. The hotel is great and rooms are good sized - especially by NYC standards!

Jose was great and got me checked in early. Was a rainy day. Welcomed me with a fresh cup of water and offered a coffee. Very helpful with directions and recommendations for local pizza places which were delicious

Loved hotel. It has a boutique feel (with only 8 rooms on a floor) for a modern chain hotel and located in Chelsea on the west side of manhattan in between, and close to, theatre and downtown with the train only a couple of blocks away. As we walked into a very small lobby we were greeted with warm smile and checked in quickly. There are only 2 elevators so I found that we had to wait for it each time we used it. The room was small but very clean with a small modern updated bathroom. The nice robe left in the bathroom was also a nice touch as was the dental and personal hygiene kits which you often don’t see anymore in hotels. Febreze has been sprayed in room so it smelled fresh and clean. The continental breakfast was also free for rewards guests so sign up for the reward program. We grabbed muffins/pastry juice coffee and fruit. Lastly I left me cell phone charger in the room when I checked out. When I called 2 days later they located the charger in lost and found and held for me at front desk so my kids could pick it up for me. All in all I recommend this hotel highly. Only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is for small rooms and elevator wait time.

The hotel restaurant, "Mykonos Blue Grill" is exceptionally good! Greek food is one of my favorites, and I was unexpectedly surprised by how fresh, flavorful and authentic the food at Mykonos Blue Grill is. The service was also excellent! I totally recommend giving this little hotel restaurant your attention.

The location of the hotel is excellent and the beds are comfortable. The bar on the top floor has a lovely view, although it gets very noisy later in the evening. Mostly, however, the hotel was a big disappointment. The wifi is weak and unreliable. The closet and desk are minuscule: absolutely not recommended for anyone who needs to work in his or her room. The cleaning of the rooms was also lax: I had to let someone know at the front desk that the bathroom had not been properly cleaned, and the sheets were never changed during my four-night stay. I left my room one morning before 9 a.m. and the bed had still not been made when I came back at 4 p.m.! The major problem I had with the room was noise. The room itself was not noisy, but the the one that I booked for my mother, which faced onto the street, was intolerably loud from very early in the morning. And Saturday night the halls and rooms adjacent to mine were unbearably loud from drunken hotel guests. The front desk is also not well trained: I was put on hold at one point, left there and, after I hung up, was never called back. At these prices, I expect something better.

This hotel is generally ok. The bathroom was a nice size, the shower was great, and the bed was pretty comfortable. Don't go looking for a view unless you want to look into someone's office. The minibar/fridge was not cold. I called to complain and was told, "well, it's meant to be more like a cooler." Ok, it wasn't cool, which meant we definitely didn't want to drink anything from it (Red Bull, champagne, wine). The wait staff at the Mykonos Grill weren't very friendly and the food is seriously overpriced for what you get. We didn't get our 10% off for being hotel guests. I guess you have to ask for it?The absolute worst thing about this place is the $25 per night "facility" fee that the folks on the Wyndham member hotline failed to tell me about when booking. If you look at what the fees are for on their website- water, access to a gym down the street, and some more water - it's a total rip-off and wasn't expected. Had I known that, I would have booked a different/cheaper hotel on a street that doesn't always smell like garbage (not all streets smell like garbage in NYC, but this one does).

Omg where do i start with thia hotel. Trip from ireland to nyc started as a nitemare as our flight out got cancelled. Lost a night in this fab hotel that we had already paid for. When we got there we were so happy with everything. The place is spotless the staff are amazing. Penthouse bar amazing. Barmen up there so lovely. Special shout out to james and melissa on reception. 2 of the nicest people we met in nyc. This hotel is so central. I have recommended to all my friends back home and i believe one of them has already booked your hotel for nov/dec time. Well done guys keep up the good work. We had a really special time and ye made a near disaterous holiday very special xxx thank u all xx

I was staying in New York for a business / pleasure trip. I had checked on the Wyndham site for hotels near Manhatten but not to close as to get the noises. I found Hotel Henri. Its only a 30-45 minute cab ride from La Guardia or JFK depending on traffic of course. The hotel itself is very clean from street view and also upon entering. It is a small hotel with a greek restaurant located on premises.the rooms all appear to be the same size and that size is very small, not so small that it discourages you but if your used to larger rooms this is not your place. The rooms come with a comfortable queen size bed which pretty much fills the entire room. the bathroom is also quite compact but usable. There is a mini fridge but it is filled with mini bar materials meaning no room for your own drinks or leftovers you might carry home. There is a safe, ironing board with iron available in the room. The exterior noises were non existent from my room #901. the down sides, during the evening there are get togethers on the roof top bar and that traffic can have an impact on the elevators, we waited 10 minutes for 1 of the 2 elevators to finally arrive to the lobby. the shower is going to leak onto the bathroom floor no matter what you! its a design flaw. the entire floor in our room was vinyl flooring which in my opinion might be easier and more cost effective to maintain but isnt appropriate for a hotel room. you can literally feel every grain of dirt and sand as you walk. now remember the shower does leak/ flood the bathroom floor so that wet floor extends all the way into your bedroom area and your feet become a mop for the dirt on the floor.i had to rinse my feet off after I had showered just to put socks on, not good.bottom line, its a nice hotel, very trendy, close to restaurants and time square even by foot.if they could fix the shower so it doesnt create a mess and add area rugs to the rooms I would give it 5 stars.

Wyndham's fine print says you may be charged additional local fees, and we were ($25/day, in addition to NYC tax). Did not find out until it appeared on our credit card. The front desk explained it, but it would have been nice to know up front when we checked in. Otherwise, the hotel is in a GREAT location, with nice-looking rooms and friendly service. This was our second stay and we will keep it on our short list for future trips to New York.

We stayed 4 nights at the end of August. The location was good as it was not far from the subway and was conveniently located near local amenities such as shops and bakeries. The rooftop bar here was good and had nice views of the sunset. The room was spacious and comfortable and we were happy with our stay until check out.
