We were told at check out about a Facility fee (for the apparent facilities that are at this hotel?) but had not been told about this at check in nor had we been told when we booked through a booking site - laterooms - the amount we were sent in the confirmation was the price we were paying! The lady said there was nothing more to pay and that was that until my husband checked his statement today to discover the fee added on! A bit of honesty would have been nice as this is a bit cheeky adding the fee on without our knowledge! We would have returned here as we enjoyed our stay but this has put us off. The money has been refunded but that's not the point. It's the deception which we do not expect from a hotel like this.

This hotel is in a good location for exploring Chelsea, Lower Manhattan and The Village. The Staff is super friendly and the rooms are very clean and comfortable with a very modern feel. Don't miss the rooftop outside view from the lounge. The Restaurant specializes in Greek fare. Very fresh. Continental breakfast with fresh pastry and good coffee.

Fantastic and very polite staff, great location. Next to the lobby there is a Greek grill-restaurant with delicious traditional Greek food and excellent staff as well. Cosy rooms with modern design. Best choice!

Hotel Henri was a nice stay for a girls weekend. The rooms are small but what would you expect in NYC. We fit three woman comfortably. We thought the location was pretty good. We walked to Time Square. I was inmpressed how dark the rooms were for sleeping and how quiet it was. We were located on the 5th floor. They have an agreement with a garage a couple buildings down and its cost 40 bucks per 24 hrs. You also get free entry into an elite gym.

Swanky yet understated, the perfect set up for a fun business trip. I found it to be just the right size for a single traveler or a couple's weekend getaway. Great roof top lounge space too. While I did see a family of tourists I have a hard time seeing a comfortable accomodation for a family of four.

Excellent Hotel! I will stay here every time I’m in New York. The hotel and rooms are very clean and so nice. The location is great for anything you want to do from shopping to sightseeing. Subway access is really close!

Stayed here two weeks ago and was very pleased. Super clean hotel and very friendly/ helpful staff. The location was perfect and really great views! Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Had an amazing stay from the second I walked in. Extremely helpful and nice staff, helped with any questions we had about the city. Modern and trendy rooms with beautiful bathrooms, also very clean rooms. Can’t wait to book this hotel for my next trip to the city !

I stay here for business quite a bit as it is in my target neighborhood. I would recommend this hotel with only one exception. If you think you are going to have to do a lot of work on your laptop the provided desk area is very tiny and not conducive to 'spreading out'! Additionally the color scheme is quite dark in the hotel and rooms. I love it for sleeping and relaxing. Not so much when putting on makeup. The penthouse bar is terrific to have a pre dinner cocktail or meet a client. Super friendly staff. I stay here frequently. Safe in a nice area of Chelsea.

James is the man! Attentive and thoughtful service with humor and engagement. Made me feel at home. Great room, clean and modern. Convenient to Madison Square, Flatiron, Chelsea and all the midtown Manhattan attractions.

It is a small hotel, but the staff is friendly. The room is on the cozy side, but nice and it has comfortable beds. The parking is not in the same building, but down the street. There is also a restaurant on the first floor.

Don't waste your money on this so called "4 star" property.. I'm sure there are many better hotels in the nearby vicinity that will be better than Hotel Henri.This is probably the first hotel in my review that I am giving a 1star.. it truly says how terrible the service is here...Stayed here for 9 nights in total.. 3 nights first and then 2 weeks later 5 nights..The first 3 nights were decent, nothing out of the ordinary and that is why we decided to get this same hotel for 5nights when we were returning to NYC after 2 weeks of touring other cities.. and that was a bad decision 1) On the 3rd day just before exiting the hotel for our tour, we informed the front desk to send someone to our room for housekeeping.. when we got back that night the room was not cleaned, only the blanket was made (the bed sheet underneath was not!!) and none of the towels or the water was replaced.. I called them and they sent me some towels2) 4th day, before leaving the hotel we inform the front desk, please send someone to our room for housekeeping, because she seemed busy, I did not say anything about the room not being cleaned night before.. that night when we returned back to the room.. the room was not cleaned at all.. they did not even enter the room.. 3) 5th day, before leaving the hotel, I went up to the lady on the front desk and in a very courteous manner told her that my room has not been cleaned since 2 days and if they could please send someone to my room for housekeeping... the lady without showing any remorse.. looked straight in my eyes and said "ok"... I looked at are with shock that she did not even had the courtesy to apologize for this issue.... that night when we returned.. our room was not cleaned.... there was a cleaning cloth that was left on the table which seemed like the housekeeping team decided to leave it there for maybe us to clean.. but nothing was cleaned.. the beds were not made, towels not replaced..3 nights in a row.. room was not cleaned in this 4 star WYNDHAM property..On the 6th day (morning 10am) of our checkout, I called the housekeeping and the front desk.. but no one answered the call.. then I had to go out and find a housekeeper to give me some towels and water (she promised to come back with water in 10mints.. but I did not see her or the water till I checked outAlso, when I told the same lady at the front desk that I will need someone to help me with the bags as I have 5bags, wife has a broken foot and accompanied by a 4year old.. she looks straight into my eyes and says that there is no one who can help me and pointed towards a trolley and said that I have to bring my bags by myself.....To all the people thinking about staying here.. please don't waste your money (like I did) on this namesake 4star WYNDHAM property..I did leave a message for the housekeeping manager.. let's see if they are bothered to reply back with real reasons as to why we were treated this way.. or just copy paste their "scripted" reply

Beautiful property and the service is outstanding. We were able to drop our luggage at the hotel early in the morning. Our reservation included breakfast and the hotel has a reasonably priced restaurant. Other restaurants are next door and supermarkets 1-2 blocks away. We got a room on the 15th floor and the location is not in a busy road at night so thankfully no city noise.Highly recommended!!

I'm also leaving this review (which I almost never do) because I got stuck in one of the elevators at 10:30PM. I hit the alarm button numerous times and got no response. I tried to use the call button but it cut off the first time. Then I reconnected with someone who said the fire department was on their way. I left a review about this through their wifi portal but I was pretty disappointed that no one took the time to reach out to me about that experience. It was a crappy 45 minutes. Hope they check their elevators from time to time.

This was our first trip to NYC and really did not have any idea where to stay. I truly lucked out with this hotel. Clean, quiet, great location close to subway access and restaurants. Hotel Henri has a "rooftop" open air area that is really nice to sit and enjoy drinks after a long day touring the city. I would definitely stay there again.

I absolutely enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was close proximity to fifth Avenue and clubs. The rooms are a bit smaller compared to other hotels. Overall, I will recommend this hotel. Also, checkout the restaurant at this hotel. The food is pretty good

I recently spent two nights at the hotel. The good points: (a) the room was clean and (b) the original price per the written reservation was fair.The bad points: (a) the room was very small, (b) the room was poorly designed, (c) the closet was not as deep as the hangers inside the closet and as a result, I could not slide the closet door closed, (d) the ironing board in the closet was designed to sit on a table top, but I could not find a table top where it would fit (too many attached things on the table tops in my room), (e) loud noise from the street began very early in the morning and woke me up, (f) either the building had settled or the person who constructed my room messed up as the bathroom door frame did not fit the door (I was afraid if I closed it I couldn't reopen it), (g) I reserved my room through Wyndham and per there written confirmation the "total for stay" was $390.63. That total include $56.31 in tax. The hotel billed me $425.05. I pointed this out to the desk clerk who explained I was billed an extra $15.00 each night as a facility fee and $1.33 tax each night on the facility fee. I pointed out that my reservation specified a total cost of the stay that was $390.63. He did not change my bill. I guess total means something else to them than it did to me. Such charges should be clearly specified at the time of reservation.

Travelling to New York City Flatiron district? This is a nice, clean place to stay. It's a small hotel with small rooms but the staff is very friendly and the place is very quiet and clean. I do not recommend the Sir Henri Penthouse Rooftop lounge, received terrible service and almost no beverage in my very expense glass of ice! Stay here, but had your after-work drink someplace else.

I was in town for some meetings and stayed over the weekend to see friends and have my wife join to visit the NY sites. The hotel feels like a boutique hotel more than a Wyndham - with cozy but updated rooms, a small breakfast area serving muffins and fruit with coffee from a pot, and a stylish rooftop lounge on the 18th floor that has a bar and lounge to chill after a day of meetings or to meet friends.The rooms have a keurig-style coffee maker and come stocked with a mini fridge and multiple snacks. The bathrooms have been updated and are roomy enough with a shelf and hooks to hold your stuff, and plenty of hot water.The staff is helpful and very accommodating, they really care about your stay.The only dings I would put on the hotel is that for 2 of the 3 nights of our stay the rooftop bar and lounge had private parties - which meant hotel guests were out of luck in using the lounge. I told the hotel about this and they gave me some drink coupons, which was very nice. But my plans to meet my friends there got scuttled. The other ding would be on the breakfast bar which was pretty weak in terms of offering.

Great hotel, clean room and bathroom. Amazing location. Service was excellent, every one was very friendly and kind. We didnt have any inconvenient during our stay. We even received a present for our Anniversary! Highly recommendable!

This was my fist time staying at this hotel and I would definitely stay again. The outside was beautiful and inviting, they checked us in early so we did not have to store our bags (which they offered to, should the room need more time) and when I had a friend meet me for cocktails, she had a lovely sitting area to hang out until I was able to come and bring her to the rooftop bar. The drinks were delicious and we were excited to have a free ticket to try a more adventurous cocktail!

I recently spent a week in NY at Hotel Henri and whilst I didn’t spend that much time in the hotel I can safely say that what I encountered of the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms and other public spaces was really very good. The lobby is quite tight, the rooms are maybe a little small but really that didn’t represent an issue and is to be expected in an existing building. The room was clean, quiet and considered in the design and equipped adequately with some nice choices for the minibar and snacks. Whilst the lobby was small it was also friendly and welcoming with personality and a nice ambiance fronted by very pleasant and helpful staff. The hotel is really well located for the Flatiron/5th Avenue district and is a great point to explore from. Just wish I’d had time to test the food on offer which looked appetizing but maybe next time.

1) They have no one to assist with parking in this busy part of NYC2) They charged me $75 for 'incidentals which they said would be refunded and .. 2 weeks later still no refund. They claimed it is their policy to charge $100 (then why did they charge me $75?). It sounds like they intentionally pad the bill and hope the customer doesn't notice. And then - still no refund.

A very nice hotel, comfortable rooms, nice area. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Stayed overnight and had a wonderful time. Will stay here again in the near future. Have to visit the roof top lounge, a MUST.

From the moment I walked in the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are about what you would expect in NY size wise. Would definitely recommend.

We stayed just for a night. The hotel is truly with their name as 'boutique' hotel where all the spaces are quite small but efficient. The location is right in the middle, easy to get to both ways of NY. It is short distance (2-3 blocks) to subway to get anywhere. The hotel does not have parking onsite but they work with IM Parking company for their guests to park there (only 4 doors down) where it costs $40 over night (we came in around 3pm and left the parking around 4pm next day). Another good thing to mention is that the hotel allows guests to check out but keep their bags at site until they are ready to leave town.

The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was very clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Hotel is relatively small so very little hallway noise. Overall great place to stay. Great location as well!

The hotel was close enough to subways, hop on hop off bus pick up points, Empire State building and Flatiron building. The room was clean and of a decent size. The luggage storage was a bonus especially if you have a late flight. The penthouse is a nice place to chill and relax. It was definitely value for buck. We were happy with our choice. Thank you Hotel Henri for a pleasant stay.

Stayed at Hotel Henri for two nights in July. Great location, comfortable, clean and very attentive staff. Free water, coffee maker in room and breakfast is a big plus. Rooms are perfect and great value for your money. Highly recommend staying here if you want to be in Flatiron district.

The hotel was very clean and it was very convenient to everything including a park. Loved it! Water was free and they responded to requests very quickly. The flatiron bldg was very close as well as other landmarks.

I absolutely enjoyed my stay at Hotel Henri!! the service was excellent, all the staff members were amazing, and my room was clean and amazing as well. I would definitely recommend you everyone to stay at this hotel!!

I often travel for business, and when I come to nyc I stay at Hotel Henri. This time I was able to stay using my Wyndham points. I received 2 drink vouchers at check in, which came in handy since I met a client at Sir Henri Rooftop Bar. The staff go out of their way for you even though I don’t really need anything. It was time I left a review.

I booked last minute through bookings.com, when I arrived I was greeted by the staff, the front desk were charming and are really knowledgeable of where to go in the city, I was given direction for lounges, the one I was highly recommended to, 235 rooftop, I encountered celebrities! How awesome was that!

Now my 3rd stay at the hotel and love this place.... Reception and concierge are friendly and helpful, breakfast on the ground floor in the morning was included and just the right start to the day - Love the Illy coffee. rooms are great - modern with great lighting and the rooms on the 16th Floor that have balconies are well worth the extra $$. The new GM has really got this place going well. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC.... the location is perfect for all midtown meetings / sight seeing.

Recently stayed at this property while visiting NYC. It was a Last minute booking, friendly and knowledgeable staff from the minute you first arrive, restaurant right on main floor, comfy bed and clean room. Will recommend further.

The staff was great. Room was good. Great location to walk or take the subway anywhere. I would/will stay at this location again. Had a balcony room although not much of a view. Was very nice to sit there in the evening with some wine.

We got there at 7 in the morning and they gave us our room. The rooms were a little small but that's Manhattan so I was expecting it. The rooms had tiles on the floor which I loved and no carpet. The staff were very nice and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

This was a great nice relaxing hotel ...Friendly staffBeautiful Rooms..Great rooftop flowI must say this is the most nice hotel I have ever been in.. Great for couples...Close to everything great food ...You won't be disappointed

Don't read neg reveiws this is a great hotel. Its located in walking distance to Herald Sq,Times Sq,Chelsea Market and West Village. Very quiet and modern room. Clean and can accommodate two adults easy.

I have had two great 3-night stays in June 2018 and plan two more in both July and August. I travel on consulting assignments and work in the financial district, but this hotel and location work very well for me. Great room, excellent service, responsive staff, and quiet time for sleeping! Great combination!

We were a group of 4 (3 adults and 1 child) who stayed at the Hotel Henri in New York City for 9 days (June 15 through 23, 2018).Though the rooms were somewhat small, they were comfortable and the location of the hotel was excellent: in a nice neighborhood with easy access to uptown sites as well as good shopping, restaurants nearby.What really made our stay so pleasant though, was the staff at the front desk (indeed, all the staff working reception were most helpful).From the start we had an issue with our reservation because of a missed flight and our travel agency. James worked to correct the issue and soon had us checked in to our rooms.All the staff I came in contact with was pleasant but I must say that the staff working in reception was exceptional! They provided excellent customer service.Throughout our stay, I asked countless questions of the hotel reception staff and they consistently provided the information with a smile and pleasant demeanor. They even sometimes went above and beyond to help (like when Jose went out of his way to go home in order to check out an ice cream truck for us!)Kudos to James, Jose, Denny, Chuck, Carlos and Stephan for their unfailing patience, kind attention and warm, approachable attitudes.Would definitely stay at Hotel Henri again!

1) The staff & service at Hotel Henri is excellent.2) Your telephone customer service rates a 1 on a scale of 1-10. I travel frequently for work (both internation & domestic). Wyndham's phone CS is abysmal & a consistently wastes my time.3) If the Hotel Henri's staff was not excellent, I would use my corporate Marriott account.Thank you,Janet M Harouse917 509 5043

Let me just say, the service was impressive and not at all what I was expecting even in a boutique hotel.  Denny at the main desk was genuinely kind and helpful, all about service.  The hotel itself felt small but I was happy with the room size even after reading some reviews.  I did hear little noise in the hallway but it was a Friday night.  Over all I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to coming back.

Location and the bed were great - very comfy and good night's sleep.Service was not amazing, had to ask 3 times in 36 hours to get a broken coffee machine fixed which was not ideal. The breakfast was poor for a 4 star hotel, with limited buffet offering options of just pastries and cereal and no healthy options. The staff there even seemed a bit embarrassed about it.Rooms are strange design - trying to be artsy, but come across a bit tacky with strange wallpaper. Lighting was nice though. Overall, an ok hotel but there's better 4 star options in New York.

Excellent location - close to the subway and great restaurants. The service was fabulous at their rooftop bar (the staff could not be more accommodating). The complimentary breakfast was a little bit skimpy, but I may be used to European style at this point. The front desk and concierge staff were delightful. Our rooms were well appointed. This boutique hotel is well worth the look and a bargain when compared to the W, where I usually stay.

Great stay with the girls! Staff was more then helpful and friendly, never felt like a bother with my many questions. Breakfast was a nice touch especially since it's served till 11am. Parking was also very convenient. We recieved a discounted rate at a local garage a few doors down from the hotel. Already looking forward to my next visit.

I like the location. The hotel Greek restaurant was delicious. The bed caved in. The shower leaked water. The walls are paper thin and you can hear when a neighbor opens and closes their door. If the neighbor is loud you hear everything all hours of the night because the hallways are so small. Rooms are very small.

ALL of the staff and especially Chuck, Denni, and Carlos were friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and very calm under pressure. I had a special weekend planned for my wife and Chuck helped me make it happen even better than I planned by helped my me purchase some surprise gifts. Mike made sure that our items during check in and check out were cared for. Our room was nicely decorated and perfect size, I also really appreciate the fact that the bathroom has a ventilation fan to keep moisture out of the bathroom helping to keep it really clean. We are really looking forward to staying at Hotel Henri again as soon as possible!

I stayed at Hotel Henri for one night this past weekend and must say it's the first time I remember being surprised by a hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. While the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was quite small with everything seemingly in miniature. The bathroom was half of normal size with a single sink and small counter; the shower was very small and would not accommodate a large person. The desk was half of a normal size. There was a small space between the front of the bed and the wall to walk to the other side. The floor of the room was a cold tile rather than carpet, which likely has benefits in terms of cleaning. The innovative and creative lighting and decor felt very trendy and cool and I was impressed by how much they fit in such a small area. I was fine by myself but if my husband was with me, we would have been maneuvering around each other to get to the bathroom, bed, etc. I met a couple there who had also relied on Trip Advisor reviews and had the same impression. We wondered if we had each just had the bad luck of getting a postage stamp sized room but concluded that every floor and every room was the same size based on the structure of the hotel. Small rooms seem to be the trend and are fine if that's what you expect. A continental breakfast is served in the Rooftop lounge and is free if you book directly through Wyndham. I enjoyed coffee and the view although the cereals and baked goods are not what I enjoy for breakfast.Rereading this review, it sounds very negative, which was not my intention. Just want to alert people to the compact nature and small size of the rooms so they are not surprised at check in as I was.

We had a room on the 15fh floor that was quiet and relaxing. Loved the rooftop lounge for a drink or two before heading out on the town!! Very comfortable and not far from transportation to Midtown and othe points around Manhattan. We will stay here again!

The staff was friendly and helpful in every way imaginable. They had great recommendations for restaurants, tours and always greeted us no matter where we were in the hotel. Jose, Dillon and James always had a great smile for us in the lobby with helpful info and directions. Fernando was a super friendly face around the hotel and very informative of the area. This hotel was the right size for a couple or small family. The rooms were nice and neat. The street wasn’t busy and centrally locates to all sites.

Scored a great rate for a weekend escape for wife's birthday at Hotel Henri. Awesome location, walking distance to lots of great restaurants and sight seeing. Staff was super friendly, special shout out to the evening weekend team for the great recommendations! will be back!

2nd stay here, which says a fair bit. Friendly staff, Good AC and a good shower. Rooms a bit on the small side, but this is Manhattan so no biggie.Here's the thing though. The WiFi is complimentary, as are the water bottles in the room. And I didn't need to sign up to their loyalty programme to get this. Chicago Hilton, take note. COMPLIMENTARY. As in 'thanks for staying, have something on us'. There's a great Greek restaurant next door too. Do your stomach a favour: Go there.

I visited New York for a conference and this hotel was perfect for business travelers. It was quiet, on a side street yet centrally located to stores, restaurants, pharmacies, all within walking distance. The rooftop breakfast that was included was a great place to start the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back for business or a pleasure trip to New York. It's an easy stroll to Penn Station also.

Absolutely loved our stay here. Outstanding service, top quality rooms, and perfect location. Definitely would stay here again. Our friends loved the available amenities and everyone was well rested after sight seeing in the city. Highly reccomend

This is an amazing hotel! The check in was quick and they even let us check in earlier because our room was ready. the breakfast was a great added bonus. To be able to sit in the penthouse and enjoy my coffee while standing on the balcony was a great start to our day before exploring the city all day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City.

It was my first time staying here and i loved it. The staff is truly amazing and the drinks upstairs on the roof are top notch. I loved how your room is very dark and it feels like you can sleep all day. I needed this time to refuel and reconnect with my husband Hotel Henri was our home away from home this past weekend. I wish surely reccomend it to my friends and family.

I had a very nice stay at this hotel. I was afraid that the rooms would be too small but they were perfect for myself and my husband. The front desk were especially warm and friendly and never too busy to assist with any questions you had. The bar was very nice but a bit too noisy to have an actual conversation. The breakfast was included and a nice way to get your day started. We will return again.

I had an enjoyable stay at this unique Wyndham property. I usually stay at Wyndham Gardens but this place was very different. Small rooms but well designed with a boutique feel. Service stood out the most as the staff couldn't be more helpful with my questions and request. The rooftop bar Henri was a nice touch as was the Greek restaurant. I would definitely recommend it and the price was terrific.

Have stayed in NYC numerous times - this was my first stay in Hotel Henri....but definitely not my last!!! Hotel is lovely and more than meets all requirements. Staff extremely friendly & helpful. The location is excellent. Definitely worth a stay.

Very friendly and service-oriented staff. Rooms were surprisingly large for NYC. Great location with easy walk to Flatiron, Union Square. Plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood. The rooftop bar was kinda neat but could have used a few more lights. It doubles as the breakfast bar in the morning. Pretty decent continental offering.

Loved the room it was stylish and modern and most important very clean. The staff was very friendly, professional and super helpful. Breakfast exceeded my expectations. Will definetly be back and already recommended it to friends.

I recently stayed at the Hotel Henri and let me just say everything was amazing ! Excellent customer service, clean stylish rooms and great location. I appreciated all he help I received from the front desk staff Stephanie and a Chuck. They assured with any request I had from dinner plans to car service back to the airport. Will definitely stay here again and recommend this property.! Thanks again guys !

I have to say this may be one of my favorite hotels in NYC! Perfect location, The staff was wonderful and always so helpful. Room was cozy and had everything I needed. The in room Keurig is a great touch for a coffee drinker such as myself. Will be back :-)

We traveled for a family wedding and had a great stay at the Hotel Henri. The hotel is excellent and we will return as soon as possible. Rooms were excellent and location is brilliant. Have to mention how nice and extraudinarily helpful all the staff were / are.We will certainly be back

Hotel was very clean, staff were all pleasant and helpful. Rooms were very well kept and clean. The rooms felt very homey, more like your own personal studio apartment. The serve a continental breakfast which was more than enough for breakfast. There is a rooftop bar and small patio there as well. Times Square and Madison Square Gardens just a few minutes away, you can walk or a cab would get you there for less than $8. Overall I give this hotel very high reviews, I would definitely stay there again.

Wonderful elegant hotel. The rooms were great and the bathrooms were outstanding and very much updated. The hotel itself is in a great location for where I needed to be so the walk was short and very senic.

The locations is fantastic. The service is great the staff are very helpful and respectful , they exceeded my expectations and treated me great. The front desk staff, and others were very accommodating. The room was quiet and the bed amazing.Thank you to all for making my recent visit memorable.

Hotel is small but nice. Rooms are very modern, bathrooms are updated.The only thing I would suggest is more lighting inside the rooms. Better to have more light then not enough.I would recommend this hotel. It’s in a good location.I recommended it to a colleague

A day trip into Manhattan for a business meeting turned into a last minute overnight stay. From the intial call to make a reservation, to the check in with Frankie to the overall experience -simple yet clean and thoughful guestrooms, super helpful staff and awesome location, Hotel Henri cannot be beat! Will return with the girlfriend's birthday next month!

This hotel has really great staff, from the housekeeping ladies to the front desk people. I was able to check in to my room early and go on about my day. I had breakfast in the bar area but I hoped they included some hot items to get you started. My room was small but very well designed and it was perfect for me since i was traveling alone. I didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but I promise that when I return I will definitely have dinner there. The only negative thing about this hotel is the small lobby but other than that it is so perfect.

Great spot. Clean, well furnished and well equipped rooms. Helpful and attentive staff. I forgot my comb - someone on staff went out and bought one for me and left it in my room. Great value compared to some of the other hotels I've stayed in in Midtown. The one thing that lets it down is the breakfast. I'll definitely recommend it to my colleagues.

I'm not usually one to post reviews but I had a really great business trip at Henry that I just had to follow through. I stayed almost a week ago and although the hotel was clearly busy with people coming and going, the reception desk team was super helpful and eager to assist. I was even impressed with the cleaning crew who were just as polite, Rooms were small but well designed, it actually has a nice boutique feel. My first time at this hotel but not likely to be my last.

Hotel is relatively small with few rooms per floor. Convenient to everything in Chelsea. Hotel is kept clean and bed is comfortable. Staff are all helpful. Walls are relatively thin- can hear when your neighbor is showering or coming in/out of room.

We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.Frank was courteous, helpful and gracious. We were allowed to park our car in front of the hotel for an hour, so we could get ready for an evening event. The room was small, no view, but had a contemporary, spirited decor. I especially liked the laminated floor, which is much more hygienic than a carpet. The shower was excellent and the bed very comfortable. The sink in the bathroom was a bit too small, but there was a nice shelf tor toiletries.All staff members were friendly including the porter, the lady at the breakfast room and the checkout person Chick.The breakfast was simple, but of quality. Parking at the garage 40 meters away was convenient and inexpensive by New York standards, USD 40 for 24 hours, since the facility had a contract with the hotel.

James was there our entire stay. Seriously dedicated and made our stay awesome. Helped us with everything. Room was cool, james was cooler. If there was something I would remember it wouldn’t be the wallpaper wood it will be james. Give that man a raise.

I have stayed at the property a couple of times the last two months and I find it to be somewhat conveniently located but there are some problems with the property. First is the room itself be in very dark from natural sunlight and not adequately having incandescent bulbs. Second well being small the use of spaces well-done but the quality of the bed it is marginal and the bathroom shower leaks onto the floor.With a little bit of work this hotel could shine.

This retrofit office/come hotel has small rooms, lumpy pillows, noisy a/c, loud and inconsiderate night time maintenance and disorganised staff. 2 of 3 nights staff was banging away restocking cupboards between 2-3am about 2 feet outside my bedroom door; even using his phone. One day room was never made up, wet towels left on floor. Couldn't use roof bar for meeting one day due to private event yet told ground floor bar would open for another hour. Room also felt like a dark bunker.. with super noisy a/c unit.

I stayed at Hotel Henri during a short business trip, and it exceeded all of my expectations. The hotel is located near the intersection of 6th Ave. and 24th St., a short walk away from many restaurants and amenities. My room was spotless and had a trendy minimalist design. Nearby street traffic was minimal, making for a peaceful sleep. The onsite penthouse cocktail lounge and Greek restaurant next door were added bonuses. The employees at reception were also highly responsive and helped book a cab for the return trip to the airport.Overall, I was impressed with the quality of accommodations and services offered. Would definitely recommend.

Pros: Great location. Modern design. Mini-bar equipped. Cons: The room is very very dark even if I turned on the every single light in the room.The door and window is very thin and it is very very VERY NOISY during the entire stay.Besides that, we were given 4th floor facing street even we asked for quite rooms and booked through Official website. Again, it is unacceptably noisy, and also no view.The rooftop is OK. The breakfast may or may not be complimentary given the booking status. I didn't try despite qualified. The gym is very far and it requires to get a paper from the hotel before heading there, which creates some inconvenience. The mini-bar is fully equipped, which is not very common recently. It can be good, but given the limited space, I won't suggest to have so many items inside and outside. Moreover, we tried to request a firm pillow but they took more than 30 minutes and two calls to send up 2 pillows which were very plush. On the second morning, the request for extra conditioners took even longer. The service could really be better.

They were supposed to charge my card $100 for incidentals but charged it over $600! The manager Maria refused to fix it and called security out because I refuted the charge. VERY unprofessional. Extremely inciting of a paying guest who had every right to be upset. Would not ever stay here again and would NEVER recommend it to anyone. Bait and switch "hotel" with no true amenities.

Good location, great Service, the room size was ok. One nigth we have some noise from the terrace, the bed was incredible and the check inn and out Service was so fast. I really recommend this hotel for a 3 to 4 days trip.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Room very quiet, bed and pillows great for sleeping. Nice continental breakfast buffet with all you could want - even fresh croissants, fruit and expresso! Roof top lounge has happy hour specials. Heat hit NYC the day I arrived, but the AC revved up quickly and the room was very comfy. Staff super friendly and helpful. Very clean and perfectly appointed. Small rooms (normal in NYC), but nice - and a king sized bed! Nothing lacking!

around midnight of my stay, someone knocked on my door multiple times, then used a key to enter the room, but my door latch was on thus they could not enter. When i called downstairs, the response was they had no idea why and who that was, and since they only had one person at front desk, nothing they can do about it. I would warn anyone to double think staying there for their own security sake.

My husband often stays in the hotel for business and I came out to join him for a weekend.The hotel was in a great location mainly because it was quiet but we could also walk everywhere. Our room was nice, it is a boutique style hotel and the room represents this. It was also quiet in the room and we slept really well.There are not really any amenities at this hotel. The roof top bar is lovely we went up there for a drink.I would stay here again and do would my husband.

Near Madison Square Park in Flat Iron neighborhood across from Eataly shopping mart. Walked down Broadway to Penn Station on a nice day in fifteen minutes or less. Near subway stops. Nice but pricey roof top bar with view of Freedom Tower.

I was there for 3 nights; HVAC did not work properly and the property solution was to turn it off and open the window facing a interior shaft filled with noisy mechanical equipment. Complained the second day and nothing happened. Bar was extremely expensive and staff seemed to be having more fun blaring music than the guest. Only one elevator was working.Drinks were mediocre and beer was warm.Overcharged for my stay, which after some time the property corrected. Only to find out I was DOUBLE CHARGED for my stay on top of the wrongful charge. After a month of phone calls I was finally told I was right but they couldn't fix the wrongful charge and that I needed to dispute it thru my credit card. Too many choices to put up with all the hassles. Stay at your own risk.

Loved the customer service from the staff, continental breakfast, free WiFi, and within walking distance to many places. Hotel needs to provide wash clothes, instead of hand towels, but mainly is a less squeaky bed for a comfortable night sleep. One thing I loved about the accessories in the room is the 'tin can' for lovers -- 1st time I had seen one in a room in a major city.

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary in the city and decided to treat ourselves to a overnight stay without the kids. I initially heard about Hotel Henri from a girlfriend who stayed there for business some time ago and raved about the location and service. All I have to say is WOW! Super friendly and professional staff- every single person we encountered from the bell staff to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, every employee took the time to say hello and ask us how we were enjoying our stay. We encountered a gentleman in the elevator who I believe was a manger, I'm so sorry I forgot his name, but he over heard us talking to our kids on the phone and would you believe he left us a bag of donuts with a note saying to "enjoying our time away together"! We felt like royalty! Now mind you, we don't typically get away much these days but its these details that really make a difference. The hotel is located near tons of great places to eat, close walking distance to shopping and MSG and a beautiful park on Madison Avenue. I wish we would have planned a longer stay but I'm happy to have a place to escape to this summer! Kudos to whoever is leading this team, well done!
Great location and comfortable rooms. Wheelchair accessible rooms should have handheld shower heads/hose.
Great location to where I was visiting and the rooms were clean and up to date. My wife and I enjoyed it. Restaurant was great too

This is a solid and recently remodeled hotel in Manhattan. Rooms are small, but not unusually so for NY and it is very clean and comfortable. Our only complaint is that (despite the management responses to other reviews) they clearly have an issue with the elevators. 1 (of 2) elevators worked with 17 floors of guest rooms, meaning a frequent long wait for the elevator.

Our stay at the Henri was great! The hotel is centrally located and close to transportation facilities! Our rooms were clean comfortable and generally inviting! The most impressive factor was the staff! Everyone was informative and helpful to us during our stay. Their courtesy and attention to details made our stay one we won’t soon forget! I would recommend the Henri to anyone who wants to be “in the middle of the action” without getting frazzled! Thanks to the Henri for a wonderful stay

I've stayed here several times since December for work. It is a really good location and close to subway which will take you anywhere. The lightning in the rooms is my main challenge. It is kind of dark and not great for working which is why I am in NYC. They lack a fitness room too and the breakfast is ok. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I like the upstairs lounge for a nightcap. If you don't plan to spend a ton of time in the hotel room than this would be a good place to stay. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean.

We were put on the 17th floor which right under the nightclub. Constant pounding music which we don't necessarily dislike but it goes on until 2:30AM. Then the staff drags the bar stools across the room during their cleanup which was noisier than the music. This goes on until 3:30AM. According to the person at the front desk that I complained to we should have been made aware of the night club above our floor.....WE WERE NOT NOTIFIED.....we would asked for a room change. As an accommodation, the resort fees were waived but being that we had 2 separate reservations only the 2nd reservation fees were waived. The one night reservation fee was not waived. On first day of service the room was barely cleaned.....sinks had coffee stains, floors not vacuumed, etc....on subsequent days the cleaning was satisfactory. I am the travel agent on record and at this point I am not comfortable booking this hotel for my clients, in spite of the excellent location.

The updates that have been made over the last few years are fantastic. I love the property, 17th floor lounge and the lower level bar area. I was however somewhat disappointed in the quality of the bed. No box spring, and a wooden bed frame makes for a loud night if you toss and turn while you sleep.

The hotel was underwhelming from the start, with rooms that were dark, small, and uninviting. The breakfast as well was underwhelming. Then one of the two elevators broke and it sometimes took 10 minutes to be able to get up or down from the 14th floor. We checked out after one night because the hotel was so bad.

Only one elevator Working, so the wait to use it was a little annoying, but we understood you were waiting for part to repair. Outside of that little glich, everything was fine, except did not have any decaf coffee for breakfast..

Rooms are cozy but very stylish and modern. Comfy bed and I like the bathroom. It is small but the shower is nice. Another great touch is the well stocked mini bar with nuts, chocolates, and liquor. HD TV is always nice too.What really separates this place though is the service. Chuck at the front desk is great and friendly and eager to provide good customer service which is great. I would recommend this place for it's stylish vibe and fantastic location.

This is a great place to stay if you want to be conveniently located BUT a little peace and quiet too. The Penthouse breakfast was very nice. Variety of cold cereal and gourmet type array of fresh baked goods. Delicious coffee and teas. Friendly and accomodating atmosphere -- great staff and at a moment's notice. I'd stay here again as it feels like you've arrived home after a busy day of sight seeing and shopping. Check out the evening happy hour as well and there is a great little greek place right next door.

Hotel Henri is on 24th street and has a great vibe. Comfortable bed, fun room, staff was great. We walked to the Hi Line and explored the neighborhood. Whitney museum, ample street parking if you are ok with walking a few blocks.

Small Hotel but great location. I used to stay in the Times Square area which gets flooded with tourists but this hotel helped me to discover the Chelsea and Flatiron Area. It is across the street from Eataly and next to several of the mean subway stations. The rooms are very clean and the front desk service is top notch. I was running late for check out due to a meeting and asked the front desk for a later check-out than normal. They were more than understanding and told me not to rush. I will be back and I will book through the website so I get the free breakfast.

I really enjoyed my 5 night stay at the Hotel Henri.Great Location: Just down the block from Eataly and Madison Park and many subway options.Great Staff: A shout out to Carlos the bellman who took extra good care of me as well as Chad at the font desk who easily righted a small problem I was having. It's a small hotel with a small staff, yet they always were attentive and helpful.Breakfast - a selection of pastries and cereals in their penthouse lounge each morning was a great way too get the day started and I appreciated the extended service until 11am as I had a few late nights in the city.My Room - While a bit small, It had a very comfy bed and still offered just the right amount of space and with a very comfortable size bathroom. Perhaps a bit more lighting would be nice, as I often kept my blinds closed since my view was of an office building across the alley....thus their view would be of me. Next time I may request a 24th street facing room - however, it was quiet on the back side of the hotel. I never had time to enjoy the Greek Restaurant in their lobby - but perhaps next time, as there will certainly be a next time.Thanks for a great stay.Erik - Seattle, WA

What a find! I am so glad I booked Hotel Henri. Location is fantastic....rooms were fabulous...the whole hotel was just terrific. I'd stay there again and recommend it in a heart beat. The value for money is without question. Breakfast is included in the rooftop penthouse so you get to enjoy a great view over a morning coffee. Its Boutique style and tucked away from the crowds.

I stayed here for the weekend with my girlfriend as a stay-cation and it was an overall great experience. We checked in early and had a cocktail/bar bites in the new restaurant. The food was great and the service was exceptional. The room was very nice...extremely comfortable and very unique...we had a great view of downtown Manhattan. At night we went upstairs to the penthouse lounge and had a few drinks in the new speakeasy space that was very nice! The next time we are going to have a stay-cation I would definitely come back and stay at Hotel Henri...it is the perfect place for a weekend stay!!!

Was in town for a few days and decided to book because of the location. The rooms were a good size and everyone there was friendly. Really liked the interior design and the mood setting in the room. The staff was helpful in recommending restaurants/bars to go to. Will definitely book again. P.S. the rooftop lounge is amazing, a must try.

I recently stayed 3 nights at hotel henri and it was amazing. The front desk were so kind and helpful. Anytime i needed directions or advice on what to do or eat, they had great recomendations. The rooms are very chic and am told recently renovated. Beds were super comfy and everything seemed to fit perfectly. The restaurant is new and called Mykonos Blue Grill. Great greek food and very elegant design. Nice that it connects to the lobby and feels so open. My recomendation is the greek salad. There is also a rooftop bar called Sir Henri which is gorgeous. Its one of these speakeasy cocktail bars with great tasting cocktails. My friends and i had fun trying the different cocktails each night. The music and DJ make the place fun. A very nice crowd comes in. Great date place i think. Overall great experience and i wish more hotels would go independant and have the flair that Henri has. And piece of advice, if you book direct they give you free breakfast. Which is a plus.

Hallway baseboards were being painted; room smelled like paint. I was trying to take a nap after horrid flight in storm, but workmen's radios going in the hallway! Sheet over comforter was stained; requested a new one that never came, so I tossed it in the corner. Comforter was upside down, so tag slapped me in the face during the night. Doors closed hard and loud when you let go, so doors everywhere were slamming all the time. Bathroom shelf was dusty. Heat settings were way off and difficult to adjust.

Clean, cool, lovely staff, great location. I enjoyed my stay at the Henri. It can get a bit loud if people are in the hallways waiting for the elevators, but other than that, I highly recommend this boutique hotel in Chelsea. I didn’t make it up to the Penthouse happy hour...next time!

Overall, we had a good stay here. It's a Wyndham masquerading as a boutique hotel, so the room has been redone to look like the Ace hotel (example: one wall looks like it's concrete that's been tagged with "always be a poet" but it's really wallpaper) and very dim Edison style bulbs in the room. There's LED rope lighting around the bed frame and headboard. Room is small (it's NYC, all hotel rooms are small) but since it's sparsely decorated there's enough room to move around. The shower is great. Mini bar features outrageously priced booze, snacks, and an intimacy kit with condom, lube, and vibrating ring in case you forgot stuff. But you can walk to the CVS around the corner for any of those items (okay, maybe not the ring) if you'd prefer to not pay for the convenience. All in all, they've turned a sleepy business hotel into Stuff Millenials Like, but even if you're not in the target audience you'll find the room to be comfortable.But since the Henri is trying to be Stuff Millenials Like, they have a rooftop bar with loud music at night. When I read about the bar when I booked it I thought it would be a nice quiet place to have a drink and look at the city. When we checked in on a Saturday, our room was two floors under the bar and all we could hear until the wee hours of the morning was the thumping bass of EDM. We had packed a white noise machine and had a bluetooth speaker in our suitcase, so between the machine at its loudest setting and the speaker cranked up playing a white noise app on my phone we were able to mask the thump enough to get some sleep. If you're here on a weekend, consider having something like that in your suitcase unless you're planning to be out all night. (We had a cruise to get up for in the morning, so partying like a rock star was not an option for us.)All in all, the Henri is well located and has a comfy bed. There's no breakfast offered, but there's plenty of food nearby. It's trying too hard to be hip, but if you can excuse that you can get a little sleep.

Overall everything about this hotel was perfect. I don't usually like the hustle and bustle of New York hotels and find everything about them rush rush.From the moment we checked in there was a line but immediately we were acknowledged and told we will be right with you. After a few minutes we were greeted by the front desk agent who was a lovely young woman. She told us where everything was and offered us some fruit flavored water. Nice touch because we were driving in traffic for two hours and were thirsty. After a brief explanation of where the elevators were and and how to get wifi access we went to our room. Everything about the room was perfect. It was clean and the room smelled like fresh flowers..... Not sure if they have a flower sent coming from somewhere but it was a nice touch. Overall when i want to be in midtown area again and not in the heart of the craziness I will definitely return. This place is for sure a gem and i didn't really want to review it because i don't want it getting sold out lol.

My wife and I stayed at Hotel Henri for a romantic weekend getaway. Location was ideal! We were very pleased with the whole experience! The people at the front desk greeted us with a warm welcome. The reception area had a cozy vibe. All the staff that we had encountered were polite and courteous. Our room was inviting, clean, and comfortable. My wife and I enjoyed drinks at the lovely rooftop bar. We also enjoyed food in the outdoor restaurant. The concierge was well informed of nearby restaurants and hotspots. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Have stayed here a couple of times now and will return every time from now. As a frequent business traveler to NYC I have stayed in many hotels around the city. This one has the perfect balance... great location with good restaurants around for the evening, great service and friendly staff.... Mr. Aldoy the new GM there is great, and reasonable rates! Room was spacious and modern in feel and very comfortable. I would totally recommend to anyone traveling on business or leisure!

I managed to convince one of my friends whom had never been to New York before to finally come up. I was looking for a hotel at a moderate price and close to everything. This place definitely did the trick. It was incredibly close to the Flatiron building (down the next avenue) but far enough away that the noise of the usually busy area wasn't noticable. Great little hotel.

The property and room were very clean and the staff was friendly. Just 2 small issues. There was no way to turn a light on/off while laying in bed. After my first night, the following morning, I woke up and realized that the coffee pods for the in-room coffee maker had not been replenished the day before.

My wife and I enjoyed a week in Manhattan, basing our adventures out of Hotel Henri. Fabulous staff, excellent property. Super location - 10-15 minute walk to MSG, 15-20 to Times Square and Broadway theaters, 25-30 to Central Park or Chelsea Market. Away from the Times Square crush, but easy cab grab to anywhere (20 minutes to Battery Park!). Rooms are generous by NYC standards, and very comfortable. Best hotel staff experience we've had anywhere in the world! Eataly (Italian market and restaurant) - across the street - is an absolute MUST.

The Hotel Is fairly clean. Rooms are small but recently appointed. As many reciewers habe mentioned the Wi-Fi doesn't work. Went to the front desk foe help but there isn't any. I think the issue is that they have a small week system that can't support the traffic so it won't let new people on to the open router. So hotel is okay if you aren't trying to do any work that requires Wi-Fi. And be prepared to hear noise from the room above (ie toilet flushing).

My family and I really enjoyed this place.. Quiet and clean is what I always look for and this place is it.. check-in was a breeze, And their warm welcome was a plus. I really recommend this place and it's also close by, shopping, activities and subway station.. You won't go wrong with this hotel.Thank you for our stay!

Best decision I made when looking for a hotel in NYC. The rooms are clean, good amenities, nice, cute hotel in general. Staff and management were amazing!!! Highly recommend, will definitely go back !

I had just gotten out of a terrible Airbnb experience with a host with rules that did not allow me access into my room between 10am-6pm and found Hotel Henri just 3 streets down with very reasonable prices and so got out of my Airbnb before 10am with my bags and walked over to Hotel Henri with my reservation. When I enquired about the possibility of early check-in (even though I was prepared to leave my bags with the concierge before returning later to check-in), the staff somehow was nice enough to check me in early after a slight wait in the lobby. It was the biggest gesture that came in an otherwise bad day and the rooms were modern and clean and stocked with complimentary bottled water. There wasn't any view in my room except seeing the office buildings across the street but it was nice in a way since it gave me an insight into the environment of workplaces in NYC. The beds were comfortable and the towels well stocked. The furnishings are modern and artsy somewhat with slightly dim lighting (not exactly my type but they are decent and acceptable) and the rooms are very decently sized in my opinion. I was rather surprised by the overall quality of the stay I received from Hotel Henri. It is a small hotel, but if you are looking for a decent place to stay, there's good tv, good beds, friendly staff, and a very responsive and hotel manager Chad, who helped look into some extra charges that came on while I was checking out that somehow wasn't included when I made my booking. Chad helped look into the charges and reversed them as a form of goodwill and I really appreciate it. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place that gives you good value for your money. In NYC and for the location in the 24th street area, I would say it is a very decent price and I will definitely come back if I am looking for accommodation in this area. But more importantly, the hotel staff, from the room cleaning crew to the lobby staff and even the manager were definitely friendly and helpful and really did make all the difference to the stay. And oh, there was complimentary breakfast if you make your reservation through the hotel's official website although I did not get to try it since I was usually sleeping in and ended up missing the breakfast but it is there if it matters for those who require it.

This is a new boutique hotel in NYC. On 24th between 5th and 6th it is clean, quite and has a bar in lobby as well as a penthouse bar. All staff was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was small but had everything we needed. Large bathroom. Best blackout shade ever on window so we got great sleep. Free continental breakfast. Also crazy low rates for NYC!!!! Definitely will stay here again. In warm weather outside bar/eating area.

I come up to NY monthly for business. I saw this hotel pop up through my Diamond Wyndham Rewards options, and figured I'd try something new. It's proximity to the Flatiron and 6th Avenue was helpful in getting around. The staff was friendly and helped us with early check-in and went out of their way to upgrade us to a suite when we requested. We did try to go use our drink coupons upstairs, but encountered a large mixer that made it almost impossible to get to the bar to use them. We gave up and went downstairs. Breakfast was free and continental. A warm option would be nice - but we understand the reasoning behind it. Sound bleed from the 18th floor to the 16th floor was noticeable, but did not keep us up. For their rates, it's a great location and a nice value for NYC.

I stayed at this property a few weeks ago and had an amazing time. the check in process was very fast (which I appreciated as I was running late for a meeting) and informative. The rooms are very small and bare but very clean, plus who comes to New York to stay in the hotel room all day. Their restaurant is closed which was a letdown since i was looking forward to room service but what can you do. I will definitely stay again at this hotel and maybe make it my go to anytime I visit NYC!!!!

I have been to this hotel many times for corporate meetings and social functions. They have a wonderful staff, incredible rooms and a beautiful top of the line speakeasy lounge on the rooftop. Their overall attention to detail and devotion to service impresses me every time I return. I have recommended this hotel to my friends and family and they have cleared the same experience. Its truly a little gem in the middle of Flatiron.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Henri during the holidays — helpful staff (hi Fabiola!), stylish accommodations and very convenient location. Don't miss the chic bar on the penthouse level! I felt like the price for what we received was very fair and we would definitely stay here again.

Perhaps my disappointment was my fault for building up so much expectation. After all, the photos are beautiful and on a map the hotel looks perfect. The street is dingy (great restaurants on either side though!). The hotel takes boutique to a whole new level, I felt like I had to shrug my shoulders to fit everywhere, lobby, hallways, room, elevator. Decor is as expected, minus a few corners of my flooring had lifted enough to stub my toe. The $25 of nasty red wine in the room is a bad idea, learn from my mistake. A great opportunity to improve my stay was the bar I had looked forward to.... and fail. The hours were poor, there’s no kitchen, the bartender was aloof and not engaging. Then the bar was closed one day all together and no one knew it would be! The sign was even out on the sidewalk. At check out they mentioned a “$15 facilities fee”. What for I asked? Oh, for all the amenities, like the bar. How about you manage this hotel better and can include the minimal amenities this property offers in your room rate like every other hotel I’ve stayed at. This is a joke given the bar is only drinks, crappy hours and service, and apparently not reliable either, and there’s no other amenity I can think of! Frankly, it was between this and the New Yorker and it was a horrible mistake choosing this hotel. NYC has far too much to offer to risk staying somewhere like here, find a different hotel.

Just got back from a five night stay ,, first time in New York an I have to say we were not disappointed the hotel Henri was perfect for what we needed from our stay the staff were friendly the rooms were cleaned daily the bed was so comfy which we needed after a day out been so tired from our sight seeing the room was lush very boutique style smart modern an yes as a lot have mentioned small !,,,, but don’t let that put you off there is more than a enough room for what you need an you don’t spend a lot of time in there it’s just somewhere to get a shower an get your head down before your next fun filled day we would recommend staying there we would definitely stay there again short walk to tube station $3.00 for a pass to take you uptown or downtown much cheaper than taxis first day back home missing the New York buzz

I stayed for 2 nights in a king room with my daughter. The service was brusque when we arrived. The place is cute, the bed is comfortable, and the room was silent. The location is AMAZING. BUT, they seem to be out to lunch on basic stuff like an extra blanket. How hard is that? Also, our room wasn't serviced when we left at 9 and returned at 3 PM. The continental breakfast is strange - weird little pastries. I think this place wants to be hip and cool but is just failing to find its way.

Visited over thanks giving to see my son Who is studying in New York. Nil issues other than small rooms for 3 adults and poor lighting. Staff seemed lovely complimentary continental breakfast muffins and coffee (first in first serve). On checkout we were told all done nothing to pay however 3 days later checked visa and found charge fir $65. Rang an inquired and was told it was for incidentals which was breakfast and wifi which was complimentary when we booked. I emailed a manager called Maria who assured me after telling her it’s illegal to charge people’s credit card without notification of the charge prior that I would get a refund that was 6th December ha! Never arrived bunch of thieves will never stay here again don’t like deceitful people.

This is a cute little hotel located in New York City. They have a modernized decor and friendly staff. I had a room with 2 full beds in it. I do not know where you could get a hotel this nice for the low price. Especially for New York

I recently stumbled upon this Chelsea gem after my New Years Holidays, and wound up staying for almost a week.. Its in a quiet neighborhood with a wide range of excellent food with in a few blocks.. The room was clean and modern. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Fabiola at the front desk was very friendly and super helpful.. I’ve found a new favorite hotel in NYC...

This hotel is modern with low romantic lighting throughout the hotel. If your not with your significant other, then we can call it mood lighting. The check-in process is quick and friendly. You will be informed of the amenities and they will highlight the rooftop bar. Make sure to appreciate both sides when you get up there.The rooms have snacks plus drink options available, at a fee of course. The rooms are small but quaint. There is enough room for you to enjoy. The views are nonexistent but who wants to spend their day looking outside when you could actually be outside enjoying yourself after you enjoy the amenities of your room. On our stay, they offered hot cider in the lobby. If you wanted to kick it up a notch, they had a fireball liquor to compliment the taste. It was a nice touch for a cold winter day. It added to the warmth that the staff had given us each time we passed the lobby. At one point, one of the employees, I believe his name was Ron, even recognized us from a previous visit which made us feel great. Chad was completely helpful and accommodating. His personal touch brought our experience to a higher level. The free drink tickets didn’t hurt either. By the way the drinks at the rooftop bar are above average in price, but if you want to enjoy it without breaking the bank, go during happy hour. I cannot comment on the breakfast option because we’ve always overslept. We have had the espresso in the lobby and it was excellent.WE WILL BE BACK

We stayed here for one night in December 2017. The hotel is centrally located and can be accessed by a couple of subway lines. The room is well appointed, with a more modern taste in its interior design. Although my room is clean, the bathroom smells stale upon our arrival. We thought it might be poor ventilation, so we turned on the bathroom fan before we left for dinner and the evening event. However, when we came back at night the smell stayed. We did not report the problem because we already settled in, and we were here just for a short one night stay. We checked out early the next morning and did not experience any problems. A couple of days later, I was shocked to find out that my credit card was charged an extra of USD 33.75 from Hotel Henri. I called the front desk to inquire, and I was told that it was from the minibar in the room. I told the person on the phone that we never used or consumed anything in the room during our very short stay, and he said he would reverse the bill. A week later, I got the credit back. Although the incident was resolved quickly and the person I talked with on the phone did a good job in reversing the bill in a timely fashion, I was surprised that Hotel Henri does not do its due diligence to verify the charge and inform me before charging directly on my credit card. It's WRONG to charge my credit card without even sending me the bill (via email, at least) detailing why and what they are charging for. More importantly, the hotel manager should do a better job to verify each single extra charge reported from his or her housekeeper.

Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.Hotel is in a good central location.Complimentary continental breakfast providexGood internetRoom small for 4 of us but staff were willing to look at alternative solutions to help us

Property was average. We expected something much more upscale than we got, but bed was comfortable and room was clean. We found the finishes to be cheap looking and the main areas were not super clean. Tons of snacks and minibar items in the room but no price list anywhere-and we searched the entire room. Were they free? Don't think so! It was also really hard to find where the entrance to the hotel was. Hopefully, finishing construction will make that more evident.

We stayed at Hotel Henri the end of November. Although newer, it was decorated very dark. Our room overlooks an alleyway into another building. The mattress was thick but too soft, and the shower leaks. The room a very small. Not a terrible stay if you're on a budget.Skip the continental breakfast!
The hotel was in a perfect location between 5th & 6th. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They good recommendations for places to eat in the area.

At best this place is 3 stars and we have traveled extensively in Europe where star ratings are relative. Tiny rooms very depressing ... view of next building ... dirty hallways. Worse was staff discouraging use of penthouse bar as we did not look young and hip enough. Go somewhere else.

Overall, we had a nice time at this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday weekend. The room and decor were very modern and we felt at home.I actually enjoyed the lighting and it had a great city feel. The front staff were always very friendly and they even personally delivered a bag of ice to our room.  When it was time to turn in for the night, we were awakened by loud screaming that persisted for way too long. The temperature in the room was not regulated well and I ended up tossing and turning because it was way too hot. The continental breakfast was cute and I enjoyed the offerings and I really like the complimentary water which is hard to come by and also left me skeptical. The most disappointing part of my stay was an anonymous charge on my credit card for about $9.00. We only drank the water and had breakfast. We were required to sign in for breakfast so it makes me wonder if we were being charged for something regarding that or maybe it was for the ice? If so, I feel as though this should be disclosed. I would have definitely recommended this place if it weren't for the surprise fees and loud screaming. Happy Holidays!

Stayed for a week on a business trip, the hotel's location was just perfect for me, staff was very hospitable, the room was clean and warm but obviously not too luxuries. Overall a very good experience.

Staff was nice, Roy the bellman was wonderful. The continental breakfast was a joke. We didn’t use housekeeping at all, just requested new towels every day. Location was a little too far from Time square. Will not stay here again because of the distance from everything.

I really enjoyed my stay. Great staff and the location was perfect. Lots of great restaurants in the area and a continental breakfast taboot. I would highly recommend Hotel Henri for your next trip to NYC.

The summary of this story is that the doors do not lock properly so sometimes the housekeeping staff unintentionally leaves the doors open. This is an issue because if you stay here, your belongings are left vulnerable for the taking. My biggest issue with this is that the Hotel has been altered to the issue for months (I have screenshots of postings from social) and have neglected to address the issue. The only response we have received from anyone are apologies from junior level staff and combative General Manager who deflects and focuses on undermining your frustration and refuses to accept responsibility. Christian N. Manager at the Hotel Henri has now responded that he is disappointed to read our review but brushes the account off saying that the hotel does their best to fix any problem but this issue has been reported by past visitors before us going back to April 2017 yet the issue still persists... The detailed account is below.I called the night of the incident (12/1) and have a reference # 3950320. However the issue was not addressed during our stay and I have yet to receive a comment from the Hotel Henri. The only response we get from Wyndham is a promise that they are looking into the situation but the first window of 1 week has come and gone.On our first day exploring NYC we returned to our room to find the room had been serviced by housekeeping, but the door was propped open. We had been gone for nearly 7 hours. I immediately called down to the front desk, but the phone rang for nearly 5 mins with no answer. My partner began to search the room to see if anything was missing, so I ran down to the front desk to alert them to the issue.The staff at the front desk was busy but were able to chase down the managers. The assistant manager (female, her name escapes me) did not offer any answers and could only apologize. I was upset because I was about to propose to my partner and the engagement rings were hidden in a bag in our room while we were out. I was expecting the room to be secure (because I checked the door as we left) and I did not use the safe because my partner and I were both using the safe for our computers and iPads. He would have found the rings and blown the surprise.In my conversation with her, I asked the assistant manager to look into it a few things:1. How did this happen?2. What is going to be done to prevent it from happening again?3. Where do we go from here?All of which were fair questions, I wanted to know that our belongings were safe. I am a former resident of NYC and now live in LA (Hollywood). We are familiar with petty crimes in high traffic areas. She sounded like she was going to look into the situation until the General Manager, Christiaan Aldoy, stepped in. He told me to calm down and that I was being unreasonable. I asked him, "how should I be feeling?" because it was the employee of the hotel that went into my secured room, with my belongings, and left the room unsecured for hours. He did not have an answer... He said I was being aggressive, but I wasn't. I explained that I was being assertive, I explained that I was protecting what was mine and trying to understand why the Hotel failed to provide 1 of 2 main services we were paying for (1. a comfortable and safe place to stay. 2. a safe and secure place to keep our belongings). He began to backpedal and didn't have answers. I asked again "how should I be feeling". I asked why he thought he should tell me how I should be feeling... He said he didn't mean to tell me how I should be feeling and tried to take back his comment. I asked him "why was my tone inappropriate and why shouldn't I be upset?" He didn't have an answer. Not once did he apologize, take responsibility for any mistake, try to move us to a more secure room, or make up for the situation in any way. Why? We booked our rooms for 4 nights / 5 days. This happened on the 2nd day. He never tried to make it better.Upon returning to the room, we figured out the issue in 5 mins. The door was not latching properly without being pulled shut (a video has been provided to Wyndham Group). The situation could have easily been addressed, but Mr. Aldoy decided to be combative and unapologetic rather than work towards a solution. All we asked was 1. How did it happen? 2. How can we prevent it from happening again (so we could leave our belongings in the room with peace of mind)? 3. Where do we go from here? Should we move rooms, etc? None of those questions were answered in the next 4 days. There were no attempts to remedy the situation. We were blown away but the standard but did not want to let this situation completely ruin such an important weekend for us (we got engaged).The next four days we didn't allow room service into our room, no turning down the sheets, no fresh towels, no cleaning the floors. It was awkward walking by the front desk, awkward walking by everyone that works there. The entire stay was very uncomfortable.Do you really feel that this is the acceptable treatment of a concerned guest at your hotel? Is this the experience your brand strives to provide? I have worked in hospitality for many years. We paid for a stay and experience that we did not receive and no one tried to make it better or help us, instead, they insulted us when raising the issue.It has been weeks and the only communication from Wyndham is the communication I initiate. No one is following up to address and provide a resolution. Further, I hope someone review's Mr. Aldoy's qualifications in holding the position of GM. This situation could have easily been addressed and avoided. Mr. Aldoy appears to be failing to address a simple maintenance issue but worse, he insults his guests when they raise issues to him (rather than taking responsibility and addressing them). I also want to point out that this issue has been raised to the Hotel Henri for months and no one has addressed it. A screenshot from the Hotel Henri Facebook Page has been provided where the same exact situation happened and they received similar treatment. I hope someone takes this issue seriously as it has the potential to become quite costly. I hope someone finally addresses it.

This is my fourth time staying at this hotel. I was on the 16th Floor the last time. This time I stayed for three days and was on the 12th floor. There was a big difference from how clean my room was the last time in comparison to this time. The 12th floor felt like I was at a different hotel. I loved the view from my window. The housekeeper who was so good that I had to ask her name was super friendly. My main reason for leaving this review was because of Jennifer. My room was so clean and smelled fresh. Everything was left spotless. I normally have issues with hotel bathrooms but my bathroom at this hotel on this floor was so clean it made me feel comfortable. Jennifer was so attentive and had a good attitude that I did not hesitate to ask her for whatever I needed. None of my personal items were touched or misplaced. I would come back to this hotel and I would make sure that I request whatever rooms Jennifer is in charge of. Thank you Henri Hotel.

My stay here was nice, I only had two issues with the stay:1. The elevator.......oh wow, this relic from the Cambrian Period is so dreadfully slow and ill-equipped to handle hotel traffic.
