Glaciers move at speeds exponentially faster than this thing. It was not uncommon to wait 7 or even 10 minutes for the elevator. 2. CHILL OUT with the fragrance. The sheets and linens reeked of whatever fragrance or cheap Drakkar Noir knock off they pour around the room. It was so bad it burned my sinuses and I could taste it while I slept. I have no idea why hotels do that, I can't image someone who enjoys sleeping in what smells like a late 80's mens store. Fragance free please.

Clean, personal, and awesome. Great staff and hotel. Only negative is the tiny “breakfast”. Would definitely stay there again! We added a day to our trip and they combined two reservations for us to make it easier!

Looks to be an average hotel. They don't really clean the rooms a lot. The first week I was there I'm usually out all day and maybe only twice they cleaned the floor, and I mean like just sweep the dust. You really got to wear slippers or else you get dirt stuck to your feet Then when my wife and daughter visited we had days where the room didn't get cleaned at all. The staff assured it would and didn't. When asked about it they were just apologetic with not actions behind it. It's like they either didn't really care or just lie to your face. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless someone just wanted to stay 1 night and not really care about decent cleanliness

Our first day exploring NYC and room service left our door propped open the entire day while we were out exploring the city. When this issue was brought to the manager by my partner, who was upset about the situation, the manager proceeded to tell him how he should act and feel about this....That didn't go over well and is not the way you should treat guests at your hotel. Obviously we are upset about this, all of our stuff is left out in the open for anyone to take, and the manager was not going to take any responsibility for this incident and had no ability to sympathize with what happened. So we are left with no trust in the manager or the room service staff. The next four days we didn't allow room service into our room, no turning down the sheets, no fresh towels, no cleaning the floors. It was awkward walking by the front desk, awkward walking by everyone that works there. The entire stay was very uncomfortable.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff are the friendliest I have met in a New York hotel. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Penn Station and in a good area. The room was great, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

One of the most unpleasant hotels I’ve stayed in. The bed was too soft and the pillows were too hard. In addition the extraction fan and toilet flush was so loud my neighbors woke me every time they went to the loo. Will not return. Ever

My wife and I spent five nights at this hotel back in October. We liked our room and enjoyed our stay, however, upon returning home my wife discovered the hotel had overcharged us by NEARLY A THOUSAND DOLLARS!! They charged her account twice and neither amount matches the amount listed on the paper receipt. We have called numerous times and they cannot explain how or why this happened. Even worse, it STILL HASN'T BEEN FIXED. The hotel states that since they overcharged such a large amount they can't fix it themselves (even though they are the ones who caused the problem). They claim corporate has to refund it. But guess what? Corporate gives the runaround. It's unfortunate that a nice vacation is going to require legal action simply because this hotel made a mistake and now refuses to fix it. If you stay here either plan to pay in cash or keep a very close eye on your credit card statement.

We selected Hotel Henri because we had points with Wyndham. We paid for 1 night and the second night was free. Location was good and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The “NYC” sized rooms are updated, clean and very nice. The beds were comfortable. The hotel is ideal for short stays only as you have no chest of drawers for clothing and the closet is very small. At check in, the desk clerk mentioned there was a continental breakfast and we were pleased to hear this news. We were disappointed to see it was just coffee and rolls only, not the continental breakfast we expected. All in all, would we stay here again, yes as just a couple. To the staff, keep up the good work!

My family and I stayed here for four nights around Thanksgiving 2017. I'll start with the positives:Location is pretty good. You're within walking distance to several subway lines and the PATH, as well as Madison Square Park and Eataly. That said, trying to get a taxi early Thursday morning was surprisingly difficult. The hotel's decor is also not bad, and despite the beds' ultra-soft feel, they were more comfortable than expected.Now, onto things that could be improved. First, we had reached out several times before check-in with requests. The emails were sent to both the hotel owner as well as the generic front desk address. No one ever responded. Then, at check-in, our simple request to have two reservations associated together so we could avoid having to check out only to check back in again was apparently not possible to do (vs. every other hotel we've ever stayed at), so we actually did have to technically check out before checking back in. Not sure if that was a system limitation, or training.The hotel offers free breakfast (that said, don't get your hopes up), though on weekdays, they limit hotel guests to a very small section of the dining area, as apparently they lease the majority of the space to some co-working group. Needless to say, that's not very hospitable to guests.Other (minor) annoyances include: a bathroom sink that didn't drain, a shower configuration that inevitably led to large water leaks, a central air system that was always too-hot or too-cold, and super tight rooms/closets (standard for Manhattan).To the housekeeping staff's credit, they consistently left us two bottles of water each day, even though we had "do not disturb" on. I've never had a hotel do that, so that was much appreciated.Would I stay here again? Maybe, if it was just myself. But not with two kids in tow.

Room was clean with king size bed and efficiently set up - small but we were only there to sleep and change. Nice addition of coffee and bakery items and fruit to start the day in the lobby. Staff friendly and helpful. We would stay again!

Upon arrival front desk was chilling at little reception, we had to sort of call him to register!We did not get comforter or duvet in the bed! We were freezing, this happened in two separate rooms!! The next night we asked for one they said they didnt have more!! Meaning: not even one per room!!! When we got very upset they said they would go and remove two from another room!! None of our rooms got cleaned, the front desk guy was insanely rude when i complained he said ok and hangup.Later i wanted to speak to a manager (when the whole thing with “we have no comforters, sorry” experience happened, and hey informed me that by 7pm he has left for the day!!!!!!!!!! The only hotel in the world with no MOD (manager on duty) and left to deal with unqualified rude staff!!The worst was we couldnt move we had paid fully w hotels.com and they refused at the hot to even consider it!!Seriously take ur money, your holiday and your loved ones someone enjoyable and at least decent clean place!!Ohh elevator was half of the stay out of order!! So huge linea at the front desk to go up!!!By far the worst, but the VERY WORST SERVICE!!!
For the price and location the hotel is a steal. Spent the night in the city for my wife's birthday. Very clean and well decorated. We would stay here again.

Friendly hotel in a great location - many subway lines run across 23rd Street making it easy to get around Manhattan. Only 10 blocks from Union Square, walking distance to the Chelsea Market and Meat packing district and a nice cinema close by.

I stayed at Hotel Henri because I was in NYC for work for a week. This hotel is in a great location as it is close to a ton of nice restaurants, in walking distance to Madison Square Park and Madison Avenue and also the subway. The rooms are nicely modern, not super fancy, but adequate for the purpose of the trip and they are clean. Times Square is about a 1 mile walk as is most of the mid-town and lower part of Manhattan. It is an easy train ride to the Freedom tower and again I'll mention there are tons of great restaurants in close walking distance to the hotel. Fifth Avenue and Broadway are right at the corner and there are lots of stores for shopping with all of the famous designer locations in a very close proximity to the hotel. You can walk to almost anything. Fabiola was very nice at the front desk for checkout, but all of the staff were very pleasant and friendly. Customer service is important and it seems like this hotel tries to hire friendly people

The rooms are recently renovated, clean, and look nice. My room was pretty small and making the heating work was a challenge. The bed was amazing though and I woke up well rested. The breakfast is cute with delicious pastries and coffee for the go. The employees are nice and helpful. I'd stay again for a short stay. I wouldn't stay here with kids.

Standing here in the lobby because they mixed up our reservation and are now fully booked. Super disappointed- never staying here again! We are in the city for an event and have no place change or get ready. Instead of being helpful the staff is more concerned with placing the blame on someone else- the manager wouldn’t even come to speak to us about this because he left for the day at 6pm This is NOT how you do business!

Great location with easy access to all the sites, shopping, food and entertainment of Manhattan. Steps away from the historic Flatiron building. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Front desk was very helpful.

Chose this hotel for two reasons, the price at the time of booking compared to other hotels and location. My wife and I were in the City from the west coast for only one night (though we were staying in the area longer). We are both native to the area so know our way around. We knew exactly the neighborhoods we wanted to stay and better those we did not. I've had generally positive experiences at other Wyndham hotels so thought "why not?" Overall we were pleased with the accommodations. We did not expect nor sought anything palatial - hard to get in NYC within our budget. So while the room was "small" it was not uncomfortable. I liked the design, my wife thought it too dark. There was no view out the window but who cares? We didn't get the room to look out the window! It was quiet and comfortable - two key criteria. Check-in: We came in on a red-eye so got to the hotel by 10AM hoping a room would be available. There was not. We were told there might be one by 12 or 2 o'clock. There was not. We were also told we'd get a call when a room was ready. We did not. Fortunately we were able to leave our bags and set out for a walk. We returned around 3:45 and were told a room was ready since around 3. It would've been nice to get the call we were promised but we did not. Aside from that minor hiccup, our overall stay was fine. We didn't have opportunity to take advantage of the 2 drink tickets for the rooftop bar but it was nice to have the option nonetheless. (And no, those tickets were not offered for having to wait for the room, it was just what they were doing to presumably promote the bar). Staff were friendly. Wi-fi worked fine. We would stay again assuming the price is right the next time we are ready to book.

Decided to bring our 14 yr old niece to NYC for the day to hit some galleries and Times Square. Usually we stay at Pod 39 (great Prices and hotel) but they did not have any adjoining rooms. After a lot of research I found Henri hotel in the perfect area with 2 queen beds for a great price. Typical in NYC, When I booked our room the price was $286 not including tax. Thank god I booked it when I did! I checked the site a few days later and the same room was $450 a night. Loved the location right literally at the Flat Iron building. We walked a few avenues west to the high line past FIT. Then walked south to the galleries in the meat packing district. Lunch in Chelsea and an easy cab ride to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Typically when my husband and I visit NYC we are on the East side but this trip was so convenient to be west. The hotel lobby was small. Very Friendly staff. The rooms were big and clean. Gorgeous marble bathroom and showers were great. And nice and quiet. Plenty of goodies were stocked up in the room we did not use.. alcohol, candy, cookies, etc. making it very comfortable stay for anyone looking to spend more time in the room. Really love that it is a 2 second walk to the Flatiron! No cross traffic so super quiet plus big and CLEAN! Definitely recommend!

Location was perfect! The rooms worked well! Parking lot “I Park” is 150 feet before the Henri entrance, so ensure you unload your luggage, back up or go around the block to park your car. Get the ticket validated at the Henri!!

I️ moved hotels after one night. The room was dirty and shower drain didn’t work. Asked to have it fixed 3 times, they moved me to a new room that was worse so I️ checked out and went to a Kimpton. I️ don’t recommend this hotel.

Good hotel, staff were friendly. Rooms were quite small but as we only stayed for a night it suited our need. Location was great, we were close to everything. Would definitely stay again, got a good deal on hotels.com

Great people...great location...updated room...a bit small for more than 1 person.Would stay again for 1-2 nights. Any more than that the size of the room would be an issue. Desk was too small for any work to be done.

The Hotel Henri is a funky smallish hotel in Chelsea. It’s themed on theatre with rooms, corridors and general areas being decorated to reflect Broadway and theatre. Our room was somewhat black (walls) but with dramatic lighting. rooms are perfectly good and functional for two, but hardly spacious. The cost was good value for money reflecting the space you get. It’s location on 24th is excellent for the subway with several lines one block either east or west. Close to the flatiron building you are almost exactly half way between battery park and Central Park. Great for a walk down Broadway to Times Square. Just one thing, there is no where to eat so try Malibu Diner on 23rd for breakfast or Eataly at the end of 24th for dinner.

The room was comfortable and cute, and the staff was so helpful. I asked to change from one kind of room to another and they accommodated me, they helped me find a place to eat, they were so friendly. I'd happily come back. Shari especially was wonderful

This hotel was a good experience. Enjoyed the ambiance and social interaction with hotel staff especially the rooftop bar manager Amy. She was amazing, treated us like old friends visiting from out of town .

We stayed here for several nights and we were overcharged on check out even though our booking had stated total for stay including all taxes. On top of this room service staff spent more time socialising outside the rooms than servicing and the noise travelled badly and they were terrible. One day we were told they had no coffee left for our room to later be told by reception that they have no idea why they would say this? We also had to specifically start asking for real coffee as they were only leaving decaf? What is that about? The location was great rooms are pretty good but staffing definitely lets this hotel down. Will definitely try out a different hotel next time we are in town. If I had a suggestion for them it would be to send someone in as a secret customer over a few day/nights to review their property so they can improve their staff.

The hotel was clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooftop bar/lounge was amazing with wonderful views, great cocktails, and the epitome of a fun NYC atmosphere. I live in Connecticut and visit New York frequently. Hotel Henri will definitely be on my list of places to stay next time I'm visiting.

The Hotel as nicely located to access transportation and area venues such as Museums and Greenwich Village. The Hotel staff was great and helpful. the Hotel clean and well maintainedWe liked the security of the place and the Lounge was great to have after a day of NYC.

I stayed at the Hotel Henri for one night last week and the hotel was fine. It wasn't great and wasn't terrible. I thought the price point was good for what you got and the place was recently renovated. It is quite dark -- the lobby, the halls and the rooms were all very dim. The room itself was fine -- its what you'd expect in NY -- small and stylish.The hotel location is amazing -- so much nearby to see and do.The one thing they need to do better at is the speed of service. We had to use the front desk a few times and it was never fast. The attendants were quite friendly and helpful but never again not fast at all.I would stay here again for the right price but my experience wasn't so good that I won't look around next time I am in NY.

I’ve been staying here since this small boutique hotel had its face lift and name change. The rooms are comfortable, spacious and offer bath tubs upon request and availability, which is a plus for me. The location, staff and proximity to everything makes it a good choice. Fabiola at the Front Desk has been a major reason for my return visits-always ensuring all my needs are met. It gives me more of a sense of home and place. I’ll be back for another extended stay this coming May when I’ll be teaching once again at SVA.

I consider is a Good Hotel, just a kind of romantic style, Im not sure if that is the concept cause we book by hotwire, the WIFI is the worst thing :/ I think it really could be better, I do not even could check my email.

$48 surcharge for water in the room, coffee that I didn't touch and only decaf available and bag storage !! I have never been charged ever before for this worldwide .. Heating didn't work Day 1Free WIFI if you give all your contacts and answer 5 questions ..

Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2017. Overall, had a good experience staying here without any issues.This review is intended to call out a front desk staff member Fabiola for her excellent service! I needed to extend my stay one night but the hotel was completely sold out. She put my name down and said that if any rooms canceled, she would call me. A half day later, she called, and was able to book an additional night without hassle. Thank you!

The room was clean and the staff were super helpful. The location can’t be beat-right across from Eataly and a block from Madison Square Park. But...the room was a bit dark. On the mini bar with gummy bears was a ‘romance kit’ for $25. A little...off-beat. Water and coffee at all times. Great shower. Meh mattress.I would stay again, but not recommend to colleagues, only friends.

Really nice and attentive staff - quick response to requests and very friendly and helpful. BUT we were unhappy to be hit with a $15/day “facilities fee” upon checking out - what facilities? There weren’t any! Staff said that was thru the web booking agent but they shoukd be up front about it. We feel ripped off. Also very uncomfortable mattress.

Hotel Henri was a very nice place. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. It was in close proximity to all sightseeing. We really enjoyed the lounge too. We would definitely recommend it to anyone

This was a very expensive room therefore, I assumed that there would be quality service. A staff member brought a bucket of ice to my room and I asked him if he could bring another bottle of water. He replied yes but NEVER returned. The next morning I called the front desk to report that there were no cups in the room to make coffee. I was told that someone would bring one up but they NEVER came. I was very disappointed in this type of service for such a grand hotel.

Staff was very warm and welcoming an attentive during my stay. Great location in Flatiron district, in easy walking distance to several neighborhoods and tourist attractions, 2 blocks from subway station. Yes - rooms are small but this is Manhattan! My room was larger than that of a work colleague staying at another nearby hotel. Room was clean when I checked in but I wasn't impressed with housekeeping, full garbage can not removed or ice bucket changed out. I had the same issue with the shower door leak flooding the bathroom, seems to be a design issue. Overall great value for the location. I would stay there again.

Found this place while searching for hotels in Chelsea and I'm glad I did. The property is well maintained and the staff was super friendly. My room was amazing...comfy king bed, fabulous shower, free bottled water and a good sized balcony! Rates were really reasonable as well. I will be staying here again for sure. Thanks Henri!

Hotel looks completely remodeled. Dining area was not completely done while we were there. Should be done in November. Didn't matter since a lot of restaurants were in close proximity! Bell hops were quick and friendly! Got there during Halloween weekend. Didn't realize the city goes all out for Halloween. There were some interesting characters but it is New York!!!!

Clean rooms, friendly people, great views from penthouse bar. My room was small-ish (I had larger rooms in Tokyo), but: location. Entrance is a bit hard to find - my booking said Hotel Henri while the lit sign says S/H (Sir Henri). Loud air conditioner in the room.

This hotel needs some work. Elevators are slow, and the rooms are NOT soundproof! VERY difficult night trying to sleep!! Rooms clean however, nice bathroom, comfortable bed, and the staff at the front desk was very friendly and easy to work with.

We were booked here two nights in conjunction with some meetings my husband was attending in New York. The location is A+, near Madison Square Park, Chelsea and the Flatiron District. The hotel itself is really small in every way. There is truly no lobby, just a few chairs by the front door. They share a the rest of their first floor space with a co-working office space, but it is blocked off after breakfast. The rooms are TINY. And the hallways are exceedingly narrow, making it difficult to maneuver around the corner with a rolling bag. They are also painted black, making everything seem even smaller than it is. The whole time we stayed there, the housekeeping cart on our floor was parked right out side the elevator. Given how narrow the halls are, it made it that much more tight. Also, as the hotel is one trying to be about design, it kind of takes away from any ambience to have a huge housekeeping cart the first thing you see every time you get off the elevator or leave your room. Of the two nights and three days we accessed our floor, the cart was only not sitting right there one time, no matter if it was morning, mid-day or even late at night upon returning from dinner. The staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. Just wish the space was more up to snuff.

Very clean and nice hotel in an excellent location! Walking distance from Times square, right in the middle of Manhattan. Staff is friendly and helpful at all times. Parking available right beside the hotel for a discounted price. Great place to stay to discover the city.

The rooms were clean. Service was average. I called the front desk a few times and was put on hold, once for 8 minutes which seemed like eternity. Was a discrepancy on my room rate. Booked through Wyndam website and local manager said the cost they quoted was an "average" rate. Not sure what that meant and it was never explained properly. I'd probably stay there again but it would be my first choice.

Most of my stay was quite pleasant. Helpful, friendly staff; the room was small but comfortable. However--the website indicates that there is a restaurant right on site. This is not the case. The restaurant (the Shay and Ivy) is closed (and looks like it has been for some time). Yes, there are many places to eat in the neighborhood, but I was on a business trip and was originally told I could just put all my meals on my room bill by the people who made the reservation for me. Guess they looked at the same website.

My husband and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights.Ill strat with the location that was great! Right next to flatiron building and Madison square park and close to some subway stations that can get you anywhere in Manhattan.The hotel staff were very nice and helpful though our entire stay, especially Chad Nathan who helped us so much!!The room in the hotel was designed beautifully and had everything! And even though the hotel has a central location there was no noise in the room so sleeping was great!!Thanks for everything we will definitely come back to your hotel every time we visit Manhattan!

Spent a couple of days at this wonderful hotel. The staff was very friendly and went nice and beyond with assisting you with directions, requests, attractions etc. The rooftop has a lounge with spectacular views of the city long with great music! I would stay here again and recommend to anyone if they are traveling in the area!

The Hotel Henri was worthwhile for our short stay in Manhattan. It's location in the Flatiron district was surprisingly perfect for us. It was near many eateries, a park, the subway, and beautiful architecture. The rooms are clean, and modern. The amenities were sufficient for a couple. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I recomment the restaurant Italienne for a superb and expensive meal and the Eataly for a delicious coffee and sweet.

Very stylish rooms - there is not a lot of extra room, but we didn't feel cramped. Wish the lighting in the room included a brighter light for the whole room - though it does set a romantic mood, and there are reading lights where you need them. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants nearby.

I spent 5 nights at this hotel and I recommend it. The staff were very helpful. The room was clean and by NY standards large enough to be comfortable. I will stay there again and I recommend it to others

Renovating the lobby while we were there. Had to go through a maze to get to the elevator. We were able to check in early which was appreciated. Location was very good. Some spots of mold on grout in master bath of the two bedroom unit. Everything else was clean and comfortable.

I booked this through Southwest reservations, while booking the business flight. The process was easy, and had no issues with holding the reservation. The hotel was is a very good location, very clean rooms, and great friendly service.

I only stayed at the hotel for 1 night. The room was a bit small, but I didn't need any additional space, so it was perfect for me. Comfortable to sleep and get ready in. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Location is excellent - close to lots of restaurants and lounges. I would stay here again.

Only about half a mile from the Empire State Building, right across the street from Eataly, and about a block from 5th Avenue. Clean and quiet. Close to subway. I will likely book again the next time I’m in NYC

Good price, helpful staff. Beds are a bit worn ( 2 stays) but comfy enough. Euro style bedding ( no flat sheet just fresh duvet. Lighting is very dark in rooms though stylish. pretty quiet given the elevator is in the center of the 8 rooms per floor. view isn't something to aspire to from any of the rooms so pay extra for it. Area is close to most subway lines and tons of great local food. 14 min to Broadway/ TS and 30 to Brooklyn Eatly, the Italian food market is a great spot to stop for a bite on the go or drinks for the room. Make sure to ask for more towels as the water doesn't stay in the glass shower well nor do the replace used ones on shorter stays, only taking them to laundry.

Very clean, interesting lighting, a little dark but basically a great choice in this genre of hotel..Kind and helpful staff, especially front desk.Great location but not in the center of midtown so a little west side and less touristy...

The room was small recently renovated and very dark. The bathroom was also dark but the shower was great. No view what so ever but the bed was excellent. We used the room to sleep and spent most of the time out on the town.

The location is good, but that’s about all I can say on the positive side. Our room was tiny and dark- barely room to walk around the double (not queen) beds. Small closet and no where to put more than one piece of luggage. Dark walls and inadequate lighting. The pillows were uncomfortable, the shower door didn’t really close tightly, resulting in water all over the floor. The hall was dark and small; lobby dark and small; elevator was small. Any issues with claustrophobia? Definitely, not for you. Thankfully, we had only booked one night.
Newly opened hotel in a convenient location to public transportation, great restaurants, shopping, and sights.

Good hotel in the heart of NYC. Easy to go anywhere. Staff on reception is friendly and professional. Clearence in rooms is poor (like everywhere in the USA). it doesnt matter how many tips you leave for maids. And another negative thing which had happened. We booked this hotel through booking.com and hotel charged us extra 65 USD for "using facilities". It was strange cause we didnt and our booking included everything.

I booked Hotel Henri after a few friends made arrangements there for a birthday weekend. It was an expensive stay for me at over $400/night. While I'm accustomed to NYC's expensive stays, this hotel just didn't measure up to the cost. The location is fine, near the Flatiron building. The lobby is bleak, with half of it dedicated to what looks like a shuttered cafe/restaurant that someone told me is now used as a coworking space during the day. Check-in was fine. The staff were fine. The hallway to my room was filthy and needed a serious vacuuming. The room itself was minimally furnished and had insufficient lighting. I had a view of the offices across the alley. The soaps and shampoo were of poor quality, and there was no body wash. On the day of my departure, I inquired about late checkout and was informed that it would cost me $100 for an extra couple of hours on top of my already exorbitant bill. To make matters worse, my friends informed me they had booked this hotel on Hotels.com for $140/night! I guess at that price I would've been more satisfied with my stay, but don't waste your money on this location. There are tons of options in New York. This place lacks form, function, cleanliness, and is way overpriced (yes, even for NYC).

Front desk associates were exceptional! My family traveled here the end of September for a combo business/leisure trip and all aspects of our trip exceeded expectations. The location was great, staff was friendly and welcoming from check in to check out! Would love to stay here again.

It's really difficult to find a hotel that's as nice/clean as Hotel Henri and has a staff that is actually willing to work with you. A must stay if you're in NYC. Can't beat the price, location, or customer service! We will tell all our future guests to book here!

Clean rooms, friendly staff and now an amazing rooftop bar!. Centrally located to everything Midtown has to offer. I always stay here when I'm in NYC! Perfect for my business trips or traveling with family.

Thought I was going to be staying at a top flight Wyndham Property. Far from it. No room service, no ice or vending machines on any floors. Rooms with small window that looks into an alley?? The staff was very pleasant and helpful, they were the only good thing about this hotel. Oh, and housekeeping doesn't even bother to replace the towels you use. If they take used one's away you have to use whatever you have left unless you ask for more.

The room was clean and the staff were extremely friendly. The bathroom was nice but no bathtub just a shower. Typical for smaller rooms. The bed was a king size and really comfortable. The location was handy as you could walk over a couple blocks and be at the flat iron building and Broadway. Shake shack was right there.

Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for the price range we wanted to pay! Hotel was in a great location close to 3 main subway lines (red, yelllow, orange). Staff on the desk we very friendly when we arrived and they answered any questions throughout our stay!! We were extremely happy when we walked into the room and saw a super king sized bed! One of the main reasons we chose the hotel was because of the room size. It was modern and clean, large tv, safe, the bed was comfy, the shower powerful. We didn't hear much noise from outside either which I'd have expected. Room quite dark, lighting didn't do much but when you opened the blinds then all was perfect! There was also a rooftop bar!! Would highly recommend for couples like us wanting a few days in New York!

The location of the Hotel is great and the front desk staff was very pleasant and accommodating. For those reasons I'd consider staying again. The guest rooms are modern and clean but the decor in the lobby is lackluster and dark. The restaurant affiliated with the hotel has been permanently closed unfortunately. There was complimentary coffee but no creamer any of the three days we stayed (why didnt a bellman run down to the market a block away?). Our room was not cleaned the last day we were there and you had to reinserted the wifi password everyday.

The hotel was in a good location but the room is quite small. Also, expected some sort of view but ended up starring at the building wall. The shower was small as weell,Overall nice stay for a one nighit.

I've been to the Hotel Henri a few times now, and have no real complaints. The room is always clean and at a good temperature, the bathrooms are huge, and the beds are comfortable. They also provide complimentary wifi, which is great.The only tip I have, is that if you're in good shape and have a room on the 5th floor or lower - take the stairs. The waits for the elevators are brutally long. Other than that, the people are always nice - and there are plenty of places to eat, drink, and experience within walking distance.

Hotel Henri was the perfect weekend getaway for my new husband and I! We wanted something easy, affordable and fun for our little mini-moon, and this place fit all the criteria.The rooms are beautiful and cozy, and we even had an amazing view of the stunning NYC. The rooftop bar gives off an intimate feel as we wined and dined on spectacular looking drinks and some light things to eat. The staff was also very informative and was able to provide us with plenty of fun recommendations of activities for the evening, (seems like they really know their city!).Overall, a fantastic trip and we can't wait to go back!
Great location and fun, intimate rooftop bar.Beds are super comfy.I had a few complications with the property which were resolved by the management in a short time.

This NYC hotel is stylish and has a rooftop bar with skyline views and Instagram worthy drinks.Sir Henri has the feel of a speak easy and inspired drinks like the Bee's Knees and Smoked Basil. The bar bites are simple and superb. Overall 5 star service and excellent experience. Can't wait to go back!

Don't stay here on a weekend if you need sleep. I understand NY has a nightlife, but when you have to work early-and all day....this is not the hotel for you. I am sure there are many who will love it- There is a lounge on the 18th floor. The DJ blasts the music until 3am- so loud you can FEEL the base in the bed Two Floors Below. Had to get up at 6:30-- SUCKEDThe rooms are poorly lit, and small, so you are tripping over the furniture. Looks cute, No carpeting in my room... no stains to report, probably makes it louder. No breakfast, only a self serve single coffee pot in the lobby (I NEVER use room coffee pots-EVER)Look at the photos people have posted...that rack of cleaning supplies blocks the hallway- hard to get out of the elevator....I think that is a Fire Hazard (FDNY)2 towels for 2 peopleNo bedspread no fancy pillows

Booked this place for convenience to Madison square park event and provided a great price (for New York City). Arrived early and staff was friendly and accommodating. They remembered and provided the special service that i requested. It was not necessary, but they made it happen. I so appreciated their efforts and kindness. The room was clean, average (again New York City hotel standards) sized, a tiny bit dark. The bathroom was well stocked and the shower worked well. Temperatures were comfortable. Speaking of comfort, the bed was great! Overall, while i generally don't have to stay in nyc hotels, this exceeded my expectations. This is not a luxurious property by any means, but depends what you are looking for when you visit nyc. Other family members stayed in other more expensive properties and were less satisfied. So, for a brief stay, i would recommend this. And, to the owners, i commend all your staff. They were all great.

When I was in the room sleeping an other guest entered the room. They gave the same room to multiple guests. It did not end there. Next the front desk employee entered the room without knocking with the other guests. No knock, no appology, they just walked out explaining they would "figure this out".

LOCATION ISN’T EVERYTHINGOn July 12, 2017 I booked the Hotel Henri on the hotel website for one night (August 19) and received a confirmation for a rate of $236.84 (total). I chose the hotel because it was close to a party we were attending and I trusted the Wyndham name.Parking at a nearby garage and check-in went smoothly. There were, however, a few issues with the room: lack of luggage racks and a light that wouldn’t turn off. I didn’t notice it until it was too late at night to call the front desk, but since it was held together with scotch tape I’m sure it must have been noticed and ignored. Nevertheless, it was a clean room with a comfortable bed. I had asked if anything could be done about a bright red blind on the window and when we returned from the party I was quite impressed to find that it had been replaced with a very nice Venetian blind. “Good service,” I thought. But that’s where the "good" part ended.I read that the hotel restaurant served breakfast. Unfortunately that was not true. In fact the restaurant doesn't serve anything because they are permanently closed. We were directed to either Starbucks or a coffee shop on Sixth Avenue. It was disappointing but tolerable.What wasn’t tolerable is what happened next. After returning home I received an email with the invoice and saw that the hotel had charged my credit card $256.33 instead of the confirmed $236.84 rate. I called the hotel immediately and was transferred to Wyndham Customer Care. The agent I spoke to checked with the hotel and told me the person in charge (the hotel manager?) would contact me the next day. That did not happen. When I contacted the hotel the following day the desk clerk put me on hold and deliberately disconnected me--twice. When I finally spoke to her she shouted something about a facility fee. I told her it was included in the original confirmation and I offered to fax or email my original confirmation, but she didn’t want it; she said the manager would contact me that afternoon. It didn’t happen.Using the email link for the hotel on the original confirmation, I sent an email and it was returned undeliverable. I filled out the feedback form on the hotel website and nobody responded. I called Wyndham Customer Care again the following day and was given a case number and told my complaint would be investigated. I was assured that someone from Customer Care would get back to me. It didn’t happen. I waited a week and called Customer Care again and the agent told me they contacted the hotel and were told that Hotel Henri sent me an updated invoice. Of course, that didn’t happen. I figured I had wasted enough time trying to deal with the regular sources so I wrote to the CEO of the Wyndham hotels and included the documentation. He responded immediately and contacted the CEO of Customer Care who contacted me and put someone in charge of the “case.” She was very helpful. This has never been about the $19.49. I could have disputed the charge through my credit card company, but they would have absorbed the charge. I didn’t want that. The chain would have been willing to refund my money. I didn’t want that either. I wanted the hotel to refund the money and to apologize, especially for the rude and deceitful treatment I received.I never received an apology from the hotel, but ultimately they did refund my money, but not quite correctly. Instead of crediting my account $19.49, they issued a credit of $19.48. I will never know if it was a calculation error or if they wanted to have the last word. The penny is my donation to their much needed hospitality fund. My advice: stay away from this hotel

Stayed overnight with my wife to have a time in Manhattan. The location is a 1/4 mile from Penn Station between 6th and 7th Ave so there are lots of things to see and do in the area and a convenient walk to many restaurants.The rooms are typically sized for Manhattan, which means small. They have done a nice job with the rooms, but a bit dark. The hallways and rooms all have been painted very dark colors which sucks up the light in the room, bad decision but not a deal breaker. If you are staying, it probably for the location rather than the ambience.

I've stayed here a few times for work. I really like that they give you access to a full gym, the staff has been mostly friendly, the restaurant is good - but had to switch to other hotels because the rooms are so dark that they are not very comfortable space and I found myself not sleeping well. Each of the rooms only has 1 tiny window, but the only light in them is one main light by the door, and then they only have edison bulbs - mixed with the fake grey cement tapestry above the bed and red accents it's not a comfortable space. The last time I stayed there the robe in my room was disgustingly dirty, the free water there was half full - and there were girls screaming through the walls.

Very nice hotel. Great Chelsea location. Close to many tourist sites. You can walk to Rockefeller center. The Empire State Building and Central Park. Great shopping is a block away on 5th avenue. Great eateries all around you. Check out the Taco joint across the street. El Presidente. Good food!Rooms are small but clean. I found them a little dimly lit. But acceptable. Friendly front desk staff and hotel staff.

Hotel Henri, in W 24th St is in a great location for Flatiiron District & Chelsea, with good selection of bars & restaurants nearby.The rooms are a good size, some have balconies - when booking ask for a room with a balcony if possible. This is great hotel both for business & holidaying. Reception staff very friendly.

I used my reward points for a couple of nights with my family. The room was small but was comfortable enough for all four of us. Clean place and has a new bar on top. Great location. Better than other Wyndhams in the area.

The hotel was phenomenal! The beds were very comfortable, every day the staff was very friendly and helpful (no matter the time of the day.) The hotel has a rooftop bar that was beautiful and had great special cocktails. We stayed for a week and would definitely be staying next time. I would highly recommend staying at the Henri, great staff, very clean rooms, rooftop bar, and a great location.

A true find in a city with constant movement and chaos - The Hotel Henri offered the Traberts one of the best sleeps we have had during our 30 day, 18 city US tour. After scouring the "Hotels Tonight" app for a nice hotel with average pricing, the Hotel Henri caught our eye amongst a plethora of hip new hotels Manhattan has to offer guests. Conveniently located in the Chelsea area of NY, this well designed and comfortably hospitable boutique hotel also offers guests a relatively inexpesive and conveniently located $40/night Self-Parking option. I know you are thinking $40/night parking . . . ARE YOU CRAZY? But, let me be the first to tell you that this was the best parking price we found amongst all the other offering and a major factor from the app in selecting Hotel Henri. Just be aware that the garage itself is a couple buildings down and is a self-park situation to a certain degree, so don't be afraid when you need to hand your keys over to a garage attendant. THE HOTEL - You never know what you are going to get when booking a hotel from a couple of pictures, but Hotel Henri lived up to all of our expectations. We were greeted by a hospitable team, not overtly welcoming, but did check us in in a very timely manner and provided a bellhop to assist us with luggage to our room. THE ROOM - was well appointed for a Manhattan hotel room, trust that they can be really small sometimes, and perfectly designed to allow guests enough room to move about without crawling over furniture; they even took the time to cover the A/C unit with a grate to hide its unsightly display. Although probably too dark for most people, I found the room decor very inviting and comfortable; especially when you come back from a night of parting in NY and just want a dungeon to crawl into to sleep off the pain from the night. The floors are cleverly designed with wood plank tile allowing for the highly trafficked rooms to be well maintained, yet offer a relaxing welcoming appearance. THE BED - Let me just say it . . . BRAVO to a hotel that gets it! This was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on with sturdy and nicely sized pillows. THE BATHROOM - adequately sized with enough room to maneuver and very clean. There was no mold or hairs in the shower, which is a nice reprieve from the norm of most hotels. AMENITIES - although we did not eat at the restaurant, the menu appeared very appetizing and ambiance chicly designed. The continental breakfast was a nice added touch that other hotels do not offer, but basic in its offering. MY CRITICS - the bathroom could use a bit more lighting for application of makeup for the ladies. Although the continental breakfast was thoughtful, there could be some healthier options instead of all sweats and carbs. The mini-bar was packed full of for sale product, which does not allow guests to stock with their own items. All the snack and amenity offerings on the "one" shelf in the room need to be removed to allow guests somewhere to place their items instead of the floor. The black carpet in the hallways showed every speck of dust, piece of lint and trash tracked in from the streets of NY, so they were constantly in need of a vacuuming - need to rethink that design element. The ice machines are not conveniently located and require guests to trek all the way upstairs or basement to get ice. All in all, it was a lovely stay and we would definitely return on our next visit to NY as the Hotel Henri is a TRABERT TOP PICK!

This hotel was very disappointing. We returned to our hotel after seeing a late show. Our room was warm and the air conditioning control unit could not be adjusted. The hotel employee said that we would probably need to move to another room. Since it was almost midnight, we decided not to move all of our things and hope the room would cool down over the night.This did not happen and in fact the room was so noisy that we thought there had been a hailstorm outside. In the morning we realized all the noise had been the air conditioner as it never rained.  After the morning water from the shower leaked all over the floor, we met a hotel employee in the hall. We related our concerns about the room to her. She was very sympathetic and said we should tell the front desk and they would probably compensate us in some way. We did tell the front desk, but they could only offer us an " I"m sorry".  The room is very small and dark with no place to put your luggage. You must put it on the floor against the wall and hope you don't trip on it. Our cousins were on the 5th floor. This photo is of the garment that stayed in the hallway near them.Staff came to clean the rooms with their cart parked close by but no one chose to remove it. It was still there when we left. I was very embarrassed at my cousins discomfort as I was the person who booked the hotel.  I chose this hotel because it was in the Wyndham chain. It does not begin to meet the comfort of other Wyndham hotels.

Quaint hotel in a good location. The rooms are OK although there are several issues - having requested a quiet room I received a street facing room which was noisy. The room decor is modern with an unneeded mini bar and very little room to store clothes, no luggage rack and decent bathroom. The floor was sticky, the corridor filthy and on one of the days the bedroom wasn't cleaned until after 4:30pm which is unacceptable. To our disappointment, after the first day where morning coffee and pastries were served in the lobby, this was stopped without any notice, pity as this was one of the positives of the place.

There is no customer service at this hotel. No overview of hotel and what you can expect. You need to know what to ask for to be told anything eg maps not offered, you need to ask, breakfast , you need to ask and if you get there after 8.45am don't expect any, area to lounge as very limited seating in tiny reception, upstairs bar but only open after 5. Room cleaning - day 5 and floor still not swept or moped, sheets not changed and forget about getting your bed made -,let's just pull the doona up. Oh and have another guest just arrive in your room was a bit of a surprise - something about a glitch in the system that had the room empty wtf. Extremely disappointed. Even a cheap motel in the outback has better customer service and house keeping. Wonder if hotel management are lackadaisical due to their relationship with Wyndham - ready made guests.

First, the good. The beds were really comfortable, the wifi worked, and the location was great. Second, the bad. The toilet never fully flushed after multiple flushes. The lobby was more an alcove and had no air-conditioning. Finally, the ok. The breakfast was like what you would get when someone from your office went to a pastry shop. In comparison, to Kimpton boutique hotels I've stayed at, Hotel Henri was a major disappointment.

Yes! They've gotten luggage racks! This is a good-natured staff who try hard to please guests. My first room had some problems, including recalcitrant A/C and the front of that single, teensy-weensy drawer falling off. They moved me quickly and without any argument. I have also figured out the problem with the consistent complaints about the hall carpeting looking like it's never vacuumed. They do indeed sweep those floors - I saw them once, and heard them the next day. Looked near-perfect right afterwards, but a few hours later, the white specks were back, obviously tracked in from somewhere. I also left something in my room after I checked out. When I called a couple of hours later, they located it, and held it for me at the front desk. Thanks, guys!

Currently staying here for 17 nights as a Wyndham Rewards Diamond member. Checked in 5 days ago, albeit extremely late at night, and the only info we were supplied with was the wifi code. Have since found out, and only by seeing it one morning, that a continental breakfast is available, on a first come/ first served basis, nothing is replenished! Today we also asked if maps were available and were given some, but you obviously have to ask, they are not offered. The room is small, and rather dark, there is nowhere to either place or store your cases. The hanging space in the wardrobe is barely adequate and there are no drawers. We are 2 female friends, here for 17 nights, so you don't feel you can really unpack and 'settle in'. on the plus side, the beds are extremely comfortable, the air conditioning is good and there is a small bar fridge, which we are using after arranging for hotel staff to empty it. We went out today at 8.45am, returning at 3.30 to have a rest before going out again tonight. Our room had not been done, at 4pm housekeeping arrived so we just asked for clean towels as we were trying to rest. At 4.45, a woman entered our room, I thought it was housekeeping returning but no, it was a guest who was just checking in and had been given our room number and card!!! What the??? I am still waiting for a phone call from reception to apologise. We have not been informed, however I have read a review on trip advisor that a daily ammenities fee is charged, really??? What for? There are none!! There is no swimming pool, no lounge to sit in, there are 4 small chairs in the lobby where you are expected to sit and eat breakfast. The 'rooftop lounge' (really the top floor) is really a bar that opens at 5pm, with loudish music, not really somewhere you can sit and relax for a bit.

I stayed 2 nights free with my Wyndham Rewards. Very nice staff. Recently updated and Hipster ready. Good breakfast. Comfy beds. They even gave a baffle of sorts in front of the A/C unit so the person sleeping near it doesn't get blasted with cold air all night. Small rooms, yes, but it's NYC so get used to it. They have a deal at the garage next door if you have a car. 40 bucks a day instead of 50+. Located near the Flatiron Bldg. and Madison Square Park (not Garden). Great Taiwanese Fusion restaurant next door.

The hotel charged me a fee after I checked out, on a card left for incidentals. No intimation of the charge before check in or during check out. I saw my statement and called the hotel who said it's a resort fee/ facility fee, she wasn't even sure of what it's called. Absolutely sneaky charge. Unacceptable.Rooms are nice,clean, bigger than many nyc hotel rooms. Dimly lit though. Was noisy because of some work on the roof 24/7. I guess that's why it was cheaper than most hotels on those dates. Very average.

The rooms are small but very chic, however the personnel was really unfriendly, I asked for a city map and wanted to ask for advice, but she was extremely uninterested and I felt I disturbed her. The room keys are very vulnerable and we needed to get new cards every day, even though we kept them from getting de-magnefied

Nice cozy hotel in Flatiron area, located at 24th St between 5th and 6th.Close to Eatery, Madison Square Park, Flatiron Building, Trader Joes and CVS. Good bagels and coffee for breakfast from Murray's Bagel at the lobby. Free :)Has a small refrigerator.

We just stayed one night. We had a small modern room. Generally all was fine. There was just a noise from an ongoing construction close to the hotel. Which we found pretty disturbing as they started quite early in the morning.

My wife & I stayed at the Wyndham for 3 nights when I was booked to speak in lower Manhattan, since the hotel has an arrangement with my hosts. We were awakened each night at 2:35 A.M. by raucous young men in the next door room (ours was 1205; theirs, 1206. Loud and boisterous, evidently when a local bar had closed. The young men, we learned, when we complained, were booked 4 to the room. The disturbance did impact the quality of my work affected our stay badly.

Fabiola helped me at the front desk and was very helpful and professional. She brightened up my day after a long trip to NYC and took the time to walk me through the amenities and notes about my room. Thank you for your wonderful service Fabiola!I really really like the room as well as it's very clean and modern looking. Pedro downstairs was very helpful as well. I'll definitely be coming back and highly recommend.

I was hesitant after some of the reviews using one of my free nights here due to the supposed shower leaking, the poor lighting, and the loud noises from the street; however none of those were concerns for me here. The shower had the plastic trim on the outside to ensure that there was no water that leaked through, the lighting was satisfactory enough in the bathroom where my wife had no issue applying make up, and we were in room 407 and there were no noises at all. They allowed us to check our bags in advance at no charge and they were extremely courteous. The room was spotless and perfect for a weekend stay in size. In conclusion, I would absolutely recommend this hotel for a weekend stay, however it would not be good for a longer stay due to size. Absolute amazing experience.

Wyndham Rewards Platinum member. Room was modern and remodeled albeit small. Housekeeping came at 9am and 10am, despite knowing I was checking out that date--and the check-out time is not until noon. Extra resort fee in disguise for a non-resort. Was promised a call back from manager--never happened.

Our family stayed in 2 rooms for 7 nights and were very happy with the choice. It is clean and the rooms are updated, and although they are on the small size they are well designed to be space efficient and user friendly. No lobby and no bells and whistles, but a good, clean place to stay. Note to the "bell man" who watched us struggle to get 6 bags out of a taxi and find a luggage cart.... you miss out on tips if you don't offer to help guests.

We spent two nights here and it was fine. We got a pretty good price on the roo. So that helped. Rooms are pretty small, but that is typical for the city. Both my husband and I found the humidity level to be a little high in the room even though the a/c was set at 68. Bathroom was a nice size but the shower stall would pretty tight for a bigger person. Not sure if all the rooms have stalls so maybe check if you need a tub instead.The staff was very nice. They let us keep our bags there after we checked out, until we were ready to leave the city. We forgot to remove our "do not disturb" sign the first morning, and housekeeping came to check on us at night to see if we needed new towels. Valet parking would have been a plus.

Rooms themselves were clean. Staff pleasant enough. Hallways though needed a thorough vacuuming - even after they were vacuumed!!! Bottled water not in room and none available through the front desk! Would give it another try...

Overall really liked this place including the fact that there are a bunch of excellent and diverse restaurants within a block. The rooms were new and clean and everything was well appointed. Four complaints: I don't appreciate the "resort fee" they use to make the nightly rate look lower. When we called just minutes away to ask where to park they should have told us that to get on the block we would have to talk our way through a police barrier due to Pride Parade. They have a problem with the design of their showers that causes them to leak out onto the floor and should have warned us of that and given extra towels to sop up the water. When we called we sometimes just got a buzzing sound instead of an answered call and had to keep calling back to get a person on the line.

My girlfriend and I decided to stay here for a weekend getaway. The hotel had so much energy with the lobby bar. The rooms were recently renovated and were quite impressive. The girl at the front desk pointed us in the right direction for a few great nights out. This will be the place we stay when we are back again.

I was in NYC for 3 days and stayed at Hotel Henri for 2 nights. It was a great overall experience. The front desk was very friendly and accommodating with early check in. They led me in the right direction to great restaurants and cafés. The room was very clean and newly renovated. Very comfortable bed and a minibar that had a lot of different options. I would definetly stay here again the next time I am in NYC

This Hotel is a gem. Very lovely and amazing decor, great size rooms with great service.This is my very first review on TripAdvisor. I signed up for TripAdvisor because of this hotel. The staff is very attentive the rooms are clean and neat. I was here for 4 days and I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Recently refurbished, looks great, but you can tell the designer never travels. As great as the room looks, ( it photographs well I'm sure). the room does not have a drawer to put your clothes in. The closet has a shelf but it is not sufficient. Worse yet it does not even have a luggage rack for your suitcase in it.....call to the front desk for one and the answer is "Sorry, the hotel does not have any". The bathroom is new, the sink is smaller than your suitcase, the shelf above it is less than adequate to hold makeup and the other necessities. The breakfast is plain and simple on Saturday morning, Sunday is only the leftovers and would you believe that Monday is a few pieces of rye bread and a toaster. At least the coffee was very good. The staff is very helpful with the limited resources that they have. The Shay and Ivy restaurant has a great location out front, but over priced......

This was my second time at Hotel Henri and I will definitely stay here again. This hotel is one of my favorites in NYC. Design of the rooms is very theatrical for sure, super clean, ultra comfy beds and front desk was very helpful. The hotel was so much fun, POP UP YOGA class Saturday morning on the patio. Randomly the Fat Jewish guy dropped in. so cool! Then great brunch at Shay & Ivy restaurant downstairs. The lobby and restaurant are connected so can grab a drink at the bar before check in to the hotel. And they tell me there is a super secret "speakeasy" penthouse opening on top of the hotel opening next month. I cant wait to check that out. Location is perfect. Sunday, I walked to Eataly and Madison Square Park. So close! My thanks to the staff and see you guys in 2 weeks

This entire hotel was just redone and it was outstanding. Super stylish, comfy new beds and very friendly and accommodating staff. I like intimate hotels that are convenient to great dining and nice neighborhoods and Henri was a perfect choice. We are in their restaurant which has a nice outside deck for people watching. The said they have Penthouse lounge opening next month too. It's right across the street from Eataly! I' ll definitely stay again.

Stayed here and found it really great. One of the boutique hotels. Clean and very comfortable beds. Friendly and attentive staff. Amazing location with good access to 3 subway lines. Perfect for being getting both uptown and downtown!

Stayed here with 2 other guests during a 10-day trip to New York.Fabulous location - surrounded by restaurants (including a Michelin-starred restaurant mere steps away from the hotel, as well as an Eataly!) and multiple subway stations. There is also a bar downstairs which was quite lively over the weekend. The Flatiron building is literally at the end of the street, and the Empire State Building is less than 1km away. The room was compact but not cramped. There were 2 large beds, and we could still manouvre around comfortably with 3 medium-large luggages. The bathroom was a good size too, although there tended to be water pooling by the shower after each use.Great air-conditioning too which was much appreciated after a long day in the NYC summer weather. Rooms were relatively well insulated from sound from neighbouring rooms although street sounds like trucks and cars honking were not always avoidable.Friendly reception staff (always made a point to greet you and farewell/ welcome you back) and great housekeeping staff too. Free wifi included - no troubles with connecting devices or slow speeds. Would definitely recommend this hotel to couples / friends who are looking for well-priced and centrally-located accommodation in NYC.

Room was soooo small. Not 1 drawer in room to put away clothes. No place to put luggage. Lived out of suitcase and had to fold it up each night, find a place to put it so we could walk in room. Housekeeping terrible. After 2 days couldn't even get the empty tissue box replaced or the trash emptied. Checked out after 2 nights and went to another hotel that was so much better. Will not return to this hotel.

The room is quite trendy in decor,but small. Do not get a street facing room, though. It was so noisy,that I checked to see if the window was open. The other two issues are things I think can be fixed,and I wonder why it hasn't happened. The shower is really nice but has a space at the door that allows water to run out onto the bathroom floor and create a significant puddle,which is rather dangerous if you don't notice it, and pretty likely to cause a lawsuit someday. Then, there is no luggage rack in the closet or anywhere. Since there is no other furnishings in the room with the exception of a small round wood rattan seat desk chair, that means the only place to put your suitcase is on the floor. Opening and rearranging my things had me having to sit on the floor. (I did not want to put my dirty metal wheeled suitcase on the bed.)I dealt with those things and moved my room location to the back, so I ended up enjoying my stay. The young staff were all very helpful and nice.

Very, very small room with no special comforts. The place was dirty to boot. There seemed to be some unfinished construction going on but nobody did anything to clean up the mess. Can't charge anything at the bar because it is not affiliated. Staff was very friendly but this was not a comfortable place to stay at all and I would never go back. I'd also add that W24th Street is a total mess as well. The location is great - steps away from Madison Square Park and Eataly - but that's about it. At the least, the owners should drastically reduce the rates during construction.

I want to start with one minor negative thing before moving on to the many positive things. I was here for one separate night and then a 2-night stay in late April. When I was checking out I learned that my 2-night rate came with free breakfast, but no one had mentioned that when I checked in. It was too late for me to use it when I was checking out. So not a big deal, but I could have used those two free breakfasts so I wish someone had told me when I checked in (albeit at a busy time).But the stay itself was very pleasant. The rooms are newly remodeled in a contemporary style with an artsy, New York edge, so they look great. As I knew from previous visits the staff are always very friendly and helpful. I really like the Chelsea location because it's easy to get to so many other parts of Manhattan from there, whether by walking or the several subway lines which are close to the hotel. I will definitely stay there again.

We got a decent price and this was just a short walk to my brother and sister in law's apartment in Chelsea.Pros:LocationVery comfy bed (KING! That's rare in NYC)Relatively isolated from city noiseEveryone was friendlyStaff held our bags on checkout day until our late flightNever waited on elevatorsQuick check inDecent sized room for NYCBed made daily, fresh towels dailyCons:Shower doors leaked all over the bathroom floor no matter what we triedHorrible iron in the room- basically useless Extremely dark in room and bathroom (hard to see to put on makeup or shave as you can only see one side of your face)Walls are paper thin-heard people next door having sex at 5 am like they were in the room, heard doors slamming loudly...woke us up more than onceBlack carpet in halls always looked dirty even after being vacuumedWalking around barefooted in the room left me with all kinds of dirt on my feet... floor wasn't very cleanOverall we would stay again if the price was right, but only if it was just my husband and me. Not a good place for kids. The renovation looked alright but someone stole the Edison bulbs on the 17th floor out by the elevators making it even more dark. It was a clean and safe place overall. The bed was so comfy. Too bad the moaning from next door and slamming doors woke us up because I would have had the best sleep if not for those thin walls.

GREAT location...However, very small and dark room with ill-designed shower room that water overflows on the bathroom floor.-Yes location - If you are looking for a hotel that is close to most attractions in Manhattan, this hotel would be a good choice. -NO room space - If you are looking for a big hotel room or if you are looking for a hotel room for family staying, this hotel might not be the choice. Personally, I would not choose this hotel (Henri Hotel) again. This was my second time sightseeing in NYC. The hotel I stayed last time might not have such great location (not bad though), the room rate was cheaper with a bigger room and way better shower system. Location: Great location. The Flatiron building on 23rd St is just “at the corner”, only half block away from subway stations. It is very easy and handy to get to any places in midtown and downtown Manhattan. HOWEVER…Room: This was a family trip. I traveled with my parents. The room we stayed was soooooooooo small for three adults. In addition, the room is very dark and dusty. There was no place to sit. We had to sit on beds all the time. This reminds me hotel rooms in Hong Kong. I am sure there are bigger rooms in this hotel. I booked the hotel room through Expedia for three adults. I was wondering how come the hotel did not take this information into consideration and give us a bigger room. Even in Hong Kong, a small hotel room would have a bathtub. But not this one. The bathroom was terrible. Firstly, it is tiny. It is lucky that neither of us was big. Then the shower room drain was clogged for the first two nights and I had to ask for a mechanic to unclogged the drain. What’s worse was that the shower room is ill-designed that water overflew on the bathroom floor even after the drain was unclogged. That made the bathroom floor watery. It was NOT pleasant. Shouldn’t the hotel staff or mechanics check such thing regularly to make sure things are working? Lobby: hmm… I am not sure if that is a lobby. So tiny, not much space for people to sit or stand. The restaurant next to it takes most space. OMG! No! Housekeeping: Housekeeping service is not consistent. I left the same amount of tips every day. Perhaps not enough, eh? I guess the hotel has different housekeeping staff each day for each floor. I saw different faces throughout my entire staying. Sometimes, the beds were made and the bathroom was cleaned with new towels. Sometimes, only the beds were made, the bathroom was slightly cleaned with no new towels. Sometimes, the beds were made and the bathroom was kinda cleaned and used towels were taken away with no new towels. I was like: “okay. Should I leave more tips (apparently not with such inconsistency) or just forget it? What is the service consistency?” Cleanness: Overall, it is a clean hotel though there was not much housekeeping consistency. I especially enjoyed the fragrance of the bed sheets. This was very nice. Front desk staff: They are very friendly and helpful.

I got here via a Hotwire purchase. My comments will mirror many of the others on here.The location is perfect. Between 2 major subway stations, close by shopping and restaurants. Convenient to everything in NYC. However, who ever designed this hotel must not have ever traveled. There is no where for your luggage. I put my suitcase on the floor. There is very little surface space for things like computers and books. They pay attention to things like the snacks and the mini bar, but not to the lighting. It drove me nuts that the lighting was so bad in the room. There is only a teeny shelve in the bathroom for all your "stuff" and the bathroom lighting is horrible!! I was so afraid I would be putting on too much make up bc I couldn't see.On the other hand the bed was amazingly comfortable!! And the room I had was very quiet. No street noise. And there are tons of electrical outlets. I also have to ding the hotel because they cleaning staff removed the holder for the coffee pod on the in room coffeemaker so that the next morning I couldn't make coffee. I was bummed bc I had purchased some cream from a local shop to have a yummy cup of joe in the am. I reported the issue to the front desk, but the pod holder was never replaced. ARGH.The ice maker is on the lower level. I never ventured down.So there you have it... ditto to earlier reviews.

This was by far the WORST hotel experience I have ever had in my life. The sheer level on incompetence of the front desk in unbelievable. I actually am still awe struck at the stupidity level I dealt with. At check in my card was charged for the cost of the 2 night stay. At check out they claimed they didn't charge my card and INSISTED on swiping my debit card again, despite the fact that I physically showed them the charge in my bank account. They said the first charge was just a hold and that money would be refunded in 5-7 business days. Well guess what, it wasn't. So after spending an hour of my life (that by the way, I'll never get back) on the phone with bank of america the issue was resolved. So unless you enjoy being scammed and paying for a mediocre hotel room twice, stay somewhere else. Its not worth the aggravation of dealing with a front desk clerk who is lazy and incompetent, a manager who can barely answer your questions or a day spent on the phone with your bank trying to reverse the damage done. I believe there is a holiday inn just down the street that I'm sure is comparable in price and star rating.

We checked some of the recent negative reviews just before checking in, so were approaching the hotel with a degree of trepidation, but our experience has been wonderful, pretty much flawless from start to finish!Stayed here for 7 nights in May 2017, and popped in around 11am to drop our bags off for the day, not expecting to be able to check in as it was quite early. However, Fabiola at the front desk checked to see if anything was ready, and we managed to get a room on the 15th floor overlooking 24th street and the skyline... awesome, after a 24 hour flight from Sydney!Room itself has a comfy King size bed with nice linen, and is decently equipped with good air con, flat screen TV and fridge. Best of all, the room is actually pretty big (for NYC) with room to hang clothes and store 4 big suitcases without feeling too cramped.Throughout our stay the entire team were friendly and helpful, with things like printing tickets for us etc no problem at all. Hotel is pretty funky and modern, and there's a nice looking bar / cafe on the ground floor, and the fabulous Eataly just round the corner.Would definitely stay here if we return to New York.

Spent 5 nights during my stay in NY. The city of NY is expensive when it comes to hotels so I was actually quite happy concerning the price - especially since the location of the hotel is just perfect. Walking distance to all that NY has to offer in a quiet street. The room was actually more than big enough but facing back of the hotel is was very very dark...no sunlight. The room had quite recently been renovated/redecorated and was OK but the cleaning of dust was not too good when I checked. Nothing critical but there was layer of dusts when I took a closer look.

Today I woke up at 7:30 am to find out that my room didn't have any water. The front desk offered to give me a key to another on a different floor if I came down to the lobby. Being decafinated and in my PJs I didn't want to do this. I asked if they would let me use the $5 bottle of spring water in my room for free. The answer was no you can't do that well have to charge you. You can give us your ice bucket and well fill that with water. Not knowing the cleansliness of the ice bucket and having to go down to the lobby I was not game. Also there was no notice that this would be the state of affairs. We did get a note letting us know that the water would be off yesterday from 10 am - 5 pm.Also the walls are paper thin. You can hear everything from the neighbors having sex to the clanging of the elevator so bring ear plugs! That said my room was spacious and the bed was clean and comfy. Great location.That said I wouldn't stay here again.

We booked a king room but requested an upgrade to one of their very few balcony rooms. I called 3x time confirm this upgrade and finally received an emailed confirmation that we had this room. Upon arrival we were told they didnt have any balcony rooms available... end of discussion. There was nothing they could do even though i had it in writing. Frustrating start. It was 4:00 and our room still wasnt ready so they sent us over to the bar with 2 complimentary drink tickets. We were told these tickets were only good for beer and wine (but only their chardonny and a red). Hmmmm, so not anything? That was odd. The bartender was rude as well. He seemed very put out by having us there - there were only 3 other people there but whatever. The room we had was on the 17th floor. It was fine by NY size standards but the finishes were not nice. The faucet to the shower was falling off so you could see a hole through the tile. The fan was hanging off of the ceiling and the lighting was poor. Seems like the rushed the rehab. The good: - friendly staff (even though we were denied our upgrade we were confirmed for)- great location- high floor room was very quietThe bad:- bar staff- finishes (including hallway and elevator)- room was not ready at 4:00 (check in is 3:00)For the price i would say its fine. I feel like we paid for a nice location and just dealt with the bad. Wouldnt come back though and would not recommend.

The only real thing this hotel has going for them is the location in Chelsea. The front desk was very nice and was kind enough to store our bags and give me a call when my room was ready. There is by no room in the lobby to relax and wait for your room.There are many cons about the recent remodel in the bedrooms. For example the is no drawers to store your clothes, no place to put your luggage except on the floor because there no luggage rack. There is a large selection of snacks and alcohol for sale in a refrigerator. The fact that the refrigerator is only for sale items you can not use it for your own food or drinks is a major con. There really is no need to have any sale items with all the nearby stores and bars.The common area carpets always looked dirty. It seem that there was only one elevator that worked. The website stated that breakfast was included but the front desk didn't inform me of the details. Then when I went to the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast and I felt very unwanted. First the host asked me for my voucher, so I asked the front desk and went back the restaurant. The breakfast was much to be desired. There were not plates I used my napkin, only a few coffee mugs. A couple of juice crafts and some danishes. Out of my four night stay I only tried the breakfast once.The best thing that this boutique hotel has going for them is the location, it's in Chelsea close to Madison Square, Park and the Shake shack and close to good restaurants and bars.

Hotel was wonderful. Clean and comfortable. Would stay there again. Would recommend it to anyone who asks for a suggestion of where to stay. It was a little tricky to find because the name outside said Henri and we were looking for Wyndham (we were unaware at first it is one and the same).
